loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children and is the sole income provider for his family. He has been running a bakery since 1995. Throughout Lebanon it is common to find small bakeries with delicious bread, pastries, and “manouche”, a type of Lebanese pizza. The borrower is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in a new machine for mixing dough. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new dough mixing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year old married man from Lebanon. He has been running a tile polishing business since 2007. This type of work is common throughout Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children, and his wife also works (in a sewing factory) to support the household. He is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in a new tile polishing machine. This will be his second Kiva loan. He was a consistent client with on-time repayments for his last loan of $1,200. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for to sell. 

In December 2006, Beverly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Beverly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four children. She has owned a bakery for three years and has more than 15 years of experience in the field. She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., which she plans to use to invest in a new dough making machine and an oven. She expects to improve her business with this loan and estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 5%. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new dough making machine and an oven.

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario B., from the town of Sta. Josefa, is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Cesario has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over three years.

In 2007, Cesario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan from CEVI, he is now requesting a new loan, his eighth, of 15000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He also plans to acquire piglets that he can raise. Cesario will use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sam-Im

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-im E., aged 29, and his wife, Mrs. Chhean Tum, aged 27, live in a small village along National Road Number Three, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have a young daughter.
Sam-im has been a construction worker for ten years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for one year. He is requesting a loan of $300 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five children. He is the sole income provider for his household. He has been working as a car mechanic for 30 years. He has owned his own shop since 1979.
He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to purchase new machines for his business. These may include a car scanner and a special device to check a car’s carbon dioxide level. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by five per cent.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase new machines, such as a car scanner and a device to check a car’s carbon dioxide level

loans.name: Sinang

texts.en:
Mr. Sinang C., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sreypov Chhoy, 32, live along National Road Number Six, about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are still young.
Sinang has been a truck driver for two years. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is in the process of building a new house, but he lacks some money to finish it. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to finish his house building.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish his house building

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Lhagvajav D., 42, lives with her husband in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband has recently returned from working in Korea. Lhagvajav operates a tailoring business. She is a professional in her business, having earned a certificate in sewing in Russia in 1987. Lhagvajav has been operating her business since 1992, and has gained significant experience over the last 18 years. She has a good personality and great communication skills. Lhagvajav is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old and has two children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over ten years.
Flordeliza joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Kimseng

texts.en: Mr. Kimseng H. and his wife, Mrs. Sam-at Um, married in 1993 and have two daughters, both of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Kimseng was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is shown instead. Kimseng has been a rice farmer since 1993. His wife sells snacks in a primary school in the village. Besides farming, he also has been in full-time employment producing bay sey in Phnom Penh. (Bay sey is a section of banana tree trunk with legs to which 3, 5, 7, or 9 layers of banana leaves rolled up in finger shapes have been attached. This is decorated with flowers and used in certain ceremonies.) Kimseng has obtained loans from Maxima several times already including a Kiva loan. Now he is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 23-year-old businessman who sells electronics such as DVD players, television sets, mobile phones, cameras and other electronic products. He has been in this business for three years and employs two people. He terms his business environment as conducive and has a wide range of customers.

The father to one two-year-old child, Benson is hardworking and visionary and desires to establish himself fully in business.

Benson wishes to add to his stock of electronics and thus he has requested for a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya. This loan is guaranteed by his group.

loans.use: To add to his stock of electronic goods

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
32-year-old Gina F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has three infant children.

Gina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years now.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is thankful that she doesn't have to borrow money from individuals who charge high interest rates.

Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her seventh loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and child and is the sole income provider for his family. He has been selling different types of Arabic sweets for the past six years. He buys the sweets from Tripoli, which is famous for its delicious desserts such as “baklawa”. He sells the sweets from his car. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to purchase more sweets to sell. This will be his first loan from Ameen. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more Arabic sweets to sell

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn S., is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Chhun (pictured together), is 48 years old, have been married since 1984 and have five children. Unfortunately, one of them died. One married and lives outside the family home, one is a security guard and other two attend school. They live along National Road Number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sorn is a motor taxi driver. When he is free, he also clamp up pump trees to collect palm juice. His wife stays at home and does house work. He is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for his son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work

loans.name: Holganat

texts.en:
Holganat S., 50, lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent).

Holganat operates a clothing and consumer goods trading business. She sells a variety of clothing and consumer goods from a rented counter at the Tirlik market including thread, scarves, needles, and buttons. She pays 10,000 MNT per month in rent.

Holganat has been operating her business since 2000, and she has gained valuable experience over the past ten years. Every two to three months she purchases about 2,000,000 MNT worth of inventory to resell. With her business profits, she has purchased a car.

Holganat has been planning to expand her business and selection of goods in the future. She operates her business at an outdoor counter that is very cold in the winter and very hot in the summer. However, she is a very hardworking person trying hard to provide a better life for her family. She says, “I would like to create my own shop and be able to afford to pay the education fees of my children.”

Holganat is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing and other goods in Taikeshken, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D., 40 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Helen is involved in rice farming. She says that proper financing is one of the factors in having an abundant harvest. She is happy that she and her husband work hand-in-hand in order to provide for their family.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is happy that the MFI (micro-finance institute) was able to reach her town.

Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her seventh from CEVI.

Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year old single man from Lebanon who lives with his parents and four siblings. Three of his siblings and one parent also work to support the household. He has been running his own plumbing business since 2005 and has more than ten years of experience in the field. He works independently and takes on projects in private homes and businesses. He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in materials for his projects. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. This will be his second Kiva loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 25%. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To invest in materials for his plumbing business

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Mr. Visal H. is 45 and his wife, Mrs. Nary Chin, is 40. They have been married since 1990 and have three children: two daughters who attend school and one son who is a construction worker.

Mr. Visal H. has been driving a motor taxi for twelve years and his wife has been a garment factory worker for four years. Besides his construction work, Visal’s son wants to supplement his income with a new business driving a motor taxi. He will be able to earn extra income.

Hence, Visal is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for his son to launch the new business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive as motor taxi

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en: Herlita B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and has seven school-aged children. Herlita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years now. Herlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Herlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mr. Sophal R. and his wife, Mrs. Ravy Phork, pictured together, have been married since 1999 and live in a small village along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have both been farming for more than 10 years, and now, in order to supplement their income, Sophal hopes to start another business selling cows. He is therefore requesting his second loan in the amount of $500 to help establish this new enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase cow for resale.

loans.name: Kerimbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Литературные произведения и множество современных фильмов описывают жизни простых людей, как они ценой неимоверных усилий и трудов достигают большого успеха в жизни и претворяют свои мечты в жизнь. Но одно произведение, не смотря на то каким бы большим оно ни было, или художественный фильм, не смотря на то, каким бы многосерийным ни был, не смогут передать со всей точностью все подробности их повседневной жизни. Они лишь могут передать отдельные моменты и дать общее представление о жизни своих героев. Герои нашей истории вполне заслуживают быть героями таких книг или фильмов, ведь они каждый день трудятся ради своих семей и пытаются обеспечить им хорошую жизнь. 

Илязова Керимбубу – лидер группы. Некоторое время назад Керимбубу постигло несчастье; она потеряла мужа. Но это её не сломало, а наоборот дало ей дополнительные силы, ведь она – мать четверых детей. Сейчас все её четверо детей уже женились и живут отдельно. Сама Керимбубу предпочла не зависеть от детей и на данный момент занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции. На своём земельном участке, она выращивает пшеницу и картошку. Осенью от продажи урожая она получает весь её годовой доход. Керимбубу занимается земледелием уже четыре года и набралась немалого опыту. Тогда она начинала с пяти тысяч сомов. Сейчас Керимбубу за год зарабатывает до тридцати тысяч сомов. Керимбубу нужен кредит, чтобы купить солярки для полевых работ. 

Партнёры Керимбубу по группе:

Ибаевой Анаркан пятьдесят семь. Анаркан с мужем вырастили семерых детей. Муж Анаркан сейчас на пенсии, но он и Анаркан вместе с детьми занимаются выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Годовой доход Анаркан и её мужа – около пятидесяти тысяч сомов. Анаркан обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить ГСМ и семян пшеницы. 
Чороевой Гульнаре сорок пять. Муж Гульнары – тракторист. Гульнара – мать пяти дочерей. Гульнара и её муж сейчас готовят поле для посева; будут сеять пшеницу. Прошлой осенью они собрали шесть тонн пшеницы. Гульнара нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить семян картошки. 

Елтуйбасовой Кулуйпе пятьдесят восемь. Кулуйпа – вдова, и мать шестерых детей. Кулуйпа вместе с детьми занимаются земледелием; выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Кулуйпа обратилась за кредитом, так как ей нужны средства для закупки семян клевера. Кулуйпа надеется получить хороший урожай, и от продажи урожая она планирует купить скот и женить сына. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Literary creations and numerous contemporary movies describe lives of simple people, how they achieve big successes in life at the cost of unbelievable efforts and labor and turn their dreams into reality. However, not one book, no matter how big it could be and not a movie, no matter how many episodes it could contain, can show all of the nuances of people’s daily lives. These creations can only show single moments and offer an overall understanding about the lives of our heroes. The heroes of our story deserve to be heroes of these books or movies because they labor every day for their families and try to provide them with good lives. Kerimbubu I. is the leader of this group. Some time ago, she lost her husband. However, this did not break her and, on the contrary, gave her additional strength because she is a mother of four children. Now, all of the four children are married and live separately. Kerimbubu preferred not to be dependent on her children and is currently involved in growing agricultural crops. She grows wheat and potatoes on her land plot. In the autumn, she sells the harvest and receives her yearly income. Kerimbubu has been involved in farming for four years and gained quite a bit of experience. Originally, she started with five thousand som and now earns up to thirty thousand som per year. Currently, Kerimbubu needs a loan in order to buy diesel fuel for field work. Kerimbubu’s group partners are: Anarkan Ibaeva is fifty-seven years old. She and her husband raised seven children. Her husband is currently retired, but he, Anarkan and their children are involved in growing agricultural products. Their yearly income is about fifty thousand som. Anarkan requested this loan in order to buy fuel and wheat seeds. Gulnara C. is forty-five years old. Her husband is a tractor driver. Gulnara is a mother of five daughters. Currently, Gulnara and her husband are preparing the field for sowing. They will be planting wheat. Their last autumn harvest was six thousand ton of wheat. Gulnara needs a loan in order to buy potato seeds. Kuluypa E. is fifty-eight years old. She is a widow and a mother of six children. Together with her children, Kuluypa is involved in farming, specifically growing agricultural products. She requested this loan because she currently needs means to purchase clover seeds. Kuluypa hopes to get a good harvest and plans to use profits from the sale of the harvest to buy livestock and marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel for field work

loans.name: Gachbai

texts.en:
Gachbai M., 51, is married and the father of eight children. He and his family live together in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Six of his children attend local secondary and primary schools.
Gachbai operates a horseshoe manufacturing business. He went into business as an iron goods maker in 1991, and since that time has been operating his business successfully. Currently, he is able to make 20 horseshoes per day. In addition, he operates a taxi service and a vegetable planting business. Gachbai has his own plot of land in Buyant soum, where his wife plants vegetables. He and his wife sell the vegetables during the autumn. Gachbai has a cow as well, and sells milk to earn extra income. He is able to sell 20 liters of milk per day. He is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills. Gachbai is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy and plant more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy and plant more vegetables

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun P., 38, and her husband Mr. Troeng Chea, 40, (pictured together) have been married since 1992. They have five children, four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Soeun and her husband have been selling chicken and fish for twelve years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy neighboring land to expand their property.

loans.use: To buy neighboring land to expand their property.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 39 years old. Jaime is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Jaime owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over 4 years.

Jaime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jaime has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jaime from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. His wife works as a nurse to help support the household. He has over 25 years of experience in furniture upholstery and has owned his store since 1990. His brother also works with him and pays him a percentage for every piece that he works on. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., which he plans to use to buy new material for his upholstery business. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy new material for his upholstery business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and child. All three household members are working. She has been running a “mini-market” for 22 years. These markets are found in every neighborhood and village in Lebanon. Her husband owns a shop for toys and gifts. She notes that, although she has been working very hard, her profits are still not as high as she would like. She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, which she plans to use to increase her store’s inventory. This will be her first loan from Ameen. The loan officer notes that she has an excellent reputation in her community. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Moza

texts.en: Moza is a 34 year old business lady. She owns a beauty shop in Nairobi where she sells beauty products. She sells her products to salon owners and beauticians and employs one person. Moza has been running this business for two years and terms it competitive. She also earns more income from a salon she owns in town. Before Moza began this business, she was selling mobile phones accessories. She is requesting her first loan of KES30,000 to purchase additional stock such as hair extensions, weaves etc. Moza is single, hardworking and trustworthy and she hopes to have a self-run salon. She also would like to have a family in five years. Since joining Faulu Kenya Ltd, Moza says that she has learnt business strategies and how to save.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four children. One of her children and her husband also work to support the household. Her husband works as a blacksmith. 

She has been working in the sewing industry for almost 20 years. She has run her sewing business from her home since 1991. She lives in an area that is famous for its hand-made clothes and jewelry. She uses the profits from her business to support her family, including paying for her children’s school fees.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. She plans to use the loan to buy material for her business. 

Women still make up a small percentage of the labor market in Lebanon. A 2008 report by the International Finance Corporation notes that women make up about 29 percent of the country’s labor force. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering microloans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy material for her sewing business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Jaime owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops which primarily consists of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over nine years now.

Jaime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaime has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jaime is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to grow. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jaime from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and seedlings to grow

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Исмаилова Айнура – лидер этой группы. Для Айнуры каждый будний день начинается с того, что она рано утром, доет своих коров и сдаёт молоко на продажу. Вот уже пятнадцать лет Айнура за счёт молока, зарабатывает около пяти тысяч сомов в месяц. Для Айнуры, у которой трое детей, это конечно же очень малые деньги, и поэтому все эти годы Айнура старалась искать себе дополнительный источник заработков. А именно, она помимо коров, держит ещё кое – какую живность: несколько овец и бычков. По мере необходимости, Айнура может выводить скотину на базар, продавать её и использовать деньги на повседневные или срочные нужды. У Айнуры сейчас ребёнок дошкольного возраста, и ей вскоре придётся увеличить расходы, и Айнура прекрасно это осознаёт. Поэтому она вместе с мужем, который имел издавна опыт в земледелии , решила параллельно заниматься выращиванием сельскохозяйственной продукции. Айнура приняла очень важное решение, так как последующее развитие дел показало значимость диверсификации источников заработка. Айнуре и её мужу удалось увеличить поголовье скота, отремонтировать дом и значительно улучшить свои жилищные условия. К тому же Айнура смело идёт на дело, зная, что всегда найдёт нужную поддержку со стороны мужа, который активно ей помогает по хозяйству и всегда рядом. Сейчас Айнура нуждается в кредите, чтобы вложить средства для обработки земли. 

Партнёры Айнуры по группе: 

Макишевой Айнуре тридцать восемь. Она замужем и у неё пятеро детей. Старшему сыну девятнадцать, а самому младшему сыну всего полтора года. Айнура держит скот и продаёт молоко, а её муж работает таксистом. Айнура с мужем с недавних пор занимаются также и выращиванием сельхоз продукции и теперь им нужен кредит, чтобы провести обработку земли.

Жоомартовой Динаре двадцать девять. Динара – мать троих детей. Муж Динары – работник правоохранительных органов. Сама же Динара предоставляет услуги парикмахера. Недавно Динара с мужем начали грандиозную постройку сарая. Сейчас им необходимо закупить стройматериалы, однако заработков Динары и её мужа не хватает. Они очень надеются на этот кредит. 

Абакирову Жолочу сорок четыре года. Он – отец пятерых детей. Для того, чтобы кормить семью он занимается перепродажей и откормом овец. Его жена работает на вино – водочном заводе. Трое детей школьного и дошкольного возраста, и поэтому Жолочу решил параллельно заниматься земледелием. Он надеется получить этот кредит для сельскохозяйственных работ. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: tillage (cultivation)

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 37 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Janet owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops in which she primarily plants and harvests rice for sale. She hopes for her farm to expand in the future.

Janet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Janet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Janet from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees and provide for the increasing needs in her household.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées toutes dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, mariage et d’activités  dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème   prêt solidaire.
Madame Assétou Keïta, qui est un des membres, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 500 kg de pomme de terre et 10 sacs d’igname. Elle se ravitaille en ces tubercules à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou à crédit ou au comptant à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Assétou Keïta compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 56 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvestir dans l’activité et épauler leurs maris dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The women in the Tièssiri group are all married in monogamous families with a median age of 39 and five children. They all live in the Hamdallaye quarter of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbors, marriage, and working at the Chateau market of Segou. With the intention of increasing their commercial funds and diversifying the products they sell, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh group loan. Mrs. Assétou K., who is one of the members, counts on using the loan to buy 500 kg of potatoes and 10 bags of yams. She stocks up on tubers in Koutiala and sells from home, at the Chateau market, and moving throughout the quarters of Ségou. Sales are done in cash and credit to a mixed clientele. Following the example of the other group members, Mrs. Assétou K. counts on making a monthly, median profit of 56,000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and help her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tubers (potatoes and yams)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has been working in the jewelry industry for over 20 years. He specializes in polishing jewelry. He lives in an area that is famous for its hand-made jewelry. His wife also works to support the family. 

He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in a new machine for his polishing business. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new machine for his jewelry polishing business

loans.name: Jehly

texts.en:
41-year-old Jehly B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is is married and has two children, her eldest being only twelve years old.

Jehly owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in her business for over nine years already.

Jehly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI.

Jehly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the needs of her household and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and young crops to raise

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda est composé d’une veuve et de quatre femmes mariées dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et d’activités commerciales  dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres de ce groupe font l’achat et la vente des  produits alimentaires.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 kg de banane plantain, avec les paysans producteurs de Koutiala au bord du goudron RN6 en face de la grande mosquée de Ségou. La revente se fait à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou généralement au comptant à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Oumou C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle ambitionne entretenir cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Faida Group are comprised of a widow and 4 women of monogamous marriages, with an average age of 32 years and with 3 children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Segou (the 4th administrative region of Mali). They are connected through ties marriage, neighbors and common business activities at the Chateau market in Sagou . The members of the group buy and resell basic products. In order to increase their operating funds, the group members decided to join the loan program at Soso Yiriwaso for their first group loan. Mrs. Oumou C. plans to use her loan to buy 100 kg of banana plantain from the producing farmers, along route RN6 , near the great mosque of Koutiala in Segou. She will resell her produce from her home, at the Chateua market, and by hawking through the neighborhoods of Segou, usually for cash and to a wide range of clientele. Mrs Ournou C. plans to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA which will be used as capital to reinvest in her business. Like the rest of the group, she finds that working with the Soro Yiriwaso group allows her to increase her operating capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of bananas

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives in Kherson, southern Ukraine, with her daughter and a disabled son. She sells women’s outer clothing in one of the local markets called Dneprovskyi. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Valentina has been in this trade for fifteen years and has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about 30,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her net income is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Valentina would like to borrow 14,700 UAH to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and to keep her business running successfully this summer season. She believes that the loan will assist her in her entrepreneurial endeavors and help her to succeed.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two children, her eldest child being only aged seven. Joan owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years already. Joan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan's Group

texts.en: It is a general tradition that when young people get married, they imagine their lives as consisting only of joys, feasts and parties. However, the cruel reality strikes people with severity and ruthlessness and many people face these obstacles without due preparedness and lose themselves. Yet there are people, who do not take everything in such a fatal way, but seek solutions and use all their imagination and gather all their ideas and energy to come up with sound and practical solutions. The heroes of our story are of this kind. I. Zhyldyzkan is the leader of this group. She trades in foodstuffs and other kinds of consumer goods and her spot is located near the school and therefore her trade goes pretty well. She has been doing this job for a year and her monthly income now has reached $180. However, her initial capital amounted to $2,200, and now she is working hard to return her money. Zhyldyzkan has a caring husband who always helps her buy the goods and transport them. Her husband has his own job: he is a private builder. Now, Zhyldkyzkan is thirty-eight and has a daughter. She hopes to obtain this loan and invest it in her business. Zhyldyzkan’s partners are: Z. Baktygul, 40, who is a widow. She has three children: two sons and a daughter. To provide for the whole family she is engaged in cattle breeding, doing all the work herself. She hopes to obtain this loan and buy some sheep. A. Talant, 38, who has three children. He is occupied with raising cattle and his wife actively helps him to look after them. Now, he needs a loan to buy some sheep. B. Shirin, 36, who is a widow. She has two children and she keeps cattle in the shed at her house and trades in them. She has acquired a great deal of experience in this business though it is not quite a woman’s job. She needs a loan as an investment in her business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and other consumer goods for her store

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame Madina Dougouné  est âgée de 65 ans, veuve elle vit avec sa coépouse et  ses 8 enfants dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elle fréquenta la medersa  et l’abandonna en classe de 6ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier par la volonté de ses parents. 
Elle mena plusieurs activités commerciales telles que la vente d’habits et de fruits et légumes  bien avant de venir à la vente de calebasses qu’elle fait depuis 21 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle à Ségou et à Bamako. 
Ses calebasses une fois achetées sur le marché sont soigneusement lavées et emballés donnant une bonne vu et envie de les acheter. 
Pour pérenniser son activité elle fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis  bientôt deux ans. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés.
 Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 3 rouleaux de  calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne sur place au grand marché de Ségou auprès des grossistes et producteurs. 
 Madame Madina Dougouné vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. 
Elle reçoit beaucoup  de commandes venant  de Bamako et envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui lui permettra de consolider son fonds de commerce et d’aider son premier garçon dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation propre.
texts.en:
Madame Madina Dougouné is a 65-year old widow who lives with her 8 children and a co-wife of her late husband in the Darsalam de Ségou region of Mali. She attended a Madrasa, but her parents required her to quit during her 6th year of school for an arranged marriage. In the past, Mme. Dougouné has had a variety of commercial enterprises, including selling fruits and vegetables. For the last 21 years, she has specialized in selling gourds, for which she is well-known and has a good clientele in Ségou and Bamako. After purchasing the gourds at the market, she carefully washes and wraps them, making them very attractive to buyers. Mme. Dougouné sells her gourds retail for cash and credit. Her clients are mostly women. To finance her business, Mme. Dougouné has borrowed from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years. All of her previous loans were repaid. She plans to use the new loan to purchase 3 rolls of gourds from wholesalers and producers in the market at Ségou. She receives many orders from Bamako, and expects to realize a monthly benefit of 100,000 CFA which will permit her to build her operating capital and help her oldest son with the family expenses. Her goal is to purchase a parcel of land for her own residence.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gourds for resale

loans.name: Jonjib

texts.en: 28-year-old Jonjib P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has no children yet but plans to have one hopefully soon. Jonjib owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years now. In 2007, Jonjib joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jonjib is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his seventh from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

He has been working in the jewelry industry for over ten years and has owned a diamond setting shop since 2008. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to buy gold jewelry pieces to which he will then add diamonds. This will be his first loan from Ameen. loans.use: To buy gold jewelry pieces to which he will then add diamonds

loans.name: Bèbikoun Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Bèbikoun sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants.  Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché de Bagadadji. 
Elles font le commerce de riz, de haricot, de pagnes wax, de bois de chauffe etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata D. qui est la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du haricot. Elle a une grande réputation à Bagadadji pour sa vente de haricot de bonne qualité d’où son pseudonyme sho-Ami (haricot Ami). 
Elle se ravitaille dans les villages environnants de Ségou (Zogofina, Sirakoro et Togo), et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Bagadadji, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame  Aminata D. espère avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments et savon. 
Elle a pour ambition de devenir grossiste dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso / Kiva.
texts.en:
The members of the Bèbikon group are all married and living in monogamous families. They are on the average 31 years old and have two children. They all live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (the fourt administrative district of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, relatives, or as vendors working at the Bagadadji market. They sell rice, beans, wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], heating wood etc. With the goal of increasing their business capital and diversify their merchandise, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso credit program; they are now on their third group loan. Mrs. Aminata D., who is the leader of the group, plans to use her loan to purchase beans. She is well-known in Bagadadji as she sells high-quality beans, and is nicknamed “sho-Ami” [“Ami the bean lady”]. She purchases her stock in the villages close to Ségou (in Zogofina, Sirakoro and Togo) and sells for cash and in credit, from home and at the Bagadadji market, to a customer base composed of both women and men. Mrs. Aminata D. hopes to achieve a monthly income of 38,000 West African Francs, which will be used for savings and for taking care of various needs of her family, such as buying condiments and soap. Her goal is to become a wholesaler thanks to this partnership with Soro Yriwaso/Kiva.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beans [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married woman from Lebanon who lives with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a house painter to help support the family. She has been running a clothing boutique since 2007. She pays the “new rent” price for her store, which can be expensive for new entrepreneurs. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. She plans to use the loan to increase her store’s inventory. She estimates that the loan will help increase her profits by 5%. This will be her first loan from Ameen. Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financiA. services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent dans le camp de garde de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues dans le camp à travers des relations de service (leurs maris sont des gardes), de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou C. veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 400kg d’échalote en gros à Niono avec les producteurs. Elle revend à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000FCFA qui sera utilisé à l’instar des autres membres du groupe pour  épargner et réinvestir dans leurs activités génératrices de revenus afin de devenir grossistes dans ce qu’elles vendent.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group are all married and living in monogamous families. Their average age is 32 and they have, on average, 4 children. They live in the watchstanders' camp in Ségou (4the administrative region of Mali) and they met each other in the camp because all their husbands are watchstanders, but also through being neighbors. They also all work at income-generating activities at the big open-air market of Ségou. Wishing to grow their working capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. Mrs. Djenebou C. wants to use her loan to buy 400 kg of shallots wholesale at Niono from the farmers. She resells them out of her home and at the big open-air market of Ségou, for cash or credit to a clientele composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA which will be used, following the example of the other members of the group, to put aside savings to reinvest in their income-generating activities so as to become wholesalers of the goods they sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shallots wholesale

loans.name: Jonna Mae

texts.en: Jonna Mae L. P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 24 years old, is married, and has a 3-year-old child. Jonna Mae owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years now. Jonna Mae joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jonna Mae is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to start up a sari-sari store. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de 4 femmes dont trois mariées dans des familles monogames et une célibataire. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et habitent le camp de garde de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues dans le camp à travers des relations de service (leurs maris sont des gardes), de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou B. est très sollicitée dans le camp de garde pour sa préparation et vente d’encens de qualité. 
Elle veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ingrédients pour la préparation de l’encens (eau de Cologne, parfums, magnonkissèni et n’gueni) au grand marché de Ségou. 
Pour préparer de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni ou n’gueni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant une semaine au moins, ensuite on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. L’encens ainsi fait est reparti dans des bouteilles pour la vente en détail. 
Elle revend à domicile et en ambulant généralement à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000FCFA qui sera utilisé à l’instar des autres membres du groupe pour  épargner et réinvestir dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu afin de satisfaire la clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
texts.en:
This Danaya group is made up of four women, of whom three are married and living in monogamous families and one is single. They have an average age of 31, on average 3 children, and live in the watchstanders' camp in Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They met in the camp because their husbands are watchstanders, in their neighborhoods, and in their income-generating activities in the big open-air market of Ségou. Wishing to grow their working capital, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. Mrs. Kadiatou B. is much sought after in the watchstanders' camp because of the excellent quality incense she makes and sells. She wants to use her loan to buy ingredients for making incense (cologne, perfumes, and special local ingredients) in the big open-air market of Ségou. To make the incense, she soaks "magnonkissèni" or "n’gueni" in cologne for at least a week, then various perfumes are added. The incense is divided into bottles to be sold retail. She sells out of her home and also, generally on credit, when walking through the neighborhoods, to a clientele composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA which will be used, following the example of the other members of the group, to put aside as savings and reinvest in their income-generating activities so as to satisfy their ever growing clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making incense

loans.name: Sylviane

texts.fr:
Né vers le 27/08/1981 à San,  Sylviane K. n’as pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle s’intéressa donc très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle est mariée et mère  d’un enfant. Elle vit chez époux dans le quartier Dabani de la préfecture de San.  
Sylviane fait la vente de cartes de recharge téléphoniques, de téléphones portables et accessoires il y a plus de 3 ans.
Sylviane est très sollicitée et pour satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Sylviane K. compte acheter, 50.000FCFA de cartes de crédits de 1000 FCFA, 75.000 de cartes de crédits de 2000FCFA, 100.000FCFA pour acheter des  téléphones portables et 25.000FCFA pour les accessoires (chargeurs, pochettes etc.)  
Elle revend à San ville et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
Sylviane espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus.
Il ambitionne agrandir  sa boutique et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour qu’elle puisse améliorer davantage sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born on August 27, 1981 in San, Sylviane K. was not lucK. enough to shine in school, so she became interested early on in earning money. She is married and the mother of one child. She lives in her husband's home in the Dabani district of the prefecture of San. Sylviane has been selling telephone charge cards, mobile phones, and accessories for more than three years. She is much sought after and in order to satisfy her clientele, she decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. Sylviane K. intends to buy 50,000 F CFA worth of charge cards of 1000 F CFA each, invest 75,000 F CFA in charge cards worth 2000 F CFA each, put 100,000 F CFA into buying mobile phones, and 25,000 F CFA into buying accessories (chargers, cases, etc.) She sells her goods in the town of San and at the weekly markets to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to repay the loan, pay school fees for her child, buy food, and reinvest any remainder in other businesses. She intends to expand her shop and thus increase her sales so that she can further improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying phone credit cards, mobile telephones, and accessories

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children and runs a small business selling children’s toys. She started this business ten years ago using advice form her friends who were in a similar business. Today she's got two business locations and has a desire to develop her business further.

At the moment there is growing demand for summer toys. Ludmila would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase more summer inventory. This business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase summer inventory for her toy store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose C. is a 55-year-old married man from the town of Sta. Josefa. He has six school-aged children. Jose owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years now. Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jose is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for his tractor. This loan will be his seventh from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income and pay for his children's school fees. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old businessman who makes a living running a food kiosk in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and has one employee. Before he began this business, he was an employee at an independent company. He has applied for a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy 10 bales of unga wa mahindi (or maize flour), 10 bales of unga ngano (wheat flour) and five cartons of soap. Samuel has four children, and hopes to expand his small company into a wholesale operation and then a supermarket. He says that Faulu Kenya Ltd is helping make this possible and has raised his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy new supplies of flour and soap to sell to his customers

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Badeya est constitué de  huit  femmes mariées, qui vivent dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans  et  4 enfants. Elles habitent à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir exercer des activités génératrices de revenus. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers tels que les fruits à l’images de Djelika Samaké, les chaussures,  le tasses, les vêtements et les boissons.
Djélika Samaké compte acheter avec son prêt, 25 paniers de fruits (banane plantain).
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  Sikasso auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au  marché  Sanoubougou I et  à l’intérieur du quartier à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Badeya group is made up of eight married women who live in monogamous families and who average 32 years of age with four children each. They live in Sanoubougou I, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with which they aim to be able to exercise their revenue-generating activities. This group of women buy and sell a variety of items such as fruits (as is the case for Djelika Samaké), shoes, cups, clothes and drinks. Djelika Samaké is planning to buy 25 baskets of fruit (plantain bananas) with her loan. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at Sikasso's large market and sells them at the market in Sanoubougou I and within her neighborhood to a customer base made up of women and men, for cash and often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18,000FCFA of which part will be used to cover everyday expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married, has a five-year-old child and makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice.

Julie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid seven previous loans from CEVI and is applying for an eighth, for 12,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer for his farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Benkelema (4femmes mariées et une célibataire)  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne  3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires tels que les condiments alimentaires avec Afou Berthé, les céréales, l’atieké et de la restauration.
Afou Berthé  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 colis de condiments alimentaires au grand marché et les villages avoisinants. Les condiments sont vendus au  marché  Sikasso et en famille, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkelema group (four married women and a single one) are on average 40 years old and have an average of three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) This is their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women sells foodstuffs such as condiments. Afou Berthé sells cereals, atieké [a cassava based food] and does catering. Afou Berthé is planning on using her loan to buy 5 packages of condiments from the large market and from the villages in the vicinity. The condiments are sold by the family at the Sikasso market to a customer base of women and men, for cash and often on credit. She is planning to make a monthly profit of 19 500 Francs CFA. One part will be used for the family’s expenses and the other will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia D. C. lives in the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 48 years old, married, has four school-aged children, and makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice. 

In 2007, Lilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from CEVI and is now applying for a new loan, her eighth, for 14,000 PHP to buy fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her farm to pay her children's tuition and provide for the increasing needs in her household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
All four of this loan group are determined to work hard to succeed in life, because they believe that success must be earned.
