Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités d’articles  de boutique à revendre aux clients ; ce qui lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice pour faire ses épargnes et accroitre son business. Elle a l’espoir de devenir une riche commerçante capable de faire le commerce d’import et être à mesure d’acheter sa propre maison et sa propre voiture et que ses enfants finiront les études avec succès et mener une vie meilleure. Elle a toujours préfère le crédit Turame aux autres institutions financières car le taux d’interet est le plus bas.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Faida  »
texts.en:
Cécile-Elide N., 32, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Kinama in the Town Hall neighborhood of Bujumbura. She has a shop where she sells various products--foodstuffs, cosmetics, and other small articles. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She attended secondary school and got a diploma A2 in business management. Her husband, Kennedy N., is a driver. She is on her second Turame loan. Cécile-Elide has four children, a son and three daughters, but she is also raising three other children who are close relatives. She is requesting the Kiva loan to buy larger quantities of items she sells to her customers. This will allow her to earn more profit so that she can put aside savings and grow her business. She hopes to become a wealthy merchant, able to import goods, to buy her own house and her own car. She also hopes that her children will finish school successfully and lead a more comfortable life. She has always preferred Turame loans over those of other financial institutions because the interest rate is lower. Cécile-Elide is a member of the community group called « Faida ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bigger quantities of the articles she sells to her customers

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité LA ALEGRIA se formó hace más de dos años mediante la gestión varias señoras y sigue unido mediante el apoyo de todas las integrantes que se encuentran  trabajando cada una realizando sus actividades.
Cada una de las señoras se encuentra con mucha esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida (Vivienda,  alimentación) mediante el trabajo que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Avelina quien es peluquera, y trabaja desde su casa en un salón. Ella estudio esta profesión siendo joven y actualmente ya cuenta con muchas clientas. 
Ella esta muy conforme con su trabajo ya que mediante el puede mantener a su familia, alimentar especialmente.
Actualmente quiere mejorar su servicio y para ello desea comprar un sillón mas confortable para peluquería ya el mismo se usa para el lavado y otros mantenimientos para cabello.
Solicita el préstamo para concretar dicha idea y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The Alegria (Happiness) group was formed more than two years ago by several women. They joined together to support one another. They met while working at their various jobs. Each group member is hopeful about improving the quality of her life especially in the areas of housing and nutrition. One of them is Sra. Avelina who is a hairdresser. She runs a salon in her home. As a young woman, she took a hairdressing course and now has many clients. She is very happy with what she does since it allows her to support her family and most importantly, provide them with food. Avelina now wants to improve the service she offers by buying a more comfortable hairdresser’s chair which can be used for hair washing and other hair treatments. She is asking for a loan to buy such a chair. She is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a hairdresser's chair

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en:
Domingos F. C. was born in Bilene, Gaza province, Mozambique. Bilene is a popular beach resort in the southern part of the country. Domingos is 47 years old and studied until 11th grade. He had to stop in order to start working, but he plans to attend secondary school for adults in the future. He is married and has four children (three boys and one girl); he also supports his wife's three step-children (two boys and one girl) and one niece. The youngest child is three years old and the eldest is 21. They all go to school.

Domingos left Bilene for Maputo at the age of 19 to live with his cousin. The situation did not last long, as he got soon called to the military. He has served in the military ever since, as a controller in the school of artillery. He has a permanent job from 7h to 15.30h.

He is asking for a loan to buy cement, zinc sheets and other materials to improve the family home. He plans to pay for it with his regular salary. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, which he got to know through a work colleague. His previous loan was for the same purpose as this one. He dreams of being able to finish his house, buy a vehicle one day and have a house outside the city to provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc sheets and other materials to improve the family home

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andres tiene 35 años. Esta casado con Georgina Larrea y tiene tres hijos menores de edad.
El se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos pequeños, ademas de calzados deportivos, termos forrados, prendas de vestir , juegos de sabanas y otros.  Trabaja en este negocio desde el año 2005.
El necesita de este crédito para adquirir edredones, estufas, secarropas y otros pedidos que recibe para esta nueva temporada que inicia.
Don Andres realiza sus ventas y cobranza en una motocicleta. En el futuro desea comprar un vehículo tipo camioneta para poder realizar sus tareas con mayor seguridad y ampliar su clientela, de esta forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos y brindar mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
35-year old Sr. Andres is married to Georgina Larrea and has three young children. He buys and sells small appliances, as well as sport shoes, thermos flasks, clothing, bedding etc. He has been doing this since 2005. Andres needs this loan to buy comforters, heaters, clothes driers etc. to complete the orders from his customers for the upcoming cold season. Andres travels by motorbike to make his sales and collect payments. In the future he would like to buy a small truck for these tasks as it would provide greater safety and allow him to expand his customer base. He would then earn more money and provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, small electric appliances

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora  Bernarda  se dedica a vender  productos de mercería y librería , esta actividad lo realiza caminando por los alrededores del barrio donde vive ,  sale todas las mañanas bien temprano a comprar y luego  repartir de acuerdo a los pedidos  , tiene  buena clientela  formada ya que a esto se dedica hace 15 años y gracias a este trabajo logro mantener siempre a sus cuatro hijos hoy en día todos mayores de edad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas, hilos, cuaderno, lapices, telas y otros artículos para su mercerías.
En el futuro desea mucho ampliar su negocio y para ello debe  comprar un vehículo para repartir sus mercaderías,  pero cree que con el esfuerzo y el trabajo logrará concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Señora Bernarda sells sewing supplies and school supplies in the streets of her neighbourhood. She leaves the house very early every morning to make her purchases and then deliver them to the customers who have made the orders. She has a good customer base as she’s been doing this work for fifteen years. With the money she earns, Bernada has always managed to support her four children who are now grown up. She is asking for a loan to buy bedding, thread, notebooks, pencils, fabric etc. In the future she would very much like to expand her business, and in order to do that, she would have to buy a vehicle to make deliveries. Bernada believes that with hard work and effort, she will manage to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, notebooks, pencils etc

loans.name: I Will Do My Best Group

texts.en:
Hawa B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called I Will Do My Best. She is 20 years old, married, and has a 5-year-old child. She also cares for two siblings. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For four years, Hawa has been selling lappas (traditional clothing) on a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She serves her customers in a nice manner, which keeps them returning. But she faces problems with insufficient funds to operate her business.

Hawa started selling from profits generated from a friend’s business when helping her friend to sell. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lappas for sale. Her goal is to build a bigger shop that can sustain her family in the future.

Hawa describes herself as a good Liberian business woman selling in the Redlight market.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more lappas (traditional clothing) for resale

loans.name: La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
Paulina H. M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal La Bendición que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Villa Tejada, tiene 24 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente vive en la zona Idustrial.
 
Con el apoyo de sus padres hace poco ha iniciado el negocio de venta de productos naturales y vende en puesto adquirido recientemente en la avenida Jorge Carrasco y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: venta de café, ropa, confección de ropa, y atención de cafetería. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Asociación Comunal La Bendición” that is part of the larger “Villa Tejada.” She is 24 years old and is a neighbor of the city of El Alto; specifically, she lives in the industrial zone. With the help of her parents, she recently started a business selling organic products on the Jorge Carrasco Avenue, from a rented location. She needs this loan in order to buy more merchandise. The other members of this association have other businesses, such as coffee sales, clothing sales and manufacturing, and cafeterias. They all need this loan in order to buy merchandise, ingredients, and supplies for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr: Ndiémé D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a bénéficié de 04 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un commerce de vêtements pour hommes et pour dames et vend aussi des tissus non confectionnés. Elle vend sa marchandise dans une cantine au marché central de Louga. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer son approvisionnement, réaliser plus de bénéfices afin de pouvoir mieux répondre aux besoins de sa progéniture et prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndiémé D. is 53 years old, a widow and the mother of six dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since March 29, 2008 and already had four loans, all of which she reimbursed without difficulty. Her business is selling clothing for men and women as well as fabrics for sewing. She sells her wares in a cafeteria a the central market of Louga. With her credit, she would like to enlarge her stock and increase her income in order to be able to better provide for her children and take care of her personal expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing men's and women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Camen  tiene 48 años, tiene dos hijos uno mayor de edad. 
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos cárnicos, los distribuye a varios negocios de su barrio y también está empezando a realizar sus ventas en algunas ciudades  del interior. Se inició en esta actividad en el año 2006. 
Su vivienda está ubicada en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de una buena cantidad de planchas de carne, para cubrir sus pedidos en nuevos negocios y carnicerías en el interior del país.
El anhelo de Doña Carmen es poder construir un amplio salón para montar allí su propia carnicería- distribuidora y de esta forma no tener que salir mucho de su hogar y estar mas tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 48, has two children, one of whom is an adult. She is a meat merchant. She sells to various businesses in her neighborhood and is starting to sell in some of the cities in the interior of the country; she started her business in 2006. Her home is located in the city of San Lorenzo. She will use the funds to buy a good quantity of slabs of meat to fill the pending orders she has in stores and butcher shops in the interior of the country. Carmen’s dream is to set up a spacious shop where she can install her large-scale butcher shop/meat distributorship so that she no longer has to leave home so much and can spend more time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy slabs of meat.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is divorced and lives with her parents. She runs a small business selling food items at a kiosk, located near the railway station in Beregovo town. Mariana has been in this business for 13 years. There is very low competition and high demand, which makes this business a success. Mariana's monthly income is 5,000 UAH. 

Mariana would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tacko Mbenda

texts.fr: Tacko Mbenda F. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'une fille. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a reçu 04 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels de l'oignon, des biscuits, du thé, du sucre, de la boisson en canette etc.. son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Son objectif est de d'assurer la prise en charge de sa fille, d'équiper sa maison et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Tacko Mbenda F., 46, is a single mother of one daughter. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since March 28, 2008 and has received four consecutive loans. She has a shop where she sells various items such as onions, biscuits, tea, sugar, canned drinks, etc. Her new loan will allow her to bolster the inventory of her shop. Her goal is to support her daughter, outfit her house, and pay her personal expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little commercial enterprise

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
David Z. was born in the Chibabava district in the Sofala province in Mozambique, close to the Zambeze river. He studied till 7th grade of the colonial system and had to stop because of lack of financial means. He is single and has four children. The youngest is 4 and the eldest is 26, a girl, who is in the picture with David's contruction. We are showing a picture of his eldest daughter, who will also benefit from the loan because he was not available when we visited the property to take the picture.

He spent all his childhood in Sofala and then moved to Maputo when he got a job for the government. He lived on his own for a period and then with his children and nephew in a rented home. He now works as a driver from 7h to 15h30. He has done this job for the last 5 years. He makes around 4870 meticais per month with his job and he is able to save around 600 of it. 

He is asking for a loan to pay for construction material to build his own house. He currently lives in a house he rents. With the money from the loan he will buy cement, bars and window frames for his construction. His eldest daughter is posing for us next to their soon to be finished home.

His dream in life is to see his house finished. He has been a client of Hluvuku, our field partner before, and hopes that with your help he will be able to see it happen.
texts.en:
David Z. was born in the Chibabava district in the Sofala province in Mozambique, close to the Zambeze river. He studied till 7th grade of the colonial system and had to stop because of lack of financial means. He is single and has four children. The youngest is 4 and the eldest is 26, a girl, who is in the picture with David's contruction. We are showing a picture of his eldest daughter, who will also benefit from the loan because he was not available when we visited the property to take the picture. He spent all his childhood in Sofala and then moved to Maputo when he got a job for the government. He lived on his own for a period and then with his children and nephew in a rented home. He now works as a driver from 7h to 15h30. He has done this job for the last 5 years. He makes around 4870 meticais per month with his job and he is able to save around 600 of it. He is asking for a loan to pay for construction material to build his own house. He currently lives in a house he rents. With the money from the loan he will buy cement, bars and window frames for his construction. His eldest daughter is posing for us next to their soon to be finished home. His dream in life is to see his house finished. He has been a client of Hluvuku, our field partner before, and hopes that with your help he will be able to see it happen.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, bars, window frames

loans.name: Ciro Gabriel

texts.es:
El Sr. Ciro Gabriel tiene 30 años y esta viviendo en pareja  con  Irma Vera desde el año  pasado y no tiene aun hijos.
El Sr. Ciro desde el año pasado se dedica a la  actividad de  Compra y Venta de Ropas y todo tipos de Calzados para Damas, Caballeros y Niños, esta actividad empezaron juntos  vendiendo primeramente  a sus Familiares  pero viendo que tenían buena venta están recorriendo los barrios de la Ciudad donde viven.
Con este crédito piesan llegar a mas clientes ya que desinaran el dinero en la compra de abrigos, calzados, botas, busos y otros con esto ademas podrán  ampliar sus zonas  de trabajo , el  Sr. Ciro esta viviendo en un local donde también  esta como encargado  de una Aguateria , su  proyecto a largo plazo es la de comprar  un terreno y construir  para su casa propia y también tener un Local en el mismo donde exponer las  Ropas y Mercerías que tiene en venta.
texts.en:
Ciro Gabriel, 30, has been living with his partner, Irma Vera, for the past year; he has no children yet. For a year now Ciro has been a clothing and footwear merchant; he stocks items for women, men and children. They started this business together selling first to their relatives but, seeing that sales were good, they are now going around various neighborhoods in their city of residence. They plan to reach more customers with this financing because they will use the money to buy coats, footwear, boots, sweatshirts, etc. This will also make it possible for them to extend their sales territory. Ciro lives in a place where he is also in charge of a bottled water supply service. His long-term project is to buy a lot and build his own home as well as to have a space where he can display the clothing and merchandise he has for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coats, sweatshirts, shoes, boots, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria trabaja como comerciante de prendas de vestir, ella compra mercadería al por mayor de Desaguadero (es la frontera con el Perú) y reparte a sus proveedoras quienes lo comercializan en los mercados de La Paz; así es como ella logra sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la  zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (ropa) la cual le servirá para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
 
Es sexto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria is a clothing merchant; she buys clothes at wholesale in Desaguadero (on the border with Perú) and distributes to her suppliers who sell in La Paz’s markets. This is how she earns income to support her family. Her home is located in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy merchandise (clothes) which will increase her working capital. This is her 6th loan with Impro; her good repayment history qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more food items, such as rice, oil and seasonings, for resale

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.en:
Mauricio J. S. was born in Inhambane, in Southern Mozambique, and he is 49 years old. He studied secondary school and is now in the process of finishing the last part of a university degree. He is separated and has two daughters who live with him and attend elementary school. He also supports his parents, who live in his native Inhambane, by sending money regularly.

He lived in Inhambane until he got called to the military in Maputo. He emigrated on his own as he did not have any children. Later he met his ex-wife and had children with her, but he and his wife separated two years ago. He has been in the military for more than ten years. He makes a monthly salary of about 15,000 meticais. He is generally able to save about 3,500 per month.

This is his first loan with Kiva, which he is requesting to purchase cement, bars and other construction materials for the on going construction in his home. His dream in life is to be able to complete his house and provide his daughters with a suitable home.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bars and other construction materials for construction in his home

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. Her children have grown up and moved out. Valentina sells clothing at an open market in Kherson town. The very good location of her kiosk brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Valentina has been in this business for nine years, ever since she saw that women's clothing was one of the few products that sells well and produces a stable income. 

Valentina would like a loan of 5,900 UAH to add to the assortment of clothing she sells. She would spend additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing she sells

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama T. est une femme de 54 ans et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans le Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD et a eu 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers, elle vend des draps de friperie, de la pâte d'arachide, des produits de vaisselle et fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire. Son crédit lui servira à mieux s'approvisionner en marchandise et de faire un élevage de 50 poulets. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mariama T., 54, is the mother of 6 children, all under her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) of MONTAGNE-SUD for two years and has received four consecutive loans. She has a little business selling various items, used sheets, peanut butter, dishes, and raises chickens to sell for meat. Her loan will be used to add to her inventory and raise 50 chickens. She helps her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her little income-generating businesses

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married to a peasant farmer. They have six children and five of the children go to school. Regina takes care of additional family members. Regina owns a wooden store  where she sells charcoal. She buys this charcoal from delivery vans.  Regina doesn’t incur any transport cost because she buys from her home. Regina wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this charcoal business, she is a chef with Makerere University.  Regina works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season, which makes it hard for her customers to reach her. She hopes to increase her business so that she can make enough profit to build rental rooms.  Regina joined MCDT because of the low interest rate. She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena M. N. was born in the capital of Mocambique, Maputo city in 1977. She spent all her childhood there living with her parents and siblings. She studied until 10th grade, but she stopped because she got married and also because she did not have enough money to support her studies. She is married and has a young child, and she takes care of her parents who currently live with her. 

It is the first time she is asking for a loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's partner in Mozambique) or any other institution. She learned about them from her father's work colleague. She is asking for a loan to purchase zinc sheets, cement, paints and other construction materials to refurbish her home where and her entire family lives. She came to request her loan in person and when we went to take a picture of the family home, she was not available, so we show you a picture of her father, who will also benefit from the loan.

She is currently employed, helping at the till of a retail business. She learned the job from her boss five years ago. She makes 2,500 meticais a month and she is able to save about 1,000 meticais every month, so she is confident she will be able to repay the loan without problems.

Her dream in life is to see her parents' home in a good condition for all her family to live in.

loans.use: To purchase zinc sheets, cement, paints and other construction materials

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Barcequillo, en este periodo de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de las trabajadoras es la señora Idalina quien se dedica a la venta de alimentos.
Los alimentos que elaborados por ella los vende a personas que circulan por su casa, entre los preparados se puede mencionar la empanada, milanesas, caldos de pescados, locros, bori-bori y otros.
La preparación de todos los alimentos requiere de mucha inversión en cuanto al gas que la señora usa, por este motivo ella desea compra una cocina eléctrica con planchas de  dos hornallas  ya que este no consumiría  mucha energía.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (To be Reborn) committee was born over two years ago thanks to the initiative and support from another committee active in that place at that time. This committee is in Barcequillo and during these two years of intense work they have grown both socially and economically; they are known there for being very hard-working women. One of the workers is Idalina who sells prepared food to people who pass by her house. Among the items she prepares are: turnovers, breaded steaks, fish stews, locros (a stew composed chiefly of winter squash, potatoes, tender corn, meat or fish), bori-bori (a chicken soup with corn dumplings), etc. Preparation of all these dishes requires a heavy investment due to gas consumption. Because of this, she wants to buy an electric stove with two-burner slates because they will not use as much energy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric stove.

loans.name: Dagga

texts.fr: Dagga N. est âgée de 66 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a 03 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est détentrice d'une petit boutique devant la porte de sa main où elle vend divers produits tels des biscuits, du savon, des boites de conserve, des détergents, etc.. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dagga N., 66, is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since March 29, 2008 and has received three consecutive loans. She has a little shop in front of her house, where she sells biscuits, soap, tinned foods, detergent, etc. With her new loan she is going to stock up on the items she sells. Her profit allows her to participate in improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little commercial enterprise

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo S. was born in the Zambezia region of Mozambique. He is 53 years old and studied through 9th grade of the old system. He had to stop due to financial difficulties. 

He is married and has two daughters, aged 8 and 9, who go to elementary school. He also lives with two step-children and the child of one of his step-children who he also has to support. 

He spent all his childhood in the Zambezia. It was in the beginning of his youth that he moved to Maputo due to a work transfer. There he met his wife. He has worked as a mechanic for more than 20 years -- a job that he learned in the vocational school. He obtains around 4200 meticas every month of which he saves around 500.

He is asking for a loan to buy cement, bricks, stone, sand and construction materials to keep constructing his home, at present still unfinished. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, Kiva's partner in Mozambique. He learned about them through a work colleague. He dreams of having his house finished with the help of a group of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Cement, bricks, stone and sand

loans.name: Felicia Clotilde

texts.es:
La sra Felicia es soltera con 2  hijos que se encuentran  estudiando.
Ella mantiene a sus dos hijos mediante el negocio que ella tiene el cual es una despensa y mercería en su domicilio.
Su negocio tiene 16 años, al principio era vendedora ambulante y actualemente ya atiende su negocio en su propio domicilio.
Ella se encuentra muy bien con su trabajo, y desea adquirir una computadora ya que su hijo esta necesitando para su estudio por este motivo que solicita el préstamo.  
En el futuro  desea ampliar aun mas su negocio ya que esta en un barrio muy poblado y su meta es que sus dos hijos no pasen necesidades con ella.
texts.en:
Felicia is a single mother of two children who are students. She supports her two children with her business which is a general store in her home. Her store is 16 years old; in the beginning she was an itinerant merchant but now she has her store set up in her home. She is very content with her work and wants to acquire a computer that her son needs for his school work; this is why she’s asking for funds. In the future, she’d like to enlarge her store because it’s in a very densely populated neighborhood and her goal is that her children have all their needs met with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Zula

texts.en: Zula is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. Zula also takes care of additional family members. Zula sells second hand clothes in Kasubi  market. She sells to all categories of people but only at retail. She wants to use this loan of 200,000/= to get more second hand clothes. Zula buys these clothes from Owino market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Zula goes shopping once a week.   She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season because she works from an open place. Zula aspires to buy a plot of land. Besides this clothing business, Zula also sells tomatoes. She joined MCDT because she wanted to get start-up capital. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and market dues. Zula resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Francisco Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr Francisco  esta casado con la Teodolinaia  tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar , el se dedica a la compra ventas de lubricantes y aceites.
 El se inicio en el rubro en una empresa muy conocida, del cual se independizó, su negocio tiene en la propiedad de su padre, con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su  propio negocio.
 El  necesita de este crédito para la compra de lubricantes ya que tiene varios  pedidos .
En el futuro  desea ampliar mas su negocio y seguir dando fuente de trabajo ya que actualmente tiene 2 empleados.
texts.en:
Francisco is married to Teodolina and they have three school age children; he is an oil and lubricants merchant. He started out in this occupation an en employee of a well-known firm; he became independent when he used a bit of his savings to set up his own business on his father’s property. He needs this loan to buy lubricants because he has several pending orders to fill. In the future, he’d like to expand his business even more to provide still more jobs; he currently hs two employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil and lubricants.

loans.name: Success To One Group

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Success to One. Beatrice is 49 years old and married. She has two children, ages 7 and 12. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 24 years, Beatrice has been selling frozen meat on a table at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She renders good service to her customers, which keeps them returning. However, she faces problems with insufficient funds to do business.

Beatrice started her business with funds she got from her friends in her community. She plans to use her 6,000-LRD portion of this 30,000-LRD group loan to buy more frozen meat in order to increase her market size. Her goal is to build a shop for the betterment of her family

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice is holding the sign. And Hannah is inset at the lower left because her face was obscured in the original group photo, therefore her photo from her loan application form  had to be taken.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meat in order to increase her market size

loans.name: Siga

texts.fr: Siga N. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est divorcée et vit seule. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de mil et d'arachides, son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises et prétendre à des bénéfices plus importants afin de pouvoir assurer son auto-prise en charge.
texts.en:
Siga N. is a 58-year old woman who is divorced and lives alone. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DIAMAGUENE since 22nd October 2007 and has benefited from five consecutive loans. She sells millet and peanuts. Her new loan will allow her to build up her stock of goods and aspire to higher profits so that she can take care of herself financially.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 27 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ada de 25 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. El arduo trabajo que Benedicto realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que las papas, alverjas y maíz que sembró, han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a la ganadería, donde con mucho trabajo a logrado criar a sus animales para que estén grandes y fuertes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas, abono e insecticidas, para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Benedicto, 27, is a hard-working, responsible father; he lives in his own home with his wife, Ada, 25, and their two minor children for whom he wants to provide a good education. The hard work that Benedicto does in his fields has brought about a good crop yield as a result; the potatoes, peas and corn that he planted have been harvested abundantly and are of good quality. In addition to farming he also raises cattle and has managed, though much effort, to see his animals grow to be big and strong. What he likes best about his work is tilling his lands because he feels that his effort yield good fruits; he has been a farmer for 7 years and considers the most difficult part of his job to keep his crops free of pests that can damage them. In time, he hopes to buy more fields in order to increase production. This is his 5th loan with MFP. He’s aware that he must work very hard putting all his effort into it to repay his loan on time and he is willing to do so. He is a very responsible member of his communal group and his highly respected for this. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy seed, manure and insecticides to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Deysi Karina

texts.es:
Deysi de 24 años, vive en el Guasmo (parte del suburbio, la mayor parte habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 8 años y el otro recién nació, ella trabajaba en el asadero de pollos de su tío pero como no tenia suficientes ingresos decidió independizarse y empezar con su propio negocio. 

Con sus ahorros ella alquilo un local y sillas para su negocio de venta de pollos asados, por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene como sustentar su hogar y darle una vida mejor a sus hijos. Trabaja desde las 16h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, pollos enteros y asados los vende a $ 8.00, el seco de pollo (plato típico, lleva arroz y pollo con un jugo) a $ 1.50, Aguado (un caldo que lleva arroz y pollo) a $ 0.80. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y una cocina para su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner el negocio en otro local mas grande, para tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Deysi, 24, lives in Guasmo (a part of El Suburbio mostly inhabited by retailers), Guayaquil. She has two children; an eight-year-old and a newborn. She worked for her uncle roasting chickens but because her income was very low she decided to become independent and open her own business. She used her savings to rent a space and chairs for her roasted chicken eatery and that good decision now makes it possible for her to support her family and provide a better life for her children. She is open for business from 4pm until 10pm every day. She sells whole roasted chickens for $8.00, “seco de pollo” (a typical dish made of rice and chicken with broth) for $1.50, Aguado (a chicken and rice soup) for $0.80. She will use the requested funds to buy tables, chairs and a stove for her business. In the future, she’d like to install her business in a larger place so that she can have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tables, chairs, stove.

loans.name: Marilly

texts.es: Marilly, de  23 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 6 meses atiende su propia botica. Antes atendía una botica  de otra persona y de esa manera gano experiencia, luego  arrendó un local en una de las principales calles de su ciudad y empezó con el negocio. Es así que en la actualidad  atiende todos los días  en su local  y administra las ganancias que recibe, Marilly disfruta cada día de su trabajo porque le gusta atender a sus clientes, paralelamente a este negocio se dedica junto a su esposo a ofrecer el servicio de transporte, es por eso que para más adelante tiene pensado  incrementar su capital de trabajo.Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con sus pagos, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron  posible el  préstamo que le será  de mucha utilidad  en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de  medicamentos permitidos, para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marilly, 23, lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house. She has had her own drug store for the past 6 months. She used to work in someone else’s drug store and that’s how she got experience. Later, she rented a space on one of the city’s main streets and opened her business; it’s open every day and she manages her own profits. Marilly enjoys her work daily because she likes to take care of her customers. She also has a second occupation with her husband: public transportation services. This is why she plans to increase her working capital in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She is very grateful to all the people who made the loan possible for it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She plans to use the funds to buy permitted medicines to stock her store thereby offering her customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Faty Arelle

texts.fr: Faty Arelle S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus et avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa commande de tissus et augmenter sa clientèle. Son objectif est de prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la couverture vestimentaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Faty Arelle S., 43, is a single mother of two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since October 22, 2007, and has received 5 consecutive loans. She has a little business selling cloth and with her new loan, she is planning to bolster her fabric orders and grow her clientele. Her goal is to pay for food, health expenses, and clothing for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and grow her cloth sales business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 40 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En el pequeño pueblo de Paucarmarca, Julia a pasado la mayor parte de su vida aprendiendo y practicando la agricultura, actividad familiar, es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de de choclo, papa y alverja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a ella y a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, es así que lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su grupo comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a hard-working, loving single mother who lives in her own home with her four beloved children; her greatest wish is to improve their quality of life. She spent most of her life in the small town of Paucarmarca learning and doing farming, this was the family occupation. Now, she grows corn, potatoes and peas, an occupation that provides for the support of herself and her family. Everything she harvests she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market which is where the best prices are to be had. What she likes most about her work is planting which she does with much care. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting her product to market because transportation services in her area are scarce. In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP; she’s been very punctual with her repayments and expects to continue to be so. She is very active in her communal group and held in high esteem by her fellow members. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Richard de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Mariluz en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Paucarmarca. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de animales, labor que le es muy rentable, puesto que es una de las pocas personas que se dedica a esto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su ganado hasta la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma. Por lo pronto espera comprar más reses y así incrementar el número de animales que tiene actualmente. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará un Toro, el cual le costara aproximadamente dos mil nuevos soles, para ellos esta dispuesta aponer la mitad del dinero de sus ahorros personales.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a cheerful and loving mother who is 32 years of age. She lives in her own home with her husband Richard, age 34, and their two darling children for whom she hopes to provide a better future. Mariluz works every day in her fields. Her crops are among the best cultivated in the village of Paucarmarca. Every day she leaves early in order to work her land because she knows the importance of keeping it maintained. In addition, Mariluz raises animals because it is very profitable and she is one of the few people in the area who does this type of work. What she enjoys most about her job is the freedom to make her own decisions. She has been in this business for 15 years and says the most difficult part is transporting her animals to the livestock fair in the city of Tarma. For now, she hopes to buy more cattle to increase her existing herd.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Mariluz feels obligated to complete her payments on time because she does not want to create problems for her Communal Bank. She is greatly admired by the other members and is always receiving advice from them. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, she will buy a bull. The actual cost of the bull is close to 2000 PEN, but she is willing to use her personal savings to cover the remaining cost.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr: Nogoye D. est âgée de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et y a bénéficié de 05 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés. Elle est vendeuse de couscous, de beignets et de colas. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer sa quantité d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Nogoye D., 62, is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) of DIAMAGUENE since October 22, 2007 and has received five loans that she has always used wisely. She sells couscous, fritters, and colas. With her new loan she is going to stock up on the things she sells so that she can earn more profit and help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and grow her little income-generating business

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina, de 31 años, vive con  su esposo  y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada.Desde hace 10 años, brinda el servicio de transporte con una  combi (movilidad que llega a transportar hasta 12 personas) que  es propia. Su esposo es el chofer  y ella hace el trabajo de cobradora de pasajes, de esta manera diariamente recorren la ruta establecida, pues su movilidad esta inscrita en una  empresa de transportes con ruta definida. El trabajo que realizan empieza desde las primeras horas de las mañana, y se extiende  hasta la noche, con ese esforzado trabajo que realizan han mejorado bastante su economía por lo que tienen planeado para más adelante adquirir  otra movilidad para hacerla trabajar contratando a un chofer.Es la primera  vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser responsable en los pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Ricardina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la reparación y mantenimiento de su movilidad, además comprará  repuestos para su combi para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For the past ten years, she has been providing transportation services in her own minibus that holds up to twelve people. Her husband is the driver while she collects bus fare from the passengers. They travel along an established route every day because their vehicle is registered with a transportation company that operates along predetermined routes. Ricardina begins work in the early hours of the morning and continues well into the night. Her hard work has enabled her to significantly improve her finances and she has plans to continue moving forward by acquiring another vehicle and hiring a driver.

This is her first loan with MFP. Ricardina promises to be responsible with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it will be very useful for making progress in her business. She plans to invest the money in repairs and maintenance of her vehicle. In addition, she will buy spare parts for her minibus so that it will be adequately maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Diompelor Group

texts.en:
Clara A., holding the sign, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Diompelor. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one and 8. She did not have the opportunity to go to college due to lack of financial support. Clara has been selling soft drinks on the street at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia, for the past eight years. She gives her customers good service, which keeps them returning but faces problems with the scarcity of goods in the market.

Clara started selling with funds from her husband. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more soft drinks to continue her business. Her goal is to build a house for her family so they can live a better life. She describes herself as a bright and good business woman.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. Janet also takes care of her mother.  She sells charcoal in Bwaise and sells to all categories of people. She buys this charcoal from delivery trucks. She wants to use this loan of 400,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. Janet sells at retail and wholesale. Janet works six days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and thieves. She joined MCDT because she wanted to generate capital. She aspires to go directly to the villages to buy charcoal. Janet resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, market dues, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Khoudia D. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE dont elle est la secrétaire depuis l'inauguration de celui-ci le 22 octobre 2007. Elle est couturière, avec ses économies elle a pu se payer une machine à coudre et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des fournitures pour confectionner des vêtements et revendre dans son quartier. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khoudia D., 29, is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) of DIAMAGUENE since October 22, 2007 and has been its secretary since the beginning. She is a seamstress and with her savings, she has been able to buy a sewing machine. Her new loan will allow her to buy cloth and sewing notions to make clothing to sell in her neighborhood. Her goal is to take part in improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cloth and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
le groupement les linguéres de Aynoumane est un sous groupe un groupement dénommé les linguéres de Fallokh
leur activité principale est la vente de legumes et céréales dans les marchés de la ville et des villages environnant comme le village de Aynoumane.Ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt pour débuter leur activité ,ce second credit entre dans le renforcement de leur commerce pour acheter davantage de produits pour être revendu dans le marché et en tirer des profits pour faire face aux exigence de la vie et des depenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The «Linguéres de Aynoumane» is a subgroup of the «Linguères de Fallokh.» Their principle business is the sale of vegetables and grain in the markets of the city and its surrounding villages such as Aynoumane. Having received a first loan to start their business, they will bolster their business with this second loan, using it to buy more products to sell at market and make a profit in order to meet life's demands and daily expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost sales

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La Sra. Natalia es una cliente antigua y muy puntual D. la institución, se dedica a la venta D. leche, vive en la comunidad D. Chicani donD. tiene sus vacas lecheras, esta leche la venD. a una industria D. Bolivia muy conocida, en todo el país, tiene una hijita pequeña, su esposo se fue a trabajar al Brasil D. donD. le manda cada mes un dinero para los gastos D. la casa, pero no le alcanza asi  que ella debe dedicarse a esta actividad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El crédito será invertido para construcción D. un muro en su casita y asi poder vivir comodamente y brindar una buena calidad D. vida a su familia. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Natalia is a long-time client of Emprender who has been very prompt with her payments. She sells milk in the community of Chicani where she has dairy cows. The milk is sold to a Bolivian company that is well-known throughout the country. Natalia has a young daughter. Her husband went to work in Brazil and sends money home every month for the household expenses, but it is still not enough, so she engages in her business to earn extra income.

This loan will be invested in the construction of a wall in her house so that her family can live comfortably and experience a better quality of life. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Alonso de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Para ella la crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo por sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida. Ella lleva a sus animales a venderlos en la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Es así que lleva 25 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, por lo pronto espera incrementar el numero de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, igual como hizo con sus anteriores créditos. Ella es una compañera muy alegre y querida en su grupo comunal y espera poder seguir trabajando en su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una ternera para criarla y alimentarla, asimismo comprará forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking and loving mother who is 38 years of age. She lives in the house of her parents with her husband Alonso, age 42, and their four beloved children who are the primary motivation behind all of her efforts. Wilma has been raising cattle for most of her life. As a young girl, she learned the trade from her parents who tried to give her a good upbringing. She sells her animals at the livestock fair in the city of Tarma. Wilma is able to command good prices because her cattle are the largest and strongest of all the animals at the fair due to the excellent care that she provides them. She has been in this business for 25 years and says the part she enjoys most is feeding the animals. Wilma hopes to increase the number in her herd so that she can improve her income. She says the most difficult part of her job is transporting the animals to the fair because the work can be very tiring. Despite that fact, she is willing to work hard in order to achieve her goals.

This is her third loan with MFP. Wilma is very eager to complete her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans. Within her Communal Bank, she is considered to be one of the most cheerful and beloved members and hopes to continue working with her group. With the loan of 1500 PEN that she requested, Wilma will buy a calf to raise and feed. She will also acquire fodder for the rest of her herd.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf & fodder for the rest of her herd

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa, de 32 años, vive con su esposo, y sus 3 hijos en la casa de su madre.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la crianza y comercio de cerdos, que vende en las principales ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Su madre le ayuda en el comercio, y todos los días  brinda un adecuado cuidado a sus animales. Con el paso de los años, ha ganado experiencia que le ha servido  para conocer las ventajas de su negocio, pues la venta de los animales le ha generado considerables  ganancias. Para más adelante tiene planeado adquirir más cerdos para  su granja.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy  responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le servirá  para continuar trabajando.Tomasa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de algunos cerdos, para su granja.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 32 years old and lives at her mother’s house with her husband and three children. For the past eight years, she has been raising pigs to sell at the major livestock fairs in her community. Her mother helps her with the business, and together they provide adequate care to the animals. Over the years, Tomasa has gained experience that has helped her to understand the advantages of her business. As a result, the sale of her animals has generated considerable revenue. To keep moving forward, she plans to acquire more pigs for her farm.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Tomasa promises she will be very responsible with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a few pigs for her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more pigs

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Emilio se dedica al servicio técnico, arreglando televisores, equipos de sonido, microndas, computadoras y todo aparato electrónico, es muy conocido porla zona de San Antonio Bajo que donde vive, es casado y su esposa tiene un restaurante que atiende los sabados y ambos aportan para los gastos de la casa, a su cuidado solo tienen un hijo ya que los otros ya son independientes, el crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar repuestos, es un cliente muy responsable y trabajador se siente orgullosos ya que sus hijos salieron de la Universidad y trabajan ejerciendo su profesion, esta muy agradecido con Kiva y Emprender por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Emilio is a service technician who repairs televisions, sound equipment, microwave ovens, computers, and all type of electronic devices. He is well-known in the district of San Antonio Bajo where he lives. Emilio is married and his wife has a restaurant that she manages on Saturdays. Both of them work to cover the household expenses and support one of their children since the others are already independent.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts. Emilio is a very responsible client and hard worker who is proud that his children succeeded in college and are now pursuing their professions. He is extremely grateful to Kiva and Emprender for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Don Armando es un padre de familia de tres hijos, de 41 años de edad, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder equilibrar sus gastos, vive en el barrio Reparto Schick, desde hace un año instalo un pequeño taller de costura, en donde elabora ropa para dama y caballeros, su esposa también ya que es costurera, antes trabajaba como policía, renuncio por que su salario era bajo y no ajustaba con los gastos.
 Luego comienza atrabajar en el  mercado oriental en donde ahorro  dinero para poner el taller y poder tener su propio negocio, el local lo hizo ocupando una parte de su casa que aun no esta totalmente bien cerrado, pero con mucho de deseo de poder salir adelante con este proyecto. Con el financiamiento podrá invertir en tela, hilo, herramientas para el trabajo que ayuden a la producción. Con el objetivo de aumentar las ventas para mejorar su economia.
texts.en:
Don Armando is the father of three children. He is 41 years old and works with his wife to balance their expenses. They live in the Reparto Schick neighborhood. A year ago, Armando started a small sewing workshop where he produces clothing for women and men. His wife also works as a seamstress, but she previously worked as a police officer and later resigned because the pay was low and not enough to keep up with the expenses.

After saving some money, Armando moved his workshop to the eastern market so that he could establish his business. The location that was set aside in his home was not totally secure, but with great determination he was able to move forward with his business. This loan will be invested in fabric, thread, and work equipment to help with production. His goal is to increase his sales and improve his finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and work equipment

loans.name: Women Of Substance Group

texts.en:
Korpo O. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Substance. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children, 9, 12 and 15, and also cares for three siblings. She is a college graduate. For 7 years, Korpo has been selling charcoal at the Paynesville Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells good charcoal which keeps customers returning but faces transportation problems. She started selling with funds she got from her parents. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 61,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to grow her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She describes herself as a quiet but determined business woman.

In the photo, Korpo is holding the sign and Kormassa is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Yuder

texts.es: Yuder, de 21 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. El campo le ha dado a Yuder los recursos necesarios para poder mantenerse, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde que tenía 10 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma, que es donde lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores. Lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y considera  que le gusta pastear a sus animales, sin embargo el tener que llevarlo a las ferias el resulta muy cansado y agotador. Es por ello que desea incrementar el número de reses que tiene, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y se siente feliz de haberlo obtenido, en su grupo comunal es un compañero muy querido ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, planea comprar un toro de raza, ya que desea mejorar la calidad de su ganado.
texts.en:
Yuder is a cheerful and hardworking young man who is 21 years of age. He lives at home with his parents and what he wants most is to succeed in life. Yuder requires necessary resources to remain in his line of work. He has been raising cattle since he was ten years old and learned the trade from his parents. His current interests are taking good care of the animals and feeding them so that they can be sold at the livestock fair in the city of Tarma, where many buyers go to acquire their cattle. Yuder has been managing his own business for six years and enjoys taking the animals out to pasture so they can graze. However, he finds taking the animals to the fairs can be tiring and exhausting. Nonetheless, he wants to increase the number of cattle in his herd so that he can improve his income.

Yuder is requeseting his fifth loan from MFP and is happy to receive it. He is a beloved member of his Communal Bank and always helps out in any way necessary. With the loan of 3000 PEN that he requested, Yuder will purchase a bull of good breed so that he can improve the quality of his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull of good breed

loans.name: Martin Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene como actividad la confeccion de ropa mas propiamente de vestidos los cuales confecciona para poder luego venderlos a un contratista, esta oportunidad esta costurando vestidos para exportarlos a paises vecinos, el Sr. Martin es una persona muy dinamica y emprendedora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, esta ocacion solicita un credito para poder terminar de construir su  casa en la que vive con su Mamá y su Hermana, ya que lo reubicaron  de zona en la que vivia por que hace diez años la misma se derrunbo, pero, ahora se recupero gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo logrando construir su nuevo hogar. Es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, su deseo es terminar de construir su casita esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin manufactures formalwear and sells them to a contractor, who in turn exports them to neighboring countries. He is a dynamic and enterprising person who wants to succeed in life. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to finish the construction of his house where he lives with his mother and sister. Martin relocated to this area ten years ago because his previous home was torn down, but he has now recovered and thanks to his work, he is able to build a new house. He is a responsible and hardworking person who desires to finish building his house. Martin is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina, de  31 años, vive con su hijo de 9 años y sus padres  en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años, trabaja en la venta de artesanías. Aprendió de muy pequeña pues sus padres producen  tejidos y  artesanías. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la  venta de comida  en su  casa que esta ubicada en una de las principales avenidas de su localidad. Trabaja durante todos los días, de manera incansable a fin de tener las ganancias que necesita, según ella, la ubicación de su negocio es el punto clave de las considerables ventas que tiene. Y para más adelante desea instalar un local más amplio, muy presentable para mejorar la imagen de su negocio.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le será muy útil  en el progreso de su negocio.Yanina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
Yanina is 31 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her nine year old son. She has been selling handicrafts for the past five years. As a young girl, Yanina learned how to make woven and handcrafted items from her parents. In addition, she sells food from her home which is located on one of the main avenues in her community. According to Yanina, she works tirelessly every day to earn the income that she needs. The location of her business is a key factor behind her significant sales. In the future, she wants to move into a larger location that is presentable so that she can improve the image of her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yanina is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible since it will be very useful for making progress in her business. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to improve the infrastructure of her store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NELLY ES UNA CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO VARIAS SECUENCIAS  EN LA INSTITUCION, EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA LA VENTA DE FRUTAS, SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO ESPECIFICAMENTE FRENTE A LA IGLESIA EL ROSARIO A UNOS PASOS DE LA FAMOSA PLAZA 16 DE JULIO, LA SEÑORA HACE TRAER LAS FRUTAS DESDE LA REGION DE YUNGAS ZONA MUY ACCIDENTADA POR LA MISMA TOPOGRAFIA, LA SEÑORA INVERTIRA EL CREDITO EN LA INYECCION DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN SU NEGOCIO POR LA CAUSA QUE HACE TRES SEMANAS SU CARRO QUE TRAIA MERCADERIA (FRUTAS) SE VOLCO, EN ESE ACCIDENTE PERDIO GRAN CANTIDAD DE MERCADERIA, PERO LA SEÑORA PESE A ESA DESGRACIA NO SE DA POR VENCIDO Y SIGUE TRABAJANDO. LA SEÑORA TIENE DOS HIJAS UNA MAYOR QUE SIGUE ESTUDIANDO Y UNA PEQUEÑA QUE SIGUE CUIDANDO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON LA INSTITUCION POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Nelly is a client that has worked several loan cycles with the institution. She has demonstrated responsibility with previous loans. She sells fruit, her business is located in the 16th of July area, specifically in front of the Rosario church just a few steps from the 16th of July Plaza. She brings her fruit from the Yungas zone, which is a dangerous journey because of the topography. She will use the loan as working capital for her business because three weeks ago her car, with which she used to bring merchandise (fruit) to market, broke down. In this accident she lost a large quantity of merchandise, but in spite of this setback she is not giving up and is continuing to work. She has two daughters, one older daughter who is still in school and a younger daughter who she still cares for. She is very grateful to the organization for having confidence in her to give her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her fruit business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. A. tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres.
El Sr. A. se dedica al reciclaje de cartones, botellas de todo tipo, hules, latas, hierro, etc.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, y la misma lo heredo de su padre que fue quien le enseño todo acerca de este trabajo
 luego de fallecer su padre todo quedó bajo su responsabilidad. Trabaja para varias empresas grandes a quienes provee de sus mercaderías (reciclados).

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
Su deseo es seguir progresando.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de más reciclados (cartones, plástico, hierro y otros).
texts.en:
Sr. Julio A. is 27 years old, single, and lives in the house of his parents. He recycles cardboard, bottles of all kinds, rubber, tin, iron, and other materials. Julio has been in this business for two years and took over from his father who taught him everything about this type of work. After his father’s death, he assumed all responsibility. He works for several large companies that provide him with recyclable materials.

Julio is a person who has made much progress in his life and he thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support that has been provided. He hopes to continue making headway. Julio is requesting this loan so that he can buy more recyclable materials such as cardboard, plastic, iron, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cardboard, plastic, iron, and other recyclable materials

loans.name: David Ong’Uo

texts.en:
David Ong’uo N. is 26 years old. He is married and the father of two children. In 2007, after finishing his high school education, he started a business in Migori, Kenya, selling rice to generate income. He purchases his stock in Sirare weekly.

He would like to raise enough income to be able to provide for his family, including education for his children. He plans to expand his business and would like to get a loan worth 30,000 KES to boost his business.

loans.use: increase stock to boost business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Miriam es una mujer emprendedora, de 47 años de edad, madre de dos hijos. Su negocio es una sastrería que  se hacen todo tipo de costura para dama, caballeros, niños, y una variedad como: cortina, ropa de cama, fundas, manteles. Este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, y trabaja junto con su esposo ya que es sastres y ambos se han apoyado en el trabajo. 
Inicio desde joven, a trabajar, pues las condiciones económicas no eran tan buenas. Gracias a su mama logro sobresalir y pudo aprender la costura. Con este financiamiento comprara materia prima como: telas variadas, hilos, botones, bordados para lograr hacer los trabajos de costura que espera lograr mejores resultados en ventas ya que hay día que están bajas. 
Es por eso hará la inversión para elaborar costura nueva, y captar clientes nuevo y lograr equilibrar sus costos y gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam is an enterprising woman who is 47 years old and the mother of two children. She works as a tailor making all types of clothing for women, men, and children, as well as a variety of other items such as curtains, bed sheets, pillowcases, and tablecloths. Miriam started her business several years ago and works with her husband. Since they are both tailors, they are both supportive of each other’s work. She started working as a young woman because her economic situation was not that good. Thanks to her mother, Miriam was able to get ahead and learn sewing.

This loan will be used to buy raw materials such as various fabrics, thread, buttons, and fringe so that she can continue producing apparel. She hopes to achieve better results with her sales since they are low at the moment. With this investment to produce new clothing, she hopes to attract new customers and achieve balance with her costs and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARTHA ES UNA CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO VARIAS SECUENCIAS  EN LA INSTITUCION, EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD, SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO, UNA ZONA MUY COMERCIAL Y LE VA MUY BIEN EL LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y SIEMPRE VIENDO EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PRA SUSTIR SU PUESTO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
