Martha is a client that has worked several loan cycles with the institution. She has demonstrated responsibility with previous loans. She sells basic needs items, her business is located in the 16th of July area, a very busy commercial zone and her business selling these products is going very well. She is hardworking and always taking into account the well-bing of her family. She will use the loan as to buy merchandise at wholesale to resell in her business. She is very grateful to the organization for having confidence in her to give her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur Lamine G. est un tailleur âgé de 30 ans. Il est dans ce métier depuis 2000 et gère actuellement son propre atelier avec ses 4 apprentis éléves. Cependant il vient solliciter un prêt de 150 000 FCFA au niveau de sa mutuelle Imcec Thiès. C'est pas la première fois qu'il sollcicte, il en est à sa troisième demande de crédit. Ce jeune célibataire compte avec cet argent acheter des tissus, fils, et autres accessoires pour confectionner des habits de toutes genres afin de les vendre. Ainsi, comme la commande se fait rare, ce pre^t va lui permetre faire marcher son entreprise par la vente de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine G. is a 30-year-old tailor. He has been in the business since 2000 and now manages his own workshop with four apprentices. He is seeking a loan of 150,000 FCFA from U-IMCEC Thiès. This is not the first time he has asked for a loan; this is his third request for a loan. This young, single man plans to use the money to buy fabric, thread, and other accessories to make various articles of clothing to sell. In this way, because orders are rare, this loan will allow him to do business selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Mildred Jaqueline

texts.es: La señora Mildred F. tiene 43 años de edad vive en villa lobos 1 en la ciudad de Guatemala, esta casada con Ernesto Pacheco y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. El negocio de doña Mildred es venta de productos de consumo diario, venta de arena y piedrin, toda la familia trabaja en el negocio. Con el prestamo quiere comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener diversidad de productos en su tienda. Ella sueña con tener una ferreteria donde pueda vender todo tipo de materiales de construccion y junto con su esposo darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mildred F. is 43 years old and lives in Villa Lobos 1 in Guatemala City. She is married to Ernesto Pacheco and has three children who help with her business. Doña Mildred sells daily consumers products and also manages a sand and gravel business. Everyone in her family works in the business. With this loan, she wants to buy more merchandise so that she can have a variety of products in her store. Mildred dreams of opening a hardware store where she can sell all types of construction materials so that she and her husband can provide their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Calvin Omondi

texts.en:
Calvin Omondi O. owns a retail shop in Rongo, Kenya, a business he started in 2001. Before opening the shop, he used to farm but had to quit due to the low income. Calvin restocks his merchandise on a weekly basis. With his future plans to become financially stable, Calvin would like to expand his business so that it will earn him considerable income to be able to sustain his family.

He would like to get a loan worth 50,000 KES to increase his stock.

loans.use: increase his business stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia tiene  29 años, esta casada con el Sr Gustavo Flores Gonzalez, tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Ella  tiene un puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado dentro del Mercado Municipal de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, el mismo se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Trabaja en esta actividad desde el año 2000. Su vivienda está  ubicada  en zona alejada  del centro de la ciudad por lo que ella debe salir muy temprano de su casa  para abrir su negocio.
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de prendas de  invierno  para  niños y adultos.
Lucia anhela poder contar con su propia Boutique  en la cual se pueda manejar dentro de su propia casa .
texts.en:
Lucia is 29 years old, and she is married to Gustavo Flores Gonzalez. They have two minor children. She has a sales stand, which is located inside the Municipal Market in the city of San Lorenzo. She sells articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She has been doing this work since the year 2000. Her house is located in a region far from the center of the city. Therefore, she needs to leave her house very early to open her business. The loan will be helpful in buying clothes for winter for children and adults. Lucia longs to be able to have her own boutique, which she would be able to run inside of her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for women, men, and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing sodas and other soft drinks for resale

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is With Us. He is 44 years old, married and has one child, who is 16 years old. He was only able to complete 12th grade due to poverty. He cares for eight siblings.

For 15 years, Emmanuel has been selling spare parts and repairing all kinds of vehicles in Gardnerville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells durable spare parts and does his vehicle repairing job well, which keep customers returning.  

He plans to use his 30,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 100,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more vehicle spare parts and to renovate his mechanic shop. His goal is to grow his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Emmanuel is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle spare parts and renovate his mechanic shop

loans.name: Kamaamia

texts.en:
Kamaamia N. is 26 years old and married to Kanasa N.. He is a farmer who farms his own piece of land which he has done for the last four years.
  
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land to increase his wheat production. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale wheat farmer.

loans.use: to plant more acres of wheat

loans.name: Ologolimot Ole

texts.en:
Ologolimot Ole N. is 32 years old. He and his wife, Kisaru, have three school-going children. Ologolimot has been a farmer for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area good for wheat farming because of the climate.

He learned about KADET from group members who are already KADET registered clients. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare fifteen acres to plant wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land to increase his wheat production. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land to farm. He is a har-working man and determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare fifteen acres to plant wheat

loans.name: Kisakwa

texts.en:
Kisakwa S. is 26 years old. He and his wife, Monica, have two children. Kisakwa is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last six years.
  
He learned about KADET from a neighbor who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to prepare twenty acres of land to plant wheat, which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land to increase his wheat production. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and plant more wheat for commercial purposes. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale wheat farmer. He is a hard-working man and determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare twenty acres of land to plant wheat

loans.name: Sakamo Ole

texts.en:
Sakamo Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married to Talash Ntayia, and he is the father of three children.

Sakamo is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last seven years.

Sakamo learned about KADET from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Sakamo's first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES to prepare his farm for wheat planting and 20,000 KES to buy sheep to fatten and sell. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his wheat production. He also hopes to buy more sheep to fatten and sell.

Sakamo's dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in wheat farming and sheep rearing. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare his farm for wheat planting and to buy sheep

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Cuando era niña  observaba como los miembros de su familia se dedicaban a fabricar ladrillos;  y desde hace más de 5 años lo hace  de manera independiente. Para lograr su labor cuenta con su horno de cocimiento donde termina de procesar la  fabricación de los ladrillos. Trabaja diariamente junto a su esposo, y produce por millares, además contrata mano de obra (ayudantes) para que la producción sea constante. Los años de experiencia que tiene en el rubro, le han permitido aprender a fabricar ladrillos de buena calidad y esta es la razón de las buenas ventas que obtiene. Las considerables ganancias que recibe la ayudan a mejorar su calidad  de vida, y para el futuro tiene planeado adquirir un terreno más grande  para que sea su fábrica sea estable.Es la novena oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales (como arena, aserrín, entre otros) que necesita para la fabricación de sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 26, lives with her husband and their two children in her own house. When she was a girl she watched how the members of her family made bricks. For over five years she has been doing this in an independent manner. In order to do her work she has an oven. That is where she cooks the bricks to finish the process of making them. She works everyday together with her husband. They produce by the thousands. They also hire helpers to work so that production is constant. Her years of experience in the field have allowed her to learn to make good quality bricks. That is the reason for the good sales that she gets. The substantial earnings she receives help her to improve her quality of life. In the future she has plans to acquire a bigger piece of land so that her factory will be stable. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible. It will be very useful to the progress of her business. Maria plans to use the money to buy a greater quantity of materials (like sand and sawdust, among others) that she needs to make bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to continue making bricks

loans.name: Parkimaso Ole

texts.en:
Parkimaso Ole N. is 45 years old, married to Naipano N., and the father of seven children. For the last seven years, he has farmed his own piece of land.
Parkimaso learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from a friend who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES of the loan on preparing his farm for planting wheat and 20,000 KES to buy a few heifers for fattening to sell later. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production. He also hopes to buy more heifers for fattening and selling later.
Parkimaso's future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer, both in wheat farming and livestock keeping. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To prepare his farm for planting wheat and buy a few heifers for fattening

loans.name: Sarinke Ole

texts.en:
Sarinke Ole N. is 30 years old, married to Nanyikae N., and the father of four children. For the last ten years, he has farmed his own piece of land.
Sarinke learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from marketing awareness carried out by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend his 50,000 KES on maize farming; maize is doing very well in the area due to fertile land and adequate rainfall. With the profits he hopes to make from the loan, he plans to rent land for farming to increase his maize production. He also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.
Sarinke's future dream is that he will be able to practise large-scale maize farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To spend on maize farming

loans.name: Ologolimot Ole

texts.en:
Ologolimot Ole K. is 37 years old, married to Nalang’u K., and the father of seven children. For the last year, Ologolimot has farmed his own piece of land.
Ologolimot learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from marketing awareness carried out by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES of his loan on maize farming and 20,000 KES on wheat farming. Maize is proving to be doing very well in the area due to fertile land and adequate rainfall. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his maize and wheat production.
Ologolimot's future dream is to practise large-scale maize farming and educate all his children. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To spend on maize and wheat farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of new sewing machines and other tools of her trade

loans.name: Kikompi Ole

texts.en:
Kikompi Ole S., 33 years old, is married to Noomeyuni S. and the father of two children. Farming his own piece of land for the last ten years, he learned about KADET through marketing awareness conducted by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan for which is planning to spend the 50,000 KES on maize farming. Maize does very well due to the fertile lands and adequate rainfall in the area, and with the additional profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, Kikompi plans to lease additional farmland in order to increase his maize production.

A hardworking man determined to achieve his goals, Kikompi's dream is to practice large-scale maize farming.

loans.use: Maize farming

loans.name: Mark Otieno

texts.en:
Mark Otieno O. is 38 years old, a husband and father of seven children. He owns a nursery school in Nyalenda, which he started in 2008 after quitting farming. He started the school to help many children within the vicinity learn basic skills and to generate his income from it.

He would like to get a loan of 30,000 KES to be able to renovate the classes so that they look appealing and the children feel comfortable there. The renovation will also attract more children which will ensure him sufficient income as he plans to be financially stable so that he can educate his children.

loans.use: to renovate the school

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sikoe Ole

texts.en:
Sikoe Ole N. is 35 years old. He is married to Merinyo N., and he is the father of four children.

Sikoe is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last ten years.

Sikoe learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign conducted by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the money to cultivate his eight acres on which he has planted maize and beans. With the proceeds he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his maize and beans production.

Sikoe's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and to have his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cultivate the eight acres on which he has planted maize and beans

loans.name: Lialo Ole

texts.en:
Lialo Ole N. is 29 years old. He is married to Noonkuta N., and he is the father of four school-going children.

Lialo is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last ten years.

Lialo learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign conducted by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the loan on maize farming. With the proceeds he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his farm production.

Lialo's dream is that he will be able to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: maize farming

loans.name: Kosiom Ole

texts.en:
Kosiom Ole T. is 41 years old. He is married to Naropil Tikan and is the father of four children. 

Kosiom is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the loan on cultivating his five acres which he has planted in maize and beans. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize and beans production. 

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and build a better house. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cultivate his five acres which he has planted in maize and beans

loans.name: Dickson Mushukwa

texts.en:
Dickson Mushukwa N. is 26 years old. He is married to Caroline Nyioma and is the father of a 2-year-old child. 

Dickson is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the loan on maize farming; maize has proven to do very well due to fertile lands in the area and adequate rainfall. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize production. 

His future dream is that he will be able to practice large scale maize farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Maize farming

loans.name: Nubia Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Nubia es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos, se dedica al negocio, desde hace varios años tiene una pulpería que ha sido su fuente de entradas. Son muchos años trabajando en ventas y lo difícil que es poder mantener el equilibrio ya que las ventas bajan, y  los productos suben, pero gracias a la inversión de los financiamientos ha logrado mantener su inventario. Cuando inicio  lo hizo joven con su mama ya que también  tenia este negocio. 
Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, así como también gas licuado que se vende mucho ya que es un producto necesario al consumo diario de nuestro hogar. Durante estos periodos no solo a mantenido su negocio con productos también ha mejorado su casa lo cual esta contenta por estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Nubia is a hard-working woman, and she has three children. Her business, which she has had for several years, is a mini-market. It has been her source of income. She has been working in sales for many years. The most difficult part is being able to maintain equilibrium because sales go down and the products rise. But, thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain her inventory. When she started she was a young woman. She started with her mother, who also had this business. With this loan she will buy things like basic grains, beans, rice, sugar, oil, and soap. She will also buy liquefied gas, which sells a lot because it is a necessary product that is used everyday in our homes. During these periods she has not only maintained her business with products, but she has also improved her house. She is happy with these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, oil, soap, and liquefied gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating tomatoes and lettuce

loans.name: Tonou Ole

texts.en:
Tonou Ole N. is 30 years old. He a single young man who is focused on farming. 

He has been farming for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for growing maize, beans and potatoes.

He learned about KADET through a KADET officer who was doing marketing awareness within his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for  maize.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery. Tonou is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Kimeenu Ole

texts.en:
Kimeenu Ole N. is 33 years old. He is married to Noolamala N. and he is the father of six school-going children. 

Kimeenu is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the money on beans and maize farming. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his farm production. 

His future dream is that he will be able to practice large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Beans and maize farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand his cultivated area and buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Taatai Ole

texts.en:
Taatai Ole K. is 41 years old. He is married to Nayengiyengunye K. and he is the father of three children. 

Taatai is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last twelve years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the money on cultivating his ten acres which he has planted in maize and beans. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest by plowing more land to increase his maize and beans production. 

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer, build a better house and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cultivate his ten acres which he has planted maize and beans

loans.name: Oltimpau Ole

texts.en:
Oltimpau Ole L., 38, is married to Naserian L. and the father of three school-going children. For the past 15 years, Oltimpau has been farming his own piece of land. He learned about KADET from marketing awareness conducted by KADET staff in his area and is now applying for his first loan, to be used for bean and maize farming. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, Oltimpau plans to hire more land for farming to increase his production.

His dream is to practice large scale farming and attain financial independence.

loans.use: For bean and maize farming

loans.name: Nadutari Enole

texts.en:
Nadutari Enole N. is 29 years old. She is married to Sinore Ole Saoli, and she is the mother of eight children.

Nadutari is a farmer, and she does the farming on her own piece of land. She has been doing this for the last eight years.

Nadutari learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members of KADET. This will be her first loan, and she is planning to spend 20,000 KES to plant more beans, which normally do well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her farming activities from small-scale to commercial farming.

Nadutari's dream is to do large-scale farming and to attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To plant more beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: wholesaling of foodstuffs

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité  Mujeres trabajadora se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro el programa comite  de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas asistieron puntualmente a sus reuniones, trabajaron de antemano para juntar fondos para la caja chica. 
Ellas están muy felices por  el crédito, pues es una oportunidad especial para ellas de progresar y salir adelante.
Margarita es un mujer que se dedica  a  la venta de ropas , ella venda sus mercaderías en la vereda de su casa ya que no tiene un salón para exponer  sus ropas.
Sin embargo mucha gente se acerca  para comprar , ella quiere adquirir prendas para la temporada de invierno (camperas, sueter, poleras, pantalones)q ue actualmente esta entrando en el país, para este fin solicita el préstamo.
Todas esperan continuar trabando y seguir contando con el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva .
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee is in its first cycle within the Enterprising Women committee’s program; they attended meetings punctually and worked hard ahead of time to gather funds for petty cash. They are very happy with the loan because it’s a special opportunity for them to make progress and get ahead. Margarita sells clothes on the sidewalk in front of her house because she doesn’t have a room in which to display her wares. However, many people come by to purchase and she wants to buy winter items (jackets, sweaters, sweatshirts, pants) to stock because winter is starting in the country; thus the loan request. All the members expect to continue working and being able to count on support from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Née le 12 Juin 1952 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Léonie vit depuis environs quarante ans au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. Léonie est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, mais qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Léonie vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léonie mène comme activité, depuis vingt ans, la vente de jus de bissaps, de yahourt, de jus de citron, etc. à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Léonie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Léonie voudrait élever davantage le niveau de son activité et faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on June 12, 1952 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, A. Léonie has been living in the Vodjè neighborhood in Cotonou for about 40 years. Léonie is a widow with three children, all of them having attended school, who are no longer her responsibility. She lives alone and supports herself. In order to do so, Léonie has been selling hibiscus-flower juice, yogurt, lemon juice, etc. out of her home and on foot in the neighborhoods. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé, who has already received three loans which have all been correctly reimbursed. Léonie would like to further expand her business so as to cope with the ever-increasing demand of her clientele. This is the reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of milk, sugar, hibiscus flowers, etc. for the production of fruit juice and yogurt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of foodstuffs and staple goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of hair dryers and other equipment for hairdressing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres con ellos y su hermano quien ya es independiente. Siendo aún soltera, se dedica desde hace 6 años en la venta de productos de belleza de reconocidas marcas, siendo promotora de ventas, posee un modulo donde ofrece sus cosméticos, de esa manera la clientela accede más fácilmente a estos productos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite realizarlo de forma muy independiente dándole tiempo para sus estudios, además el rubro de venta de estos productos siempre le ha gustado, pues es muy detallista en los colores, tonos que mejor le favorecen a las chicas, es por ello que aconseja muy bien a todas sus clientas realizar buenas ventas. Si bien el rubro de belleza le gusta mucho, desea complementarlo estudiando turismos, por ello desea en el futuro tener su agencia de viajes, es una meta que quiere alcanzar para desarrollarse como profesional. Este es su primer crédito en MFP por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Patricia, 22, lives with her parents and a brother who is independent already. Being still single, she has sold well-known brand name beauty products for the last 6 years. She has a sales booth that makes it easier for customers to access her products. She likes her work very much because she’s free to establish her own schedule and can work while still going to school. Besides, she’s always enjoyed working in this particular line of work because she is very meticulous with the colors and shades that are most flattering to the young ladies; because of this, she gives good advice to her customers and this leads to very good sales. Even though she enjoys being in the beauty business she also wants to study tourism and hospitality so that she can have a travel agency in the future; this is her long-term goal for professional development. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with all her payments. She will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of beauty products to have available in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock beauty products.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
EL Banco D. emprendimiento SANTA RITA, viene trabajando ya dos ciclos atrás este banco se caracteriza por ser puntual en los pagos y ser muy solidarias. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como: cosmeticos ollas en aluminio ,atencion en su tienda y otras a la elaboracion D. mantas ,macrame y tejidos.

La Sra. ROSAURA es una D. las socias mas aniguas, ocupa el cargo D. presidenta la sra tiene como actividad una tienda D. barrio,con el prestamo a surtido su tienda comprando mercaderia como refescos, conservas, galletas, detergentes, bebidas, pañales, etc, con esta actividad ya tiene varios años y D. este modo colabora con los gastos D. la casa.

La Sra. ADRIANA ocupa el el cargo D. secretaria, esta socia trabaja en una empresa D. limpieza tambien ella se dedica a la elaboracion D. tejido en macrame, con el prestamo otorgado a comprado material para la elaboracion D. mantas a pedido ya que tiene muchos clientes y tiene que realizar entregas.

La Sra. VIQUI ocupa el cargo D. tesorera esta socia se dedica a la cofeccion D. mantas y realiza macrame con el prestamo otorgado a comprado por mayor lana, cintas para la realizar sus mantas, es una socia muy trabajadora y responsable siempre viendo a que actividad dedicarse.

Todas las  socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias solas, estan muy agaredecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita community bank has completed two loan cycles, and can be characterized as being punctual with its payments and V. united. The members sell products such as: cosmetics, aluminum pots, some work in general stores and others make ponchos, macramé items, and weavings. Rosaura is one of the oldest members of the group, and is the president. She has a neighborhood store, and with the loan she will stock her store with soda pop, jelly, cookies, detergent, beverages, diapers, etc. She has had the store for several years and in this way meets her household expenses. Adriana is the secretary, and she works in a cleaning business and she also makes macramé weavings. She will use the loan to buy materials to make custom ponchos as she has many customers and orders to fill. Viqui is the treasurer and makes tablecloths and also macramé weaving. With the loan she will buy more wool and belts for making her ponchos. She is a hard-working and responsible member who always has work to do. All the members are hard-working and responsible and in many cases are the sole supporters in their families. They are V. grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Tori Bossito, dans le département de l'Atlantique, A. Virginie vit depuis quinze ans environs à Akpakpa-Dodomè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Virginie est mariée à SEWANOU Raymond, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont un seulement représente leur propre enfant. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Pour assurer ses différents besoins et venir en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges familiales, Virginie  vend du pain à son domicile et aussi devant une école primaire à Cotonou. Virginie s'approvisionne dans les boulangeries de Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Virginie vend également du charbon de bois à son domicile. C'est depuis treize ans que Virginie mène cette activité. Virginie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de rehausser le niveau de son activité, pour se faire plus de revenus, Virginie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Tori Bossito, in the Atlantique Province, A. Virginie has been living for about 15 years in Akpakpa-Dodomè, a district of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Virginie is married to SEWANOU Raymond, a chauffeur. The couple are raising four children, of whom only one is their biological child. All the children are enrolled in school. The family lives together and the couple share in supporting the family. To help her husband cover household expenses, Virginie sells bread at their home and also in front of a primary school in Cotonou. Virginie gets her supplies in the bakeries of Cotonou. Secondarily, she also sells charcoal out of her home. She has been in these businesses for 13 years. She is a long-time client of ALIDé, having received four loans, all of which have been correctly reimbursed. Wishing to increase her working capital and expand her businesses, Virginie is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bread wholesale

loans.name: Gerardina De La Paz

texts.es:
Gerardina de la Paz Veliz de López tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Guatajigua , en el departamento de Morazán. Ella es soltera vive con sus dos hermanos y su madre, aprendió el oficio a los 12 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de productos artesanales de Barro (comales, ollas, jarros) es un negocio de tradición que se enseña por  generaciones y lo desempeñan generalmente las mujeres, el negocio les ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.
Gerardina  comercializa sus productos en la plaza de comercio de Guatajiagua y con visitantes de la zona, ella solicita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de diferentes clases de barros que son necesarios para que ella elabore sus cómales y ollas, ya que en la época del invierno (de Mayo a Octubre) es bien difícil obtenerlo. 
Con la compra de materiales  ella seguirá elaborando más productos durante el verano (de Noviembre a Abril)  ya que es la época más indicada para elaboración y secado. Su aspiración es mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar la calidad  de vida para su familia y diversificar la elaboración de productos de artesanía para tener a disposición cuando sea necesario.
texts.en:
Gerardina de la Paz V. de Lopéz is 33 years old. She lives in the municipality of Guatajigua, in the department of Morazán. She is single and lives with the her two brothers and her mother. She learned her occupation when she was 12 years old. She makes craft products from clay (tortilla pans, cooking or storage jars, vases). This is a traditional business that is taught from one generation to the next, and it is usually done by women. The business helps her support her family. Gerardina sells her products in the market plaza in Guatajiagua to people from the area. She is requesting the money to buy different kinds of clay that she needs to make her tortilla pans and cooking pots. The clay is very difficult to get during the rainy season. When she has purchased her materials, she will continue making her products during the dry season, since that’s the best season for making and drying them. Her aspiration is to maintain and build her business, improve her family’s quality of life, and diversify the products she makes so she can have them ready when necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clays

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel M. y M., tiene 36 años de edad es acompañada y tiene tres hijos de las edades 14,11 y 7 años, viven en una casa propia ubicada en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de  tortillas, ella empezó su negocio gracias al apoyo de su mama y actualmente comercializa tortillas entre los vecinos y otras personas que circulan por el puesto que esta ubicado en la vivienda, con las ganancias del  negocio ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares, ayudando a sus hijos que actualmente asisten a la escuela.

El préstamo lo necesita fortalecer su negocio, que los invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, gas cal, bolsas entre otras cosas.
Anabel sueña con tener un negocio mejor como lo es el de un comedor, para mejorar su vivienda y poderles dar a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Anabel M. y M. is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children who are 14, 11, and 7 years old. They all live in their own house, located in the Santa Elena department of Usulután. She has been selling tortillas for three years. She started her business thanks to her mother’s support and she sells tortillas to her neighbors and other people who pass by the stand she has in her house. With the earnings from the business she has been able to pay the family expenses and help her children, who are currently in school. She needs the loan to build her business. She will use it to buy corn, firewood, natural gas, lime, and bags, among other things. Anabel dreams of having a better business, such as a small restaurant, so she can improve her house and be able to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, natural gas, lime, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying manure and farm supplies and renting a tractor for plowing

loans.name: Magaly Diana

texts.es:
La señora  Magaly Domínguez es socia de banco comunal Luz y Vida hace nueve ciclos, vive  en una casa arrendada  con sus hijos de 8 años y dos meses de edad y su esposo que trabaja en una mecánica en la comunidad El  Aguacate en el sector Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra  ubicada a 2.550 metros de altura en la parte sur de la cordillera ecuatoriana, es la tercera ciudad más grande  e importante del  Ecuador después de Quito y Guayaquil y desde 1999 ha sido designada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO.  Aquí encontramos  numerosas iglesias que son un símbolo de  religiosidad impuesta por los españoles a nuestros antepasados donde podemos visualizar  una arquitectura imponente con valiosos detalles en mármol y oro.

Magali tiene 31 años de edad es una mujer  muy activa ya que siempre busca la manera de generar ingresos económicos para su hogar vendiendo comida los viernes, compra y vende yogurt en su comunidad y también se dedica a criar pollos tanto para el  consumo de su familia como para la venta.  Con el  crédito comprará más  pollos y  alimento como maíz, engorde, etc.  para su crianza.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Magaly Domínguez, 31, has been a member of the “Luz y Vida” (Light & Life) communal bank for nine cycles; she lives in a rented house with her children, who are 8 years old and 2 months old, and her husband, who is a mechanic, in El Aguacate, Monay sector, Cuenca. Cuenca is located 2550 meters above sea level in the south part of the Ecuadorean Andes; it’s Ecuador’s third most important city after Quito and Guayaquil. Since 1999 it has been designated Patrimony of Humanity by UNESCO. One finds numerous churches here which are a symbol of the religion imposed by our Spanish ancestors and where we can admire imposing architecture with valuable marble and gold details. Magaly is a very active woman who always seeks to generate income for her home by selling prepared meals every Friday; she also is a yoghurt merchant and raises chickens both for family consumption and for sale. She will use the funds to buy more chicks and food like corn and chicken feed. Her greatest wish is to have her own home someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, corn and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Magda es madre de familia de cuatro hijos, muy dedicada al trabajo,  Su  negocio es la venta y compra de cerdo, lleva varios años en este trabajo que junto a su esposo trabajan. Comprando el cerdo lo engordan y luego lo destasan, para sacarle mejor ganancia que cuando lo venden de un solo. Es un trabajo cansado ya que hay que lavarles el chiquero, alimentarlos, cuidarlos. Pero es un negocio rentable que le ha permitido las mejoras económicas a su familia. Sus planes es poder comprar más cantidad de cerdo para lograr mejores beneficios. Con este financiamiento comprara varios cerdos para destace ya que los que tiene están en proceso de engorde y no tiene para comprar en este momento los cerdos es por eso con este financiamiento mejora el inventario de su negocio.
texts.en:
Magda is the mother of four children; she is very dedicated to her work. Her business is buying and selling pigs; she and her husband have been in this line of work for several years. They buy pigs; fatten them up and then butcher them thereby earning higher profits than selling them whole. It is exhausting work in that one must wash out the pigsties, feed the pigs and care for them. But it is a profitable business that has made possible improved economic conditions for the family. Her plan is to continue to buy larger numbers of pigs to get more benefits from them. She will use this loan to buy several pigs to butcher because the ones she currently has are still being fattened up and she currently lacks funds to buy pigs to butcher; this funding will improve her businesses stock inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy several pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Rosa Anastacia

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, la mayor parte habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo con el tiene dos hijos de 35 y 20 años. La tienda la tiene hace 8 años atrás cuando su esposo empezo a comprar viveres para que Rosa venda a sus vecinos, esto les ayudo como un ingreso adicional en su familia, despues de un tiempo ella invirtió sus ahorros en arroz, cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para hacer mas grande la tienda. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y comprando mas productos, trabaja con su hija desde las 07h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, ha comenzado a vender papelería en su tienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, enlatados, bebidas para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener otra tienda en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (part of El Suburbio mostly inhabited by retailers), Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband with whom she has two children who are 35 and 20 years of age. She has had her store for 8 years since her husband started to buy foodstuffs for Rosa to sell to her neighbors. This provided additional family income and after some time she invested her own savings to buy rice, notebooks, beverages and display cases to enlarge the store. Gradually her capital grew and she bought more and more products. She works with her daughter from 7:30am until 9pm every day. She has started to include stationery items in her store’s stock. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, canned goods and beverages for the store. In the future, she’d like to have another store in a different location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, beverages, canned goods.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio M. Diaz es un señor de 45 años el cual vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos.



Don Julio se ha  dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura,  pero la cría de cerdo  para engorde ha sido uno de sus principales actividades en la cual ya tiene 10 años de experiencia. El Asegura que este siempre ha sido una buena fuente de ingresos ya que en la comunidad reconocen la calidad de producto.

Por ahora Don Julio  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢606000 (seiscientos seis mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido e Infraestructura. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 50 cerdos para engorde y aprovechar el buen precio que tiene el producto en este momento, para asi aumentar las ventas y  mejorar sus condiciones económicas. 


Don Julio forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su primer préstamo y asegura que será de mucho beneficio para su negocio, y espera seguir participando mas activamente con la empresa de crédito Comunal.
texts.en:
Julio M. Diaz, 45, lives with his wife and five children in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is located 150 kilometers south of San José province, Costa Rica’s capital. It is 850 meters above sea level. It is an agricultural area where vegetables, coffee and other products are farmed; in addition, there are other activities like pig and cattle raising. Julio has been a farmer all his life but for the last 10 years he has also raised pigs. He assures us that this has always been a good source of income because the quality of his product is well recognized in the community. For now, Julio wants to obtain a microcredit in the amount of 600000 colones to buy more pigs and improve their care and infrastructure. With this loan he will reach his goal of having 50 pigs to raise so that he can take advantage of the good prices this product currently commands thereby increasing sales and improving his economic conditions. Julio is a member of Bancruce communal bank one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 1st loan and he assures us that it will be of great benefit for his business; he hopes to continue participating more actively with his communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Martha María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Luz y Vida está ubicado en la comunidad  El Aguacate en el sector Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy reconocida por la belleza natural, sus construcciones mezcla de lo moderno y lo medieval por lo que  en 1999 la UNESCO declaró a ésta ciudad como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.  Las edificaciones del centro histórico es uno de los atractivos turísticos por los elementos coloniales que ofrece como los balcones de madera tallada y hierro forjado, los adoquines de piedra, entre otros.

La señora Martha L.    tiene 36 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal engendró  tres  hijos de 15, 8 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca  y los dos pequeños en una escuela del sector,  está muy contenta ya que se encuentra en el séptimo  mes de embarazado de su cuarto hijo;  su esposo tiene un  taller de  aluminio y vidrio ubicado en su casa propia fruto de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.

Es nuestra socia hace nueve ciclos y es una mujer que trabaja junto con su esposo en el taller de aluminio y vidrio  sin dejar de lado los quehaceres de su hogar ya que tiene que estar al pendiente de sus hijos. El credito solicitado lo va a invertir en la compra de aluminio para abastecer su negocio.

Su meta es aumentar  poco a poco su taller.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luz y Vida is located in the community El Aguacate in the Monay sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for its natural beauty, and its mix of modern and medieval construction. This is why, in 1999, UNESCO declared this city a World Cultural Heritage of Humanity site. The buildings in the historical district are one of the tourist attractions, due to their colonial elements, offering carved wood and forged iron balconies, and the paving stones, among other things. Martha L. is 36 years old. She is married and her marriage has produced three children, aged 15, 8 and 7. Her oldest son studies in a high school in Cuenca and the two little ones are in an elementary school in the area. She is very happy to be in the seventh month of pregnancy of her fourth child. Her husband has a aluminum and glass workshop located in their home, the fruit of much work and sacrifice. She has been a member for nine cycles and she is a woman who works with her husband in the aluminum and glass workshop, without neglecting the housework, since she has to keep an eye on the children. The requested loan will be invested in purchasing aluminum to supply her business. Her goal is to grow her workshop little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase aluminum

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela R. D. O. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar con sus tres hijos D. 8, 10 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales son el mayor motivos para ella como toda madre responsable D. salir adelante y poder buscar nuevas posibilidades para aumentar sus ganancias ya que ellos dependen exclusivamente D. Blanca. Ella posee una venta D. verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado municipal D. San Jacinto, lugar en el cual ya posee 15 años D. contar con el puesto D. verduras. Ella cuenta con muy buenas ventas diarias ya que muchas personas la conocen y tienen la plena confianza D. estar adquiriendo productos D. muy buena calidad. Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que D. lunes a domingo trabaja desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta las 5 D. la tarD., contando siempre con el mayor deseo D. poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus tres pequeños hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica. Blanca solicita un préstamo a integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad y cantidad D. verduras, con el fin D. atender a más clientes, los cuales se sientan satisfechos y confiados que siempre encontrarán lo que buscan con Blanca, esto sería D. mucho beneficio ya que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y contar con más clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela R. D. O. , 43, lives in the San Salvador Department, in a home with her three children:8, 10 and 11. As a responsible mother they are her main reason for trying to get ahead, and to look for new ways to increase her income since they depend completely on her. She sells vegetables in a stand located in the municipal market of San Jacinto. She has had her stand for 15 years, and she receives good daily sales since many people know her and trust that she offers high quality products. Blanca is a hard-working woman. She works from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon, Mondays through Sundays, with the desire to offer the best to her young children. The children are in elementary school. Blanca is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a greater quantity and variety of vegetables. This way she can take care of her customers who are always satisfied and confident with what they find when they look for Blanca. This will help her a lot and allow her to increase her sales so that she can have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa T. D. Z. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San salvador. Ella posee una venta D. productos varios, tales como: jugos enlatados, sodas, dulces, juguetes plásticos, pegamentos, billetes D. lotería y saldo para recargar a celulares. Ella tiene 15 años D. experiencia como comerciante, lo que le permite conocer cuáles son los productos que más se venden en el lugar que posee su venta, la cual es en la avenida Cuscatlán, una zona con mucha afluencia D. personas y varios negocio y bancos a su alrededor. Nicolasa siempre ha trabajado al lado D. su esposo, por el bienestar D. su hogar y D. su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, el cual se decía a estudiar, ella ha sabido ser una madre muy cuidadosa con su hijo y así mismo una madre muy responsable quien trabaja a diario por su único hijo. Nicolasa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tarjetas para recargar saldo a celulares, así mismo recargas electrónicas, ya que este es un negocio muy bien remunerado, ya que posee gran demanda en la actualidad. Con esto Nicolasa alberga la esperanza D. poder contribuir más con su hogar y poder contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Nicolasa T. D. Z., 60, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department. She has a general store where she sells such items as: canned juices, soft drinks, candies, plastic toys, adhesives, lottery tickets and cellular phone recharging cards. She has 15 years experience as a merchant which permits her to know what products sell best in her location, which is Cuscatlán Avenue, an area with a lot of foot traffic with several stores and banks nearby. Nicolasa has always worked alongsiD. her husband for the good of her home and her 18-year-old son, who is a student. She has known how to be a careful mother with her son as well as a responsible mother who works daily for her only son. Nicolasa is asking for funds to buy cell phone recharging prepaid cards as well as electronic chargers because this is a very profitable business due to current very high demand. Nicolasa hopes to contribute more to her home this way and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cell phone service cards.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor de María A. G. de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 7, 11, y 15 años de edad, con los cuales reside en el pequeño pueblo de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace 7 años que Flor trabaja en su propio puesto en el cual vende productos los cuales son muy necesarios en el hogar, tales como: papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, shampoo, pasta de dientes, y así mismo productos comestibles como: sopas instantáneas, sardinas, salsas, aceite y otros más. El puesto esta ubicado en el mercado Sagrado Corazón, en la zona del centro de San Salvador, lugar al cual la mayoría de personas comprar por mayor los productos para abastecer negocios más pequeños como tiendas entre otros. La posición de su negocio es muy buena así mismo la amabilidad de Flor le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, todo por mayor para surtir a sus clientes con todo lo necesario, de esta manera Flor espera mejorar sus ventas y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es la única que vela por el bienestar de ellos.
texts.en:
Flor de María A. G. is 32 years old, and lives together with her 3 children of 7, 11 and 15 years old. They live in the small village of San Martín, located in the San Salvador department. For 7 years Flor has had her own stand where she sells necessary household goods, such as toilet paper, sanitary towels, shampoo, toothpaste, and comestibles such as instant soups, sardines, sauces, oil among other things. Her stand is located in the Sagrado Corazón market, in the central zone of San Salvador, a location where the majority of people purchase most of their products to then stock smaller shops. The business is in a very good position, and Flor's amiability means she has many customers. She is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products, mainly to provide her customers with everything they need. In this way Flor hopes to improve her sales and improve her childrens' situation, as she is the only one who looks after their well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household goods

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco V. M., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado, y vive con la señora y sus 2 hijos, de 1 y 6 años.Ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para posteriormente sembrar frijol y maíz, además para la compra de insumos. Desea darle una adecuada preparación al terreno para luego darle un buen mantenimiento a los cultivos y así lograr una mejor calidad y poder obtener un ingreso mayor cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han  brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Francisco V. M. is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children ages 1 and 6. They are his priority. He wants a loan to prepare earth to then plant beans and corn, and also to buy supplies. He wishes to prepare the earth adequately so then he can take good care of the crops and in this way achieve a better quality and be able to earn a greater income when it is harvest time. This is the first loan he is seeking from FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the opportunities provided to him. He hopes to provide his family a better quality of life in the future and a greater economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and supplies to grow crops

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia Margarita A. D. G. D. 56 años D. edad, es una madre soltera, quien vive junto a su hijo D. 9 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su madre D. 77 años D. edad. Sonia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, el cual es el único modo D. ganarse la vida, y con cuyas  ganancias deben salir adelante. La tienda esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en Ilopango,  en el departamento D. San Salvador. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea poder salir adelante con su familia, así brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida sobre todo para su pequeño hijo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando productos alimenticios como sopas instantáneas, sodas, pan, café, y así mismo productos D. primera necesidad como detergentes, jabones y otros más. Este negocio es muy importante para el sostenimiento del hogar D. Sonia por lo que es D. mucha importancia poder mejorarlo con todo lo necesario para percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia Margarita A. D. G. is 56 years old and is a single mother. She lives together with her 9 year old son, who studies, and also with her 77 year old mother. Sonia has a store where she sells grocery items, which her is only way of earning a living and improving her situation. Her shop is located in her house, in Ilopango, in the San Salvador department. Sonia is a very hard-working woman who wants to improve her family's situation, and give them a better quality of life, especially to her little son. She is seeking a loan to stock her business with items such as instant soups, sodas, bread, coffee, and other necessary household goods such as detergents, soaps, etc. This business is very important in maintaining Sonia's home and for this reason she puts great importance on improving it in every way necessary to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Delmy Maidel

texts.es: Delmy Maidel R. de 24 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y junto a su madre de 92 años de edad. Delmy posee una venta de productos varios como sandalias para niños, mujeres y hombres, shampoo, acondicionador para el cabello, crema para el cuerpo y gel para fijar el cabello, así mismo vende algunos cosméticos. Su negocio esta ubicado en Santa Tecla, perteneciente al mismo departamento en el cual reside. Delmy debe trabajar muy arduamente para poder brindarle el apoyo económico a su esposo así mismo para poder darle todo lo necesario a su madre quien necesita cuidados especiales debido a  su avanzada edad. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar sus productos, y así mismo mejorar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única opción que tiene para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de esta manera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Delmy Maidel R., 24, lives in Lourdes Colón, located in the La Libertad department. She lives together with her husband and her two children, who both study, and her 92 year old mother. Delmy has a shop that sells various products such as sandals for children, men and women, shampoo, hair conditioner, body cream and hair gel, and also sells cosmetics. Her business is located in Santa Tecla, which is in the same department where she lives. Delmy must work very hard to provide economic support to her husband, and to provide for her mother, who needs special care owing to her advanced age. Delmy is seeking a loan to be able to increase her products, and improve her sales, as this is the only option she has to help her husband with the household costs and improve their situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory such as sandals and creams

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela R. D. O. D. 38 años D. edad, posee un bazar llamado “variedades Edison”, negocio en el cual comercializa productos varios como arreglos florales, ropa zapatos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, mosquiteros, y todo tipo D. productos para hacer obsequios en ocasiones especiales. Ella vive en casa propia en el municipio D. Ilopango, junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 y 10 años D. edad, lugar en el cual también se encuentra ubicado el bazar. Sonia tiene el deseo D. poder expander su negocio, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales le generan ganancias diarias, ya que por la variedad D. productos que venD. sus clientes tienen muchas opciones, ya sea para productos D. uso personal como para regalar. Es por esto que Sonia solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. utilidades, sobretodo en esta temporada en la cual se aproxima la celebración del día del padre y del día del maestro, fechas en las cuales sus ventas aumentas ya que muchas personas incluso hacen encargos D. productos específicos, es por esto que Sonia espera contar con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas y así solventar todos sus gastos personales y darle todo lo necesario junto a su esposo a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia Estela R. D. O., 38, has a bazaar called 'variedades Edison', a business where she sells floral arrangements, clothes, shoes, hair and body creams, mosquito netting, and all sorts of products for gifts for special occasions. She lives in her own house in the Ilopango municipality, together with her husband and 2 children (8 and 10), in the same region where her bazaar is located. Sonia desires to expand her business, as she now has many customers who proviD. her daily earnings, mainly because she gives her customers a great variety of options, as her products can be used for personal use as well as presents. It's for this reason that Sonia is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products, mainly because this is the time of father's and teacher's day, dates when her sales increase and many people order specific products. Sonia wants to have everything available to proviD. a better service to her customer and increase her sales, in this way meeting all her personal costs and giving her family everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mirna Esmeralda

texts.es: Mirna Esmeralda B. D. G. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Apopa, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja junto a ella en el negocio, así mismo vive con su sobrino D. 15 años D. edad y su suegra, la cual se dedica a cuidar al joven y a ayudar con los quehaceres del hogar. Mirna se dedica a la venta D. zapatos deportivos, para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo sandalias y zapatos formales para dama. A pesar que cuenta con varios años D. tener el negocio, ella no posee una gran variedad D. zapatos, por lo que desea poder adquirir nuevos estilos y diversidad D. colores y tallas, D. manera que tenga muchas más opciones que ofrecerle a  las personas y D. esta misma forma por el hecho que el negocio esta ubicado en el Parque Bolívar, en el centro D. San Salvador, todos sus productos están a la vista D. la gran afluencia D. personas que transitan en el lugar, desea poder tener diferentes estilos D. sandalias y zapatos para captar D. esta manera mucho más la intención D. las personas; Mirna espera lograr esto por medio D. un préstamo solicitado a Integral por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero para llevar a cabo lo anterior.
texts.en:
Mirna Esmeralda B. D. G. is 37 years old, and lives in Apopa, located in the San Salvador department. She lives together with her husband who also works with her in the business. Their 15 year old nephew also lives with them, and her mother in law, who looks after the young boy and helps around the house. Mirna works selling sports shoes for men, women and children, and also sandals and formal shoes for women. Although she has had the business for several years, she doesn't have a large variety of shoes, and for this reason she wants to acquire new styles and a diversity of colours and sizes. This will mean she has greater options to offer her customers. Her business is located in Bolivar Park, in the centre of San Salvador, and all her products are seen by a large number of people who are in transit in the area. She wants to have different styles of sandals and shoes to capture the attention of more people. Mirna hopes to achieve this goal via a loan with Integral, which will help her achieve the aforementioned goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and sandals

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años.  Su actividad económica es la venta de costura, cosméticos y repostería.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 16 años con C$1,000.00 y ahora posee un bueno inventario de productos cosméticos y desodorantes.  Además, también posee telas, hilos, y materiales para elaborar vestidos incluso hace todo tipo de ropas.

Juana ha recibido 3 prestamos y ha pagado muy bien, además, quiere seguir comprando mas cosméticos y ropa ya que tiene clientes que le hace encargos.  Juana ha mejorado su nivel de vida con sus préstamos.  Tiene artículos del hogar y sobre todo ha comprado mas maquinas de coser para la elaboración de vestidos y trajes de de todo tipo.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, sells seamstress services, cosmetics and pastry. She began her business 16 years ago with a 1000 colon investment and now she has a good inventory of cosmetics and deodorants. In addition, she has fabric, thread and dressmaking materials although she makes all kinds of clothes. Juana has gotten three previous loans and has repaid very well. In addition, she wants to continue to buy more cosmetics and clothes because she has customers that place orders with her. Juana has improved her standard of living with the loans. She has acquired articles for the home but especially sewing machines for her dressmaking activities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants, fabric for dressmaking and cake-making pastry supplies.

loans.name: Lucio Salvador

texts.es: Lucio Salvador M. de 31 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador, junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad. El es un padre de familia muy responsable quien posee su negocio propio en el cual ha luchado mucho para sostenerlo, y de esta manera siempre poder aportar sin falta a su hogar. Lucio se dedica a la reparación de relojes y al mantenimiento de estos, haciendo trabajos como cambiar piezas, o cambiar la batería de estos. Así mismo comercializa brazaletes y pines para relojes, el negocio esta ubicado en el centro de San Salvador a las afueras de una comercial muy conocida, lo que le permite estar con contacto con más personas. A pesar que su negocio es pequeño logra obtener ganancias diarias las cuales son muy aceptables, es por esta razón que Lucio desea comprar diferentes tipos de brazaletes para reloj en variedad de colores y estilos, así mismo comprar más baterías y toda la herramienta necesaria para el mantenimiento y reparación de estos. Lucio solita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda lograr todo esto, teniendo el deseo de crecer en su negocio y poder contar con una vida estable y mejor.
texts.en:
Lucio Salvador M., 31, lives in San Salvador department with his wife and two children who are 7 and 9 years of age. He’s a very responsible father who owns his own business; it’s been a struggle to keep it but he always hopes to be able to support his family through it. Lucio repairs and services watches, he replaces parts and batteries, for example. He also sells watch bands and watch band springs. The business is located in downtown San Salvador outside a very well known store which exposes it to more potential customers. Despite his business being very small he manages to earn daily profits that are acceptable. For this reason, he wants to buy different kinds of watch bands in a variety of styles and colors as well as buy more watch batteries and the necessary tools to repair watches. Lucio is asking Integral for a loan that will make all the above possible wishing his business grow thereby having a more stable and better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Battery and watch repair accessories.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana del Carmen S. D. P. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por: su esposo el cual trabaja como agente metropolitano D. seguridad pública, y sus dos hijos D. 3 y 7 años D. edad. Ana tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga D. confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una D. las mejorar cualidades D. ella. Ana elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas D. vestir para vender en su casa D. habitación, donD. también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. Ana solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, Ana posee la certeza q D. esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana del Carmen S. D. P., age 39, lives in the Soyapango municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and her two children. Her husband works as a metropolitan agent in public security. Her two children are three and seven years old. Ana is a seamstress. She makes formal clothes, uniforms, and casual clothes. She is very detail oriented, and she does very good work. That allows her to have the loyalty of many customers like relatives, friends, and neighbors. Being responsible is one of her best qualities. Ana does work by order. She also makes articles of clothing to sell in her house, which is where she also does her work. Ana is requesting a loan to be able to buy fabrics of various styles and prints. She will also buy thread, needles, and everything needed to make clothes. Ana is sure that this way her business will be able to improve. She will then get greater earnings, which will be beneficial to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, and needles

loans.name: Elicia Maria

texts.es:
Elicia de 60 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, su esposo es guardia ellos tienen tres hijos de 39, 36, 33 años. 

Ella empezó desde hace tres años atrás con una maquina de coser vieja haciendo bordados, y cosiendo ropa dañada de sus clientes, por el buen trabajo que estaba desempeñando tuvo mas clientela. Ahora se ha podido comprar una maquina industrial y sus hijas le ayudan desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar Telas, hilos, cierres para su negocio, en el futuro quiere confeccionar ropa para almacenes.
texts.en:
Elicia, 60, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (part of El Suburbio inhabited mostly by retailers), Guayaquil; her husband is a security guard and they have three children who are 39, 36, and 33 years of age. Three years ago she started with an old sewing machine to do embroidery and repairing clothing for her customers. Her good work led to more customers. Now, she has managed to buy an industrial sewing machine and her daughters help her from 8am until 6pm. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and zippers; in the future she’d like to manufacture for department stores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric, thread, zippers.

loans.name: Vernan

texts.es: Vernan L. S., tiene la edad de 43 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y dos hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de herramienta. La idea es comprar herramientas para trabajar en construcción. El espera que con estas herramientas pueda realizar los trabajos con más eficiencia y rapidez.Cuenta con varios años de trabajar en construcción y tiene muy poca herramienta. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Vernan espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar el logro de sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Vernan L. S. is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children ages. He wants a loan to buy tools. His idea is to buy tools to work in construction. He hopes that with these tools he can complete his work more efficiently and quickly. He has been working in construction for a few years and has very few tools. This is the first loan he is seeking from FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the opportunities provided to him. He hopes to provide his family a better quality of life in the future and a greater economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person, and in addition to be able to complete his goals and projects.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Miriam Estela

texts.es: Miriam Estela G. Vda. D. V. D. 38 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza día con día por llevar el sustento diario y así mismo suplir todas las necesidades D. su familia, la cual esta conformada por su madre, dos hijos D. 10 y 8 años D. edad, así mismo vive junto a un sobrino 12 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes depenD. por completo del Miriam. Ella posee un pequeño bazar en su casa D. habitación, ubicada en el municipio D. Soyapango, en el cual comercializa zapatos, bolsos, carteras, cosméticos, blusas, regalos y otros productos más, así mismo con el deseo D. poder obtener mayores ingresos, cada mañana Miriam se dedica a vender estos productos D. forma ambulante por pueblos y cantones, mientras su madre se encarga D. atender el bazar en la casa. D. esta manera ambas trabajan en conjunto para lograr un bienestar en su hogar. Miriam solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar sandalias, blusas y cosméticos, ya que son estos los que más venD. tanto en su hogar como fuera D. este, así mismo comprar productos que no posee con el fin D. poder brindar un mejor servio.
texts.en:
Miriam Estela G. Vda. D. V., 38, is a very hard working woman who struggles daily to support her family composed of her mother and two children who are 10 and 8 years of age; her 12-year-old nephew also lives with her.
