All the children are students and 100% dependent on Miriam. She has a small store in her home which is in Soyapango. She sells shoes, purses, wallets, cosmetics, blouses, gift items and other products. In order to earn higher income, Miriam sells these products as an itinerant merchant in various towns and settlements while her mother tends to the home-based store; this way they work together for the good of the family. Miriam is asking for funds to buy sandals, blouses and cosmetics because these are the products that sell best both at home and in the outlying areas; she also wants to buy products that she currently doesn’t stock in order to proviD. better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, sandals and cosmetics.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto A. P., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El crédito lo quiere para comprar lechones para el engorde, él desea tener más cantidad de cerdos y así poder mejorar la calidad de la raza. Cuenta con un local para el desarrollo y engorde de los cerdos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Alberto A. P. is 53 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children. The loan that he wants is to buy piglets to fatten. He wishes to have a greater quantity of pigs and be able to improve the quality of the breed. He has a place where he develops and fattens the pigs. This is the first time he is taking out a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities they have provided. José has been working at this business of raising pigs for many years. He hopes in the future to provide a better quality of life and greater economic stability for his family and to be able to continue to grow as a person and producer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets to fatten.

loans.name: Gloria Sabina

texts.es:
La  señora Gloria C. es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida ubicado  en la comunidad El  Aguacate en el  sector  Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra  ubicada en el centro sur del país a 2.550 metros de altura sobre el nivel del mar, tiene muchos atractivos turísticos como los cuatro ríos que bañan la urbe, la arquitectura de su centro histórico y los templos donde encontramos detalles en mármol y oro.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos  que se encuentran de 9, 8, 6, y 5 años, todos sus hijos se encuentran en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en su propio taller de mecánica y  gracias al esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su propia casa.

Gloria tiene un almacén de venta de productos eléctricos junto a la empresa eléctrica, labora hace cinco años atendiendo de  8 a.m. a 6 p.m. gracias al apoyo del banco comunal del que es socia hace ocho ciclos ha logarado sacar adelante su negocio ahora con  el  nuevo comprará alambre, toma corrientes, interruptores, boquillas y más artículos eléctricos para abaster su local con todo lo necesario.

Su meta comenzar sus estudios en el colegio y obtener su título de bachiller.
texts.en:
Gloria C., 25, is a member of the “Luz y Vida” (Light & Life) communal bank located in El Aguacate, Monay zone, Cuenca. Cuenca is in the south of the country at 2550 meters above sea level. It has many tourist attractions like the four rivers that bathe the city, its downtown architecture and its churches with fine details in marble and gold. She is married and has four children who are 9, 8, 6, and 5 years of age; all are in the local school. Her husband is a mechanic and has his own shop. Thanks to the couple’s efforts, they have managed to build their own house. Gloria has an electrical supplies store located next to the electric company. She has been in operation for 5 years and is open from 8am to 6pm. Thanks to support from the communal bank she’s been a member of for 8 cycles, she has managed to stay in business. She will use the new loan to buy wire, plugs, switches, bulb holders, etc. to stock her store with everything necessary. Her goal is to go to high school and get a high school diploma.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Leti

texts.es: Leti tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años, el cual esta en edad escolar, ella tiene una pequeña bodega en casa, negocio que inicio hace ya 2 años aproximadamente lo inicio con ahorros obtenidos de los 6 años laborando como obrera de planta, ya que luego de nacer su hijo no podia seguir laborando fue asi como decidio poner su negocio propio, el cual le genera una ganancia aproximada de S/.1000 ingreso que le permite darle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida, ella solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia y poder implementar su bodega con mejores productos, ya que su sueño es tener mayor ganancia para brindarle a su hijo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Leti is 29 years old, and she has a three year old son who is school age. Leti has a small grocery story in her house. She started the business approximately two years ago. She started with savings that she got from six years of working at an industrial plant. After her son was born she could not keep working. That is how she decided to establish her own business. The business generates an income of approximately 1,000 PEN. That allows her to give her son a good quality of life. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to be able to stock her grocery store with better products. Her dream is to have greater earnings in order to give her son the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jewelie

texts.en:
Jewelie is an expert baker, with over 13 years of experience in the trade. In particular, everyone loves her gluten-free Brazilian cheese bread (“pao de quijo”), which she learned to make as a high school exchange student in Brazil.  After years of urging from friends and family, Jewelie finally decided to start a business to sell her famous bread.  To build a strong foundation for the new enterprise, Jewelie enrolled in a six-week business planning program at Mercy Corps Northwest in Portland, Oregon.

As laid out in the business plan that she developed with the help of her Mercy Corps trainer, Jewelie plans to sell the bread frozen to both wholesale and retail customers. In the meantime, she has been diligently building her network and generating buzz around the product. With a commercial lease, licenses, and a strong network in place, Jewelie now needs funds to purchase equipment (e.g., mixer, freezers, etc.), packaging, and a computer. Because its loan fund was fully deployed, Mercy Corps referred Jewelie to ACCION USA, where she was approved for a $9,000 loan. 

We at ACCION USA look forward to watching her business grow (not to mention to sample her bread!).

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.




Important Information About This Loan
Kiva realizes that access to credit is a challenge for entrepreneurs everywhere. Kiva started out as a website focused on developing-world entrepreneurs. In June 2009, Kiva began experimenting with allowing entrepreneurs in the United States to raise money on its website. If this is something you support, please feel free to fund this loan. If you have questions, including how an entrepreneur in your neighborhood might get a loan, please visit our Help Center and click on "Loans in the United States."

loans.use: To purchase equipment, packaging, and a computer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, ella comparte su vida con su esposo Emilio de 46 años y sus 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace algunos años trabaja como maestra en la escuela de una amiga, actividad que le gusta realizar por la mañanas y durante las tardes se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, de esa manera aprovecha su tiempo libre para generarse un ingreso extra a la economía de su familia. María se siente muy contenta con los trabajos que posee, ya que gracias a la escuela pudo conocer buenas amigas y colegas, quienes le hacen algún pedido de los productos que vende. En un futuro desea mejorar su negocio comprando más mercadería para tenerla en stock y así generar muchos mas ingresos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos y no defraudar a su grupo solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará material didáctico para brindar una mejor enseñanza a sus alumnos y además comprar productos de belleza para cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, and lives in her own home with her 46-year-old husband, Emilio, and her 3 children. For some years, she has been a teacher in a school run by a friend. She enjoys this activity in the morning, and afternoons she spends selling beauty products. She thus takes advantage of free time to generate extra income for her family. She is happy with the work she does. Through the school, she has met good friends and colleagues, who sometimes place orders for the products she sells. In the future, she would like to improve her business by purchasing merchandise to have in stock and thus generate more income. This is her third loan with MFP, and she commits to making payments punctually, and to not jeopardizing her group. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy educational materials to provide better teaching to her students, and also buy beauty products to respond to customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy educational materials to offer better teaching

loans.name: Damaris Carolina

texts.es:
Damaris vende ropa y calzados.  Ella ha visto una disminución en las ventas por problemas provocados por la crisis financiera.  En el pasado ella ha tenido 3 préstamos y los ha usado para ampliar su negocio.  Un día suena de construir su propia casa.

Damaris tiene 27 años.  Ella vive en El Sauce, está casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años.
texts.en:
Damaris sells clothing and shoes. She has seen a reduction in her sales due to the problems created by the financial crisis. In the past, she has had 3 loans, and has used them to expand her business. She dreams of one day building her own house. Damaris is 27 years old. She lives in El Sauce, and she is married and has a son who is 4 years old.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for business selling clothing and shoes

loans.name: Elma

texts.es: Elma tiene 59 años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con sus hijos pero son ya mayores de edad, por lo cual debe velar por si misma. A lo largo de los años se ha dedicado a diferentes oficios para poder sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente ya sin responsabilidades, se dedica a trabajos temporales y sin mucho esfuerzo, en verano vendía refrescos como la chicha morada y en invierno vende café, siendo estas bebidas ofrecidas en el exterior de su casa o de manera ambulante. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque genera sus propios ingresos y de manera cómoda y tranquila, esperando en un futuro mejorar su negocio poniendo un snack, pero sabe que le falta presupuesto, pero espera que sus hijos puedan ayudarla a concretar ese sueño. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar vasos descartables que utilizará para la venta de café, algunos muebles para brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Elma, 59, is a very hardworking woman who lives with her children, but they are now adults so she is now responsible only for herself. Over the years she has had different occupations so that she could help her family to get ahead. Now, without family responsibilities, she works part-time and does not have to work as hard. In the summer she sells drinks such as chicha morada (a corn-based beverage), and in the winter she sells coffee. She sells these drinks from the outside of her house and also on the street. She likes this work very much because she can generate her own income in a manner that is calm and tranquil. In the future she hopes to improve her business by adding snacks, but she knows that she lacks the resources to do so. She hopes that her children can help her to make this happen. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan that she requests, she wants to buy disposable cups that she will use to sell coffee, and some furniture to provide greater comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy disposable cups and furniture to provide better comfort for her customers

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal los Lideres conformado por 8 integrantes 6 mujeres y 2 varones todos los socios viven en la zona del Torno en distintos barrios como ser barrio 6 barrio, libertad, barrio Bolivia, MiraF., 27 de mayo y cuentan con negocio de venta de verduras, frutas, cosméticos, pan, y servicios como ser moto taxista, albañil trabajan con su negocio hace 4 y 5 años este banco de emprendimiento conformado por una mesa directiva.
 
El Presidente: Sr. Juan cuenta con el servicio de transporté en la comunidad del torno en la P. de moto puerto rico trabaja con nuestra institución hace 4 secuencia y es de estado civil soltero vive en la localidad de puerto rico barrio libertad con el dinero del credito realizara el arreglo de su moto.

La Secretaria: es la Sra. Maria vive en el barrio 6 de mayo y cuenta con el negocio venta de pan y venta de tarjetas telefónicas cuenta con este negocio hace 1 año, La señora es madre soltera y cuenta con 3 hijos a su poder y también es muy estricta que hace cumplir los reglamentos internos, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia en tarjetas.

La Tesorera: Sra. Elena cuenta con el negocio venta de pollitos en el mercado central el torno por las noches la Señora vive en el barrio Bolivia y cuenta con 3 hijos a su poder su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Argentina dentro de un año estará de vuelta aun así la señora a salido adelante y es una clienta antigua que esta trabajando con nosotros 3 secuencias compra de mercaderia para incremento de capital de trabajo.

Este banco de emprendimiento esperan perdurar mucho tiempo y cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas sin problemas, esta muy agardecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Lideres (leaders) community bank is made up of eight members: six women and two men. All of the members live in the Torno area in different neighborhoods such as neighborhood 6, Libertad (liberty), Bolivia, MiraF., May 27, and they have businesses selling produce, fruit, cosmetics, bread and services such as taxi and bricklayer. They have worked in their businesses for four or five years. This venture bank is made up ofr a board of directors. The president: Juan has a motorbike transportation service in the Torno community. He has worked with our institution for 4 rotations. He is single and lives in the Puerto Rico area in the Libertad neighborhood. With the money from the loan, he will fix his motorbike. The secretary: Maria lives in neighborhood 6th of May and has a business selling bread and selling phone cards. She has worked in this business for one year. She is a single mother with three children in her care. She is very strict and makes sure the rules are enforced. With the money from the loan, she will buy phone card merchandise. The treasurer: Elena has a business selling chicks in the central market in Torno at night. She lives in the Bolivia neighborhood and has three children in her care. Her husband can be found working in Argentina. Within a year, he will be returning. Elena has got ahead and is an old customer who has been working with us for three rotations. She will buy merchandise to increase her working capital. This venture bank has endured a long wait and will make their payments without problems. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided by granting them a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Diego Leonel

texts.es:
Diego esta en el negocio de compra y venta de Ganado.  El quiere usar su prestamo para la compra de vacas paridas.  El ha estado en este negocio por varios años y ha usado préstamos en el pasado para comprar más ganado y crecer el negocio.

Diego está casado, tiene 45 años de edad, y  tiene 2 hijos.  El vive en El Sauce y su meta es preparar a sus hijos que sean profesionales y que el negocio sea auto-sostenible.

En el pasado, un problema que ha afectado su negocio es el clima.
texts.en:
Diego is in the business of buying and selling livestock. He wants to use this loan to buy dairy cows. He has been in this business for a number of years, and he has used loans in the past to buy more livestock and to grow his business. Diego is married, 45 years old, and has 2 children. He lives in El Sauce and his goal is to prepare his children to become professionals, and to have his business become self-sustaining. In the past, one problem that has affected his business is the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité  La Familia se encuentra en su 1er ciclo ellas son señoras de la zona de Laurelty .
Todas ya están comenzando con una actividad que  les pueda mejorar su ingreso.
Así la señora  María comenzó con la actividad de venta de ropas y tiene mucha esperanza  ya esta  muy entusiasmada y confiada de que este trabajo dejará ganancia  para ayudar a su marido con  los gastos de la casa especialmente para la alimentación.
Solicita un préstamos para la compra de artículos que desea vendar especialmente para esta temporada fría como edredones, ,mantas de lana, camperas, busos, pantalones y otros.
Agradece  por la oportunidad que ellas tienen con el comité de mujeres ya que les facilita con el crédito que se les otorga.
texts.en:
The committee called “The Family” is in their first loan cycle. They are women from the “Laurelty” zone. They are all beginning an activity that they hope will improve their income. Mrs. Maria is starting a business selling clothes. She has a lot of hope. She is very enthusiastic and confident that this work will help her earn money to help her husband support their household. She hopes it will help with the cost of feeding their family. She is asking for this loan in order to buy articles of clothing that she would like to sell. She would especially like to buy winter clothing such as comforters, woolen blankets, jackets, sport jackets, pants, and other items. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has with the women’s committee. They facilitate the loans that are given to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothing such as comforters, woolen blankets, jackets, sport jackets, pants, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, D.  64 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en su casa que es propia.DesD. hace 8 años trabaja en la atención D. su tienda  D. comestibles, aprovechando la ubicación que tiene su casa,  en una céntrica avenida D. la ciudad. Cada día trabaja en  su tienda y su esposo la apoya en la labor; afirma que recibe mayores entradas en las fechas festivas D. su localidad. Doña Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer es por esta razón, que siempre esta al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su negocio para mantenerse activa. Disfruta D. su trabajo diario  porque le gusta atender a su clientela, es por esta razón  que continuara trabajando con la proyección D. incrementar su mercadería.Es la novena  vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y  es muy responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas  y agradece  a todas  personas que  hicieron posible el  préstamo,  pues le será   muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Teodora tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en incrementar su capital D. trabajo para adquirir más mercadería en  productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For the past 8 years she has been running a grocery store, taking advantage of the location of her house, in a centrally located avenue in the city. Every day she works in her store and her husband assists her with the work. Because of her location, she attracts a lot of customers, especially on holidays. Ms. Teodora doesn't miss a single opportunity to grow, and for that reason, she's always looking to innovate and improve her business while staying active. She enjoys working daily because she likes attending to her clients. So she will continue working with plans to increase her merchandise. This is the ninth time that she's had a loan with MFP, and she is very responsible with her monthly payments. Teodora plans to invest the money requested to increase her working capital and buy more merchandise in the most essential items.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy major quantity of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, su esposo es obrero ellos tiene un hijo de 6 meses. 

Ella empezó con el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su casa y para que su esposo tenga mas oportunidad de pasar tiempo con ellos, reubico su casa para poner un local en la parte delantera y compro víveres para el hogar. En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda muy surtida, trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener tiendas de víveres para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years-old, and lives in the Guasmo urban zone in Guayaquil with her husband (a day-worker) and 6-month old son. She started her business in order to help cover family expenses and to allow her husband to spend more time at home. She re-arranged her house so she could open a food/provisions store-front. Her store is well-stocked and offers a wide variety of products, and she works every day from 6:30am to 11:00pm. With this loan, she plans to buy notebooks and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she wants to own several similar stores so she can continue to ensure her family's financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and display cabinets for her business

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es: Paulo tiene 32 años, él vive con su esposa  Nika de 27 y su pequeña hija. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años se dedica en la venta de llantas en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Lima, a dos horas de su domicilio. Felizmente las ganancias que recibe son buenas, pues sus dotes de buen comerciante le han dado mucha ventaja en este negocio, además su carisma y experiencia  ha hecho que otorgue a sus clientes los consejos y características apropiadas para comprar llantas. Es por ello que se siente contento y tiene muchas ganas de sacar su negocio adelante pues sabe que tiene un gran futuro, además hay gran demanda en este rubro. Por lo pronto espera abastecerse de esta mercadería y de la mejor calidad. su mayor anhelo es progresar y brindar beneficios a su familia. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprar llantas en calidad variedad para sí lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Paulo is 32 years old and lives with his wife Nika, who is 27 years old, and their small daughter. They live together in their own home. For the past several years, he has sold tires in a central area within the city of Lima, two hours from his home. Thankfully, the earnings that he receives are good and his talent as a good businessman has given him a lot of advantage in this business. In addition, his personality and experience allow him to offer his clients appropriate advice on tire purchase. For this reason, he is very happy and has a great desire to help his business succeed and improve. He knows itt has a great future as there is high demand in this sector. For right now, he hopes to stock up on good quality merchandise. His main goal is to improve and bring the benefits to his family. This is his eighth loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With the loan, he will buy a variety of tires and in this way increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on quality tires to improve his sales.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Doña Olimpia es una mujer emprendedora, madres de tres hijos, desde hace varios años logro poner una pulpería que ha venido aumentando de capital como la captación de clientes. Para ella no ha sido fácil, ya que ante se dedicaba a la venta de tortilla, y que poco a poco ha logrado las mejoras con ayuda de la institución a través de los financiamientos, vende una variedad de productos de consumo diario, vende al contado, pero también da al crédito de quincena a clientes que conoce. Ya que muchas veces los clientes no pagan.
 En Tiempo de su pasado fue difícil por que no tenía la ayuda del padre de sus hijas y tenia que trabajar constante para poder alimentarlas. Hoy en día esta contenta por que la vida le ha cambiado gracias a su pequeña pulpería que como meta es agrandar cada día. Con este préstamo comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, carne entre otros productos para ofrecer un buen servicio, a si como aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores utilidades. Y poder ir ahorrando para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa que va haciendo las mejoras poco a poco.
texts.en:
Olimpia is an enterprising woman and is mother of three children. For several years, she has been running a convenience store, increasing her income and growing her customer base in the process. This has not been easy for Olimpia, as previously she sold tortillas. However, little by little and with help from the organisation and previous loans, she has been able to expand her business. Olimpia sells a variety of products for daily use. People normally pay in cash but Olimpia also allows items to be purchased on fortnightly credit only for people she knows, as on many occasions, customers do not pay. Olimpia did not have the support of her children’s father and so had to constantly work in order to take care of them. However, these days, Olimpia is happy because her life has been transformed thanks to the small shop, which she wishes to continue expanding on a daily basis. With the loan money, Olimpia plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, sweets, meat and other products in order to offer a good service to her customers, increase sales, garner better profits, and to be able to save to undertake home improvements bit-by-bit.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets, meat, etc., to increase both her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité la Esperanza esta en su segundo ciclo y se encuentran trabajando cada una en su actividad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Marylín quien posee  una mercería en su domicilio ella atiende su negocio entre  las labores de la casa .
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya le puede ayudar a  su marido quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos de forma ambulante y no posee  un ingreso suficiente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de shampoos, lencería, termos para  agua caliente, cremas  para la piel, y otros.
Agradece por la ayuda  que la Fundación con Kiva están brindado a la gente con escasos  recursos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza Group is in its second loan cycle and each member continues to work in her respective job. One of the members, Marylin, has a haberdashery in her home where she attends to customers in between undertaking her household chores. Marylin is very pleased with her business as it helps to generate income and therefore helps her husband, who has a mobile shoe selling business but whose income is not sufficient. Marylin is requesting the loan in order to buy shampoo, underwear, thermal drinking flasks, skin creams, amongst other items. She is thankful for the help the Kiva Foundation provides to people who have few financial means.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, shampoo, underwear, thermal drinking flasks, skin creams, etc.

loans.name: Isolda Adilia

texts.es:
Isolda es una mujer joven, muy emprendedora, trabajadora, se caso joven, procreo dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como electricista. Isolda ha tenido el apoyo de su mama económicamente para que sea una mujer de negocio. Desde hace años su mama emigro a España y manda remesas a su hija. Cuando inicio con un pequeño negocio de frutas, y golosinas, luego con financiamiento de Afodenic logro aumentar su inventario, su mama ayudo ahora para hacer las mejoras de la infraestructura en donde ha logrado acomodar mas su pulpería.
 Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, carnes con el objetivo de vender mas, aumentar de clientela. Contenta por que ha logrado mantener su negocio a pesar de que las ventas están bajas, pero no se deja de vender, es  por eso la necesidad de incrementar su negocio para equilibrar su economía.
texts.en:
Isolda is a very enterprising, young woman. She married when she was young and had two children. Her husband is an electrician. Isolda has had the financial support of her mother to be able to set up in business. Several years ago, her mother emigrated to Spain and sends Isolda funds. Initially, Isolda began with a small shop selling fruit and sweets. With a subsequent loan from Afodenic, Isolda was able to expand her inventory. Nowadays, her mother helps Isolda to increase her wares and expand her shop. With this loan, Isolda plans to invest in more staple grains, sweets, fizzy drinks, meat, etc. The goal is to sell more goods and increase her clientele. Isolda is happy because she has managed to keep her business going despite sales being low. However, she has not stopped selling goods. It is therefore necessary to expand her business to safeguard her earning potential.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets, fizzy drinks, meat, etc., to increase sales.

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamilette tiene 36 años por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues todo el tiempo le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a sus hijos, últimamente no ha podido surtir su negocio, pues no tiene el capital suficiente, por lo que siempre ha ofrecido una gran variedad de productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para comprar productos como vestidos, faldas, ropa interior, camisolas y pantalones. Su meta es obtener más clientes y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Yamilette is 36 years old, and it is not the first time she has received financing assistance. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of clothing, and has been in this line of business for more than 7 years. She has always enjoyed working and supporting her children. Lately, she has not been able to supply her business due to lack of capital, and she has always offered a great variety of products. She requests this loan in order to buy products such as dresses, skirts, undergarments, camisoles and pants. Her goal is to capture more customers, and to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba, de  37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años  trabaja en la venta de licores artesanales, que ella misma elabora para las festividades  que se realizan en diversas zonas aledañas a su comunidad. Antes criaba animales, pero por razones del cambio climático observo que no era adecuado para dedicarse como negocio. Y con las ganancias que obtuvo de  la venta de sus animales, y adicionado a sus propios recursos decidió  adquirir un motocarro, con el que su  esposo brinda actualmente el servicio de transporte. Elba esta planeando ampliar  su negocio y  vender productos de temporada.Es la novena vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy  responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que solicita y que  le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de cantidades de insumos para elaborar sus licores; y también para iniciar el negocio de venta de madera pues necesita un  capital inicial.
texts.en:
Elba, 37 year of age, lives with her husband and 3 children in a house they own. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling liquors that she makes herself for the various festivities that take place in the areas near her community. She previously raised animals, however, for reasons related to climate change, she decided it best not to continue with this activity as a business. With the funds saved from selling her animals, as well as additional other resources, she decided to buy a motorcar that her husband currently uses to provide transportation services. Elba plans to expand her business and sell seasonal products. This is her ninth time obtaining a loan with MFP, and she commits to being responsible with her installment payments. In addition, she thanks everyone who helped make this loan possible and states that it will help her a great deal in growing her enterprise. She plans to invest the requested funds into buying the supplies she needs to make her liquor; also, she would like to start a business selling lumber, and needs start up capital for this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making more liquor.

loans.name: Yenny Dolores

texts.es:
Yenny de 38 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es transportista, ellos tienen tres hijos de 19, 17, 9 años. 

Yenny tiene un puesto de comida en la calle de su casa, cuando lo inicio solo tenia una mesa y una cocineta para vender comida. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y tuvo la oportunidad de comprar mas mesas y sillas, desde ese tiempo trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Vende bolones(bananos con cheso y lo hace como una pelota pequeña), jugos de naranja.  Una de las dificultades es que no tiene local y su puesto de comidas esta en la calle. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina y aceites para hacer mas comidas. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
Yenny, 38 years of age, lives in an urban area of El Guasmo (part of a suburb where many retailers reside) of Guayaquil. Her husband works in transportation, and they have three children ages 19, 17, and 9. Yenny has a food stand on the street outside her house. When she started, she only had a table and kitchenette for selling her food. Little by little, her business grew, and she had the opportunity to buy more chairs and tables. Since then, she works from 6:30 until 12:00 every day. She sells bolones (bananas and cheese that she rolls up into small balls), orange juice. One of the challenges is that she doesn’t have a locale for her business, and her food sales stand is on the street. She would like to use the loan to buy flour and cooking oil to make more food. In the future, she would like to have her own proper location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and oil.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años, es separado desde hace 12 años, pero de aquella relación tiene 3 hijos, de las cuales dos de ellos están en Lima en búsqueda de un futuro mejor, mientras que la menor vive con él en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años trabaja como maestro de obras y construcción, trabajo que es muy importante para él, ya que depende de su experiencia para otros trabajos futuros. En esta labor no cuenta con el apoyo de su familia. Lo que más le agrada de su oficio es terminar la obra sin contratiempo, pues muchas veces paso malos ratos por algún retraso y eso le perjudico mucho en el pago de sus honorarios. Por eso hace las coordinaciones respectivas en los términos de contrato. La construcción es su principal fuente de ingresos, puesto que le ha generado buenas utilidades que le ayudaron a  mantener a sus hijos. Ahora espera asociarse con una de sus hijas con quien venderá ropa en un puesto dentro del mercado de su ciudad, además con el tiempo anhela instalar un negocio de venta de plásticos dentro de su vivienda, ya que lo considera muy rentable. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde todos los miembros son unidos como una familia y eso lo motiva a laborar de manera activa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios fardos de ropa principalmente polos y blusas.
texts.en:
Juan, age 53, has been separated for 12 years. He has three children from that relationship. Two of them are in Lima looking for a better future. The youngest one lives with him in his own house. For over ten years he has worked as a master builder. This work is very important to him as his future work depends upon his experience. His family does not help him with this work. What pleases him the most about his work is finishing the job without mishap. He has often experienced some bad moments due to some delay. This penalized him a lot in his fees. That is why he makes arrangements regarding the terms of the contract. Construction is his main source of income as it has generated good profits, which have helped him support his children. He now hopes to team up with one of his daughters. He will sell clothes with her at a stand inside the market in the city. In time he also wants to set up a business selling plastics in his house. He considers this to be very profitable. This is his third loan with MFP. He is happy to be working with his communal bank. All of the members are united like a family. This motivates him to work in an active manner. He will use the 2,000 PEN he is requesting to buy various bundles of clothes, which will mainly be polo shirts and blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes including polo shirts and blouses

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el centro poblado menor Lives del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, un distrito ubicado en la serranía de la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, ubicada a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde que era joven brindando servicio de carpintería, el suele confeccionar todo tipo de muebles a sus clientes y vecinos de la zona, este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante durante todo este tiempo y gracias a el se ha podido hacer cargo de su familia. En la zona el es bastante conocido y recomendado gracias a que siempre realiza sus trabajos con calidad y total responsabilidad.

Marcelino gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza y le ha trasmitido ese gusto a sus hijos que ahora trabajan con el, ellos sueñan con tener un taller a gran escala y distribuir los muebles que producen en toda la región norte del país. Marcelino desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más materiales, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Marcelino es un padre responsable y que durante toda su vida ha dado lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante. El tiene proyectado realizar mejoras en su vivienda, la cual está construida de material rústico.
texts.en:
Marcelino, age 57, lives with his wife and their children in Centro Poblado Menor Lives in the Unión Agua Blanca district. The district is located in the mountainous region of the San Miguel province in the Cajamarca region. It is four and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked providing carpentry services since he was a young man. He makes all types of furniture for his customers and neighbors in the area. This business has allowed him to get ahead during all of this time. Thanks to the business he has been able to care for his family. He is well known and recommended in the area thanks to the fact that he always does quality work and is completely responsible. Marcelino likes the work he does a lot, and he has transmitted this enjoyment to his children. They now work with him. They dream of having a shop on a large scale and of distributing the furniture they make in the entire northern region of the country. Marcelino wants to expand his business by purchasing more materials so that he can increase his production. That is why he has requested, for the first time, a loan for 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternative. This will help him achieve his objective. Marcelino is a responsible father. He has given the best of himself during his whole life in order to get his family ahead. He plans to make improvements on his house, which is made of rudimentary material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to increase production in his carpentry shop

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es:
Freddy tiene un negocio de servicio para triciclos y también vende cerdos.  El empezó criando cerdo.  Los dejaba parir, vendía la mitad y con esa ganancia le daba de comer a la otra mitad.  De esto le salió buena ganancia y luego se compro un triciclo.

Freddy ha tenido prestamos en el pasado y los ha usado para criar mas cerdos y sacar suficiente ganancia para el compro de otro triciclo.  Gracias a los préstamos, Freddy tiene mejores ingresos y tiene ayuda para sostener su familia.

Freddy tiene 24 años de edad.  El esta casado y tiene un hijo.  Su meta es mejorar su casa y la condición de vida para su familia.  También quiere llegar a tener unos seis triciclos y hacer una media granja para criar cerdos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Freddy has a business of providing tricycle service. He also sells pigs. He started breeding pigs. He let them give birth, and then sold half of them. With this income he gave food to the other half. This produced good earnings, and he then bought a tricycle. Freddy has had loans in the past. He has used them to breed more pigs and to get enough income to buy another tricycle. Thanks to the loans, Freddy has better earnings. He also has help to support his family. Freddy is 24, married, and has one child. His goal is to improve his house and his family’s living conditions. He also wants to have six tricycles and make an average size farm in order to breed the pigs in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tricycle

loans.name: Jessica Vianey

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 29 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Fuente, madre de un hijo de 4 años,  su esposo trabaja como electricista, su trabajo de ella es la costura que por muchos años a apoyado a su compañero ya que aprendió el oficio muy joven el cual cosía para ayudar a sus padres con un poco de gastos. También vende cosméticos para ayudarse más ya que abecés la costura están bajos los pedidos. Su esposo le compro una maquina mas para que se ayude mas con su trabajo en total son cinco maquinas que poco a poco le ha comprado.

 Con este financiamiento quiere comprar tela variada de colores, botones, siper, bordados para vender ropa, y poder cumplir con pedidos de los clientes ya que abecés se atrasa por no tener tela en existencia lo cual espera superar, y tener mas inventario para cumplir con la demanda. Y poder ayudar a cubrir con los gastos básicos de su hogar ya que todo ha incrementado.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young, 29 year old woman who lives in the La Fuente neighborhood (The Fountain) and is the mother of a 4 year old son. Her husband works as an electrician and her work is sewing which for many years has helped her partner, since she learned the skill while very young when she used to sew to help her parents a little bit with household expenses. She also sells cosmetics to provide more help since at times the requests for sewing are slow. Her husband bought her another sewing machine so she can help out more with her work. Little by little he has bought her 5 sewing machines in total. With this loan she wants to buy cloth of a variety of colors, buttons, zippers, and borders in order to sell clothing and meet the orders of her clients, since at times she gets behind because she does not have cloth on hand, a problem she hopes to overcome. She also wants to have more inventory to meet the demand and to be able to help cover the basic household expenses since everything has gotten more expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of cloth, buttons, and zippers to meet the orders of her clients

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina es V. desD. hace mas D. 20 años, con su marido había comenzado con la actividad D. venta D. comestibles en  un Copetín en su casa propia en el Centro D. la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo.
Como actualmente ya no pueD.  trabajar en la cocina la Sra. Marina se dedica al Alquiler D. los Salones  Comerciales que habían construidos con fruto del trabajo del entonces Copetín, en la actualidad cuentan con 3 Salones Comerciales.
El Crédito que esta Solicitando es para la Refacción D. unos D. los Salones  ya que este se esta desalquilado y se debe aprovechar antes D. volver alquilar D. manera que urgentemente se deben realizar los arreglos como  Revocar, Pintar D. Nuevo para el siguiente Locatario, por un lado y por el resto va a pagar su Impuesto Inmobiliario correspondiente al presente año.
AgraD. a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
Marina has been a widow for more than 20 years. She and her late husband started selling food and snacks from their home in central San Lorenzo. Marina is no longer able to work in the kitchen and now manages the rental of commercial space that was built with income from her first business. She currently has 3 rooms she rents out. The requested loan is to refurbish one of the rooms. It is currently vacant, and Marina wishes to take advantage of this to plaster and paint the room for the next tenant. She will also pay her property taxes with part of the loan. Marina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint, bricks, cement, whitewash, etc.

loans.name: Brillando El Sol Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Brillando El Sol” y está conformado por 16 socios pertenecientes a la comuna de Victoria, ubicada aproximadamente a 1 hora de Temuco, que es la capital regional. Sus principales negocios son la venta de plásticos, hilos y agujas, telas, manteles tejidos a crochet, ropa juvenil, joyas, cosméticos, artesanía en maderas, comida, pan amasado, confección y venta de cortinas y centro de Internet.
La socia entrevistada fue Marjorie, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, en primer lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste buzo negro. Ella vende juguetes en una vega en el centro de la ciudad, donde trabaja medio mes todos los días y sólo los días sábado, la otra mitad del mes. Invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, es decir, en  juguetes que estén de moda y los que son más vendidos siempre, como pelotas, pistolas y barbies. 
El sueño de Marjorie es tener un local propio o arrendado, ya que en la vega donde trabaja ahora no tiene un puesto establecido.
 A Marjorie le gusta de Fondo Esperanza el trabajo en grupo, ya que ha podido compartir experiencias y buenos momentos con sus compañeros. También le gusta la posibilidad de obtener sus préstamos sin muchos requisitos y la forma de pago semanal, ya que así se le hace es más liviano y fácil el pago.
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Brillando El Sol” (Shining Sun) and is made up of 16 members from the town of Victoria, located approximately 1 hour from Temuco, the region's capital. The members have retail businesses selling plastics, thread and needles, fabric, crocheted blankets, children's clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, wooden crafts, food, homemade bread, and curtains, as well as a tailor's shop and internet cafe. The member interviewed is named Marjorie, the group's secretary. In the photo she can be seen in the first row, first on the left, wearing a black sweatshirt. She sells toys in a lot in the city center; half the month she works everyday, and the other half she works only Saturdays. She will invest this loan in merchandise, the most popular toys such as soccer balls, toy guns, and Barbie dolls. Marjorie's dream is to have her own store space or rented stall, since she currently doesn't have a stand in the lot where she works. What Marjorie likes about Fondo Esperanza is working in a group. She has already been able to share experiences and good times with her group. She also likes the ability to access loans easily and the weekly repayment, which is regular and easy to remember. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise: toys

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El señor Justino V. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo comprar la computadora, ya puede realizar las impresiones de las credenciales de las escuelas que tiene contrato.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un crédito para poder comprar material y un amplificador que le esta haciendo falta para realizar mejores foto grafías.
Planea pagar este nuevo crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Justino V. is grateful for his previous loan, with which he was able to buy a computer to create student ID/credentials for schools that are his clients. He is requesting another loan to buy more materials and a photo enlarger to print better photographs. Justino plans to repay this loan with the income from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and a better photo enlarger

loans.name: Ninoska Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ninoska  Cecilia  tiene la actividad como es venta de ropa usada. Ella es casada y su esposo trabaja para ayudar a pagar los gastos del hogar. Aduce la señora que el crédito ha influido positivamente en su vida, ya que ha ido invirtiendo y ha logrado aumentar el nivel de su negocio, brindándole mayores ganancias. Algo que ha influido en el buen manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración de su negocio y a la reinversión que siempre ha realizado en el mismo. Afirma la señora, que pese a que su negocio ha crecido, ahora ha mejorado el ingreso de su familia, lo que le permite brindar mejores atenciones a sus hijos. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ninoska Cecilia has a business selling used clothing. She is married and her husband works to help pay the household expenses. She says that having access to credit has positively influenced her life, since she has been investing and has managed to increase the level of her business, providing increased earnings. With good business management and the reinvestment that she has always done, she has been able to manage her credit well. She states that even though her business has grown, she is able to provide better attention to her children because of the increased income that it brings to the family. The loan she currently requests will be used to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Florci

texts.es: Florci, de  43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de madera, que junto con su esposo, extrae con la ayuda de una sierra eléctrica. De vez en cuando compran terrenos llenos de árboles, de donde sacan su materia prima, así almacenan la madera para venderlas  a las  grandes madereras y a las fábricas de muebles. Las ventas las realizan semanalmente, y de esta manera recibe las ganancias merecidas, paralelamente a esta actividad, también cría vacas en su establo y periódicamente vende los becerros. Su deseo es continuar con la venta de madera y crecer en capital de trabajo.Es la novena oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo pues le  será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Florci tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de madera,  y en una ternera pequeña.
texts.en:
43-year old Florci lives with her husband and three children in their own house. For the last fifteen years she and her husband have sold wood which they cut up using an electric saw. From time to time they buy plots of land full of trees from which they get the wood and then store it before selling it to timber merchants and furniture manufacturers. The sales are made on a weekly basis and in this way they get their much-deserved income. In addition, Florci raises cows in her stable and periodically sells the calves. Her goal is to continue selling wood and increase working capital. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and Florci promises to be responsible with her repayments. She is grateful to all those people who make the loan possible as it will be very useful in helping her business progress. The money will be used to buy wood and a young calf.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of wood

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 59 años, vive en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, es viuda y todos sus hijos están casados, cuando su esposo murió ella invirtió sus ahorros con arroz, azúcar y bebidas para poder sustentar su hogar. 

Poco a poco con unos cuantos víveres en su casa y vendiendo a sus conocidos ella logro readecuar su casa para construir un local en la sala de su casa, ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 19h00pm todos los días en compañía de sus nietos(aparece uno en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesa, arroz, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente.
texts.en:
59-year old Alicia lives in Guasmo (part of the Guayaquil suburb in which small business owners live). She is a widow and all her children are married. When her husband died, she used their savings to buy rice, sugar, and drinks so she could earn enough money to live on. Over time by earning money selling these items to her acquaintances, she managed to alter her house, turning her living-room into a store. Now she works from 6:30 am to 7:00 pm every day with her grandchildren alongside (one of them appears in the photo). Alicia plans to use the loan to buy a table, rice, and drinks for the store. Her hope for the future is that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a table and products for her store

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 46 años, viuda y madre de 9 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos, en una casa  alquilada, asimismo posee una vivienda propia en lo alto de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Con la ayuda de sus hijos, cultiva frutas cítricas, café, cacao y demás frutos que producen en la selva, lo que más desea es la tranquilidad que le ofrece el campo, por otro lado le desagrada retirar la maleza de sus tierras ya que le resulta pesado y cuando son varios los días que necesita limpiar sus campos, al final salen perjudicados sus brazos, pero el saber que sus cosechas serán excelentes la motivan a continuar. Lleva 20 años en este oficio y gracias a la agricultura ha podido conseguir muchos bienes, como adquirir terrenos agrícolas, una casa junto a sus chacras y cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Es que desea incrementar su productividad, plantando más productos de manera alternada, asimismo implementar un vivero en donde pueda disponer plantas de café. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada de trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una máquina motorizada que le ayudará retirar la maleza de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
46-year old Julia is a widow and mother of nine children, five of whom live with her in a rented house. She also owns her own home on the hilltops around the town of Pichanaki. With help from her children, she grows citrus fruits, coffee, cocoa and other jungle fruits. She really enjoys the tranquility that country living offers. On the other hand she dislikes pulling up the weeds from her fields as it is exhausting work. When the fields need several days of such work, her arms end up being very sore, but the knowledge that the harvest will be excellent keeps her going. Julia has been doing this work for twenty years and thanks to farming, she has been able to obtain much property such as farmland and a house near to her fields, as well as educate her children. Now she wants to increase productivity by alternating different crops, and also start a nursery growing coffee plants. This is Julia’s second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is very enthusiastic about working with her community group. With the loan she will buy a motorized machine to help remove the weeds from her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motorized machine to remove weeds

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad,  casada su esposo es comerciante. Ella tiene una pulpería con varios años de administrarla, comenzó trabajando en una sastrería en donde tomo experiencia, luego comenzó con la venta de tortillas, y con ayuda de su esposo y ahorros puso la pulpería en donde vende varios productos, pero no lo suficiente es por eso la necesidad de aumentar su inventario para poder crecer, tener mejores ganancias, y así poder ir mejorando su casa, ya que donde tiene la pequeña venta es parte de la sala. Y desea ahorrar para poder hacer un local para la pulpería y así lograr tener un espacio para su familia. 
Con este financiamiento aumentara la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, productos enlatados entre otros para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Reyna is a hard-working forty-five-year-old woman who is married. Her husband is a shop keeper. She has had a pulpería (a small store in her home) for several years. She started out working in a tailor's shop where she gained experience. After that, she started selling tortillas. Then, with her husband’s help, and savings, she started the pulpería. She sells some things, but not enough, which is why she needs to increase her inventory. Increasing her inventory will help her grow and earn more and in this way make some improvements to her home since she has her small store in a corner of the living room. She would like to save so she can build a stand-alone store making more room for her family. With this loan she will buy more basic grains, sweets, sodas, dairy products, canned foods and other things to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more basic grains, sweets, sodas, dairy products, canned foods and other things to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Marcelina V. le está haciendo falta el techo de dos cuartos que están construyendo.
Desea ponerle una losa de concreto para que sea mas duradera y segura, ya que serán  una recamara para sus padres y la otra para ella. 
La señorita Marcelina V. vive con sus padres que ya son personas mayores y quiere que tenga la comodidad necesaria para que puedan estar bien en su casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja en una fabrica en el área de asistente de recursos humanos. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Jesus V. el papa de la señorita Marcelina ya que ella se encontraba su trabaja el día de la visita
texts.en:
Ms. Marcelina V.'s home doesn't have a roof over two of the bedrooms they are building. She wants to put up concrete so it will be more durable and secure since one bedroom will be for her parents and one for her. Ms. Marcelina V. lives with her parents, who are older, and wants them to be comfortable in their home. She plans to pay off the loan with income she makes from her job as a human resources assistant in a factory. The person in the picture is Mr. Jesus V., Marcelina’s dad, since she was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building concrete roof

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ever Wilder

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tembladera, el distrito con menos altitud de la región Cajamarca, pertenece a la región de Contumaza, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de verduras frente al mercado de la localidad de tembladera, el nos cuenta que el negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con un ingreso que le permitiera sustentar los gastos de su familia. Empezó vendiendo pocos productos y actualmente ya cuenta con bastante demanda, por lo que sus productos encuentran rápida acogida, ello lo pone muy contento y cada dia se esfuerza para seguir creciendo como empresario. Ever nos comenta con bastante orgullo de que gracias a las ganancias que le brinda su negocio ha podido construir su vivienda y que poco a poco esta avanzando en este proceso. 

Ever desea responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes adquiriendo mas productos, de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ever es un joven padre que da lo mejor de si por sacar a su familia adelante, en la localidad de tembladera sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ever is 28 years old and a father. He lives in the Temblandera district, along with his wife and two children. Temblandera is the lowest lying district in the Cajamarca region of Contumaza, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque. He’s been selling vegetables in front of the Temblandera marketplace for the past three years. He tells us that his business was born out of the need to earn an income to be able to support his family. He began by selling only a few items, but how he can count on a much greater demand and his products sell quickly. This makes him very happy and he works harder each day as an entrepreneur. Ever is proud to say that the income he has earned through his business has allowed him to build his home little by little. Ever would like to be able to better respond to his customers’ demands by acquiring more items and expanding his business. It’s because of this that he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,500 PEN ($350) through Edpyme Alternativa. Ever is a young father who gives his best to help move his family ahead. He is admired by his neighbors and customers and they consider him to be hard working and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables for resale

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: La señora Maria Dominga, ella tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijas, las cuales ya todas son mayores de edad y le ayudan a trabajar en el negocio. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de comida, el cual está localizado en el mercado, generalmente aquí lo que elabora principalmente son desayunos y almuerzos, a las 3 de la tarde la señora viaja a su casa a preparar el trabajo del día siguiente. Ella ya tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó en ese tiempo debido a que su mama era la que vendía tortillas y fue ella  la que empezó a vender enchiladas, tacos gallo pinto. Después el negocio pasó bajo la administración de Maria Dominga. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, arroz y granos básicos utilizados para la elaboración de comida. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un restaurante grande ubicado en un local muy bonito y que pueda expandirse más su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old. She is married and has three adult daughters who help her with her business. She sells breakfast and lunch from a location in the market. She finishes by 3:00pm and returns home to prepare for the next day. She’s been doing this for 30 years and she started because her mother used to sell tortillas, and Maria began selling enchiladas and tacos. The business eventually passed to Maria. She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn, rice, and basic grains that she uses to prepare her dishes. She has always wanted to open her own restaurant in a nice location so that she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Campanita I Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Campanita” describe que es una hada común que arregla teteras y ollas de manera servicial y sobre todo emprendedora. Describe la magia, la esperanza al solucionar problemas por medio de un sueño y, se identifican cada una de ellas por ser emprendedoras y soñadoras al mejorar la vida cotidiana de sus clientes.
Se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo. El grupo está conformado por 10.
María del Pilar O. O. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 10 años. Estudio la secundaria y es comerciante. Ella se dedica a vender antojitos mexicanos desde hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas y materia prima; así podrá ofrecer más variedad de antojitos a sus clientes y  darles un mejor servicio. La Sra. con ayuda de su madre y hermana llegan muy temprano a poner su puesto ofreciendo un desayuno rico y cordial en los portales del Centro. Se siente contenta de haber obtenido el crédito porque podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y darles a sus padres y su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 
Lucina H. A., integrante del grupo, de 48 años estudió la primaria, es casada y tiene dos hijos (una mujer y un hombre). Ella se dedica a la talabartería (vende accesorios y ropa para dama y caballero) inició su negocio hace 10 años y solicita su crédito para la compra de pantalones charros, sombreros, espuelas, accesorios de charrería en general. Sus clientes compran con gusto ya que son tratados con amabilidad y respeto, tiene precios accesibles, buena calidad y buen ambiente. Se encuentra ubicado en los portales a un costado de la Iglesia. Se nota ansiosa pues sabe que este préstamo será de utilidad para su desarrollo, quiere el crédito para mejorar la calidad de sus productos así como ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. Esta foto fue tomada en el local de la Sra. Victoria García D., integrante del grupo “Campanita”. Esta ubicado en la cabecera municipal de Villa de Tezontepec en Hidalgo. Se dedica a vender juguetes desde hace 27 años, ahora solicita el crédito para la compra de regalos, muñecos de peluche y cajitas musicales. Sus clientes son personas que desean adquirir un regalo a precio accesible, esta muy bien ubicado (en los portales del centro). Se siente feliz al solicitar su préstamo y cumplir su sueño de ampliar y surtir su negocio. Tiene 53 años, estudio la primaria, es casada pero sin dependientes, pues sus hijos ya todos trabajan.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
García D. Victoria	              Venta de juguetes y regalos 
O. O. María del Pilar	      Venta de comida
B. Juárez Bernardita Valentina   Venta de zapato por catalogo
F. Chávez Juana Noemí	      Reparación de celulares
V. V. Sara	              Venta de joyería (oro y plata)
H. A. Lucina	              Talabartería y venta de pantalón
B. A. Ana Maria	      Tienda de abarrotes
I. L. Ma. Del Pilar	      Venta de zapato por catalogo
T. V. Ma. Isabel	      Venta de artículos de piel
Ávila H. Suleyma	              Venta de dulces y comida
texts.en:
This group is named "Campanita", which is described as a common fairy who mends pots and kettles in a helpful manner and, above all, is entrepreneurial. She describes the magic, the hope is the solution to problems through a dream. Every one of them identifies with being entrepreneurial and dreaming of improving the daily life of their customers. They are located in the Hidalgo State. The group is made up of ten people. María del Pilar O. O. is the president of the group. She is 45 years old. She lives with her partner and has one child who is ten. She studied until high school and is a merchant. She has been dedicated to selling Mexican snacks for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to buy desks, chairs and basic materials. In this way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of snacks to her customers and give them better service. Maria, with the help of her mother and sister, arrives very early to attend better to her customers and give her parents and her child a better quality of life. Lucina H. A. is a member of the group. She is 48 years old and studied until elementary school. She is married and has two children (a girl and a boy). She is dedicated to saddlery (selling accessories and clothing for women and men). She began her business ten years ago and is requesting a loan to buy pants, hats, spurs and general charro (Mexican cowboy) accessories. Her customers buy with pleasure since they are treated with friendliness and respect. She has accessible prices, good quality and good ambience. She is located at the gates to the side of the church. She is anxious because she knows that this loan will be useful for her development. She wants to laon to improve the quality of her products, as well as offer a better quality of life to her children. This photo was taken at the place of Victoria G. D., a member of the Campanita group. She is located in the municipal head of Villa de Tezontepec in Hidalgo. She has been dedicated to selling toys for 27 years. Now she is requesting a loan to buy gifts, teddy bears and musical boxes. Her customers are people who wish to acquire a gift at an accessible price. She is very well located (in the gates of the center of town). She feels happy to request her loan and achieve her dream of expanding and stocking her business. She is 53 years old, studied up until elementary school, and is married but has no dependents since her children already work. The other members of the group are: García D. Victoria Sells toys and gifts O. O. María del Pilar Sells food B. Juárez Bernardita Valentina Sells catalog shoes F. Chávez Juana Noemí Repairs cell phones V. V. Sara Sells jewelry (gold and silver) H. A. Lucina Saddlery and sells pants B. A. Ana Maria Grocery store I. L. Ma. Del Pilar Sells catalog shoes T. V. Ma. Isabel Sells skincare Ávila H. Suleyma Sells sweets and food

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase desks, chairs, basic materials and riding accessories

loans.name: Raquel Francisca

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 5 años  de tener su negocio.  Aprendió el negocio de elaboración de pan y nacatamales desde que tenía 3 años.  Su papa antes tenía panadería pero fracaso y, luego, después de casarse y tener dos hijos Raquel inicio el negocio de nuevo.  Ahorra también hace y vende nacatamales.

Raquel a podido salir adelante ampliando su negocio gracias a préstamos que ella ha logrado en el pasado.

Raquel tiene 28 años de edad y vive en El Sauce.  Ella está casada y tiene 2 hijos en la escuela.  Su meta es llegar a tener una panadería grande para tener una base solida de ingreso familiar y construir un propio local para el negocio.
texts.en:
Raquel has had her business for five years. She learned to make bread and nacatamales when she was three years old. Her father owned a bakery, but it failed. After marrying and having two children, Raquel restarted the business. Now she also makes and sells nacatamales. She’s been able to expand her business and move it ahead, thanks to her previous loans. She is 28 years old and lives in El Sauce. She is married and has two children in school. Her goal is to open a large bakery in order to create a solid income base for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años trabaja en su tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en su casa. Labora todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo, paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la atención en su panadería, que es propia. Y su  esposo es el encargado de elaborar los panes para repartirlos durante  las mañanas  a todas las tiendas pequeñas de su localidad. Estos negocios le ha permitido tener una economía  sólida, en pleno progreso, por las buenas  rentas económicas que le generan. Para el futuro desea instalar una tienda mas abarrotada de productos de primera necesidad, y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.Es la octava oportunidad que  Gladys tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas; además agradece  a las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su  tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and lives with her husband and six children in her own home. She’s been running a small grocery store out of her home for the past five years and works every day with the help of her husband and children. She also has a small bakery and her husband is in charge of baking the different types of bread and delivering it every morning to all the small stores in her neighborhood. These businesses have allowed them to generate income and establish a solid economic base. In the future she would like to open a larger store that also sells primary need items in order to better serve her customers. This will be Gladys’ eighth loan through MFP and she promises to be responsible with her payments. She is grateful to those who made this loan possible. It will be very useful for her business. She will use the money to buy larger quantities of products in order to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Bernabe Trinidad

texts.es: Bernabé Trinidad tiene 50 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdo. Por lo que tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio, pues siempre ha sido una persona muy dedicada en su trabajo, pues sus inicios se dan porque anteriormente su familia se dedicaba a la venta de ganado, fue así que el adquirió experiencia además siempre se ha preocupado por sus 3 hijos que tiene a su cargo. Tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre recurren a Don Bernabé porque ofrece una muy buena calidad de productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Bernabé is 50 years old and takes care of his three children. He buys and sells hogs and has been in this business for more than ten years. He has always been very dedicated to his work and began doing this because his family has always been in the livestock business, which gave him the necessary experience. He has a large variety of regular customers because he offers them good quality. He will use the money from this loan to buy more hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs

loans.name: Littman

texts.es: Littman, es una persona ejemplar, tiene 30 años, casado con Cleofe de 26 años, con quien tiene una hija Zumey de un año, está familia vive en casa de los padres de él. Pese a su discapacidad, siempre está dispuesto a luchar por un futuro mejor, y aún mas desde que se casó, dedicándose a la agricultura y al transporte publico por medio de su carro; mientras que su esposa tiene una tienda de comestibles. De las ganancias que obtiene, son derivadas para los gastos domésticos, así como para comprar mercadería necesaria para abastecer su tienda.
