Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente se acostumbro a verlo como un hombre normal y trabajador, puesto que anteriormente lo compadecían de su incapacidad. “Todos los oficios son rentables, si trabajas con perseverancia, voluntad y decisión” afirma Littman,  quien tiene infinidad de ideas para generar otra fuentes de ingresos económicos, por lo pronto pretende comprar otro moto carro para alquilar a S/. 20.00 soles diario, asimismo se dedicará a la crianza de cuy porque cuenta con espacio disponible en su casa e incluso tiene jaulas, del mismo modo incrementará los productos en su establecimiento para agilizar sus ventas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque las personas quienes conforman su grupo siempre lo apoyan en los momentos difíciles. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Littman is an exemplary person who is thirty years old, married to Cloefe, who is 26, and with whom he has a one-year-old daughter, Zumey. They live with his parents. Despite of his disability, he is always ready to fight for a better future and even more so now that he is married. He works in farming and also uses his car to drive people around. His wife has a grocery store. They use the income they get for their household expenses like buying merchandise they need to stock their store. What he likes most about his work is that people get used to seeing him as a normal guy and a worker. They used to feel sorry for him because of his disability. “All work is profitable, if one works with perseverance, will, and dedication,” Littman says who has a million other ideas for earning more money. He is trying to buy another car to rent out at 20 soles a day. At the same time, he will raise guinea pigs because he has some space in his home and even has cages. In the same way, he will increase the products he has so he can sell more. This is his third loan with MFP and he likes working with his communal group because the people in his group always support him when things get hard. He will buy essentials to stock his shop with the two thousand soles he’s taking out.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su bodega.

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène F. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL  depuis le 14 juillet 2003 et a eu 15 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter  2 dizaines de moutons et de l’aliment pour bétail afin d’engraisser les sujets et les revendre au bout de 4 ou 5 mois au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa	 zone. Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de la vie de la famille par la nourriture et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Mbène F. is a 44-year old woman, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in Ndondol since July 14, 2003 and has had 15 good loan experiences. She raises sheep, and with her new loan she wants to purchase two dozen of sheep and animal food in order to fatten up and resell the sheep four-five months later at one of the weekly markets in her region. Her goal is to contribute to improving the life conditions of her family, especially food and clothing for her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep for her livestock business

loans.name: Enrrique De Jesus

texts.es: Enrique De Jesús tiene 46 años, el tiene 2 hijos menores que están a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de moto taxi, pues tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad para él es muy importante ofrecer un buen servicio ya que así obtiene más clientes. Por lo que su esposo también labora para ayudar a sufragar los gastos de la familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como llantas, cambio de asientos y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Enrique De Jesús, 46, has two minor children under his care. He provides mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo)transportation services; he's been in this line of work for 3 years. It's important for him to provide good service because that leads to more customers. His wife also works in order to contribute to household expenses. The funds will be used to buy raw materials like tires, replacement seats and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, car seats and other materials.

loans.name: Joffe

texts.es: Emerson, de 34 años, vive con su esposa, su hijo y su padre, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 4 años decidió generarse su propia fuente de ingresos, y empezó a ofrecer el servicio de transporte en su propia motocarro. Cada día recorre  las calles de su localidad, el trabajo que realiza es durante todo el día  y solo descansa una vez  a la semana. Dice que la labor es fuerte  y con algunos riesgos, que cada día  supera con mucha  perseverancia porque  este trabajo lo compensa con las buenas rentas económicas para su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad también  se dedica a sembrar alfalfa, para su granja de cuyes  que su esposa atiende. Su meta para el  futuro es adquirir otra movilidad más  y ampliar su granja de cuyes.Es la sétima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además  agradece  a todas las personas  que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Emerson tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Emerson, 34, lives with his wife, his son and his father in his own home. Four years ago he decided to work for himself and started to offer public transportation services using his own vehicle. Every day he roams the streets of his city offering his services all day; he only takes one day off per week. He states that it’s hard work and somewhat risky but he perseveres daily because the work compensates him with good profits for his family. In addition to this work, he also grows alfalfa to feed the guinea-pigs that his wife cares for. His goal for the future is to acquire a second vehicle and to expand the guinea-pig business. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he promises to be very responsible with his repayments; he also thanks all those people who made the loan possible because it will be very useful for the progress of his business. Emerson will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts and pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a sus hijos en casa de su familia ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito que pertenece al circuito de playas de la región y cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca, queda ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace nueve años a la venta de pescado procesado (seco – salado) en el terminal pesquero ECOPHINSA, el único terminal pesquero de la región, ella adquiere el pescado fresco en el mismo teminal y lo procesa en un local especial para luego regresar a venderlo a los comerciantes que llegan al lugar para adquirir mercadería que luego venderán en mercados de toda la región.

El negocio tiene bastante acogida en la zona, el pescado que suele procesar es la raya y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado de modo que así pueda percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da todo de si para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar a su familia, su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación, ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 25, lives with her children in her family’s home located in Santa Rosa district, a district that is part of the country’s coastal region whose economy depends primarily on fishing; it’s 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 9 years she has sold processed (dried and salted) fish at the ECOPHINSA fishing terminal, the region’s only fishing terminal. She buys fresh fish there and then has it processed at a local firm in order to sell it afterwards to merchants that come by to acquire merchandise for subsequent sale in markets throughout the region. The business is quite well received in the area. The type of fish that she usually processes is ray and, due to the long time she’s been in business, she has a good client base of regular customers. Rosa wants to expand her business buying more fish so that her profits will increase. For this reason, she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan. Rosa is a hard-working woman who has always given all of herself to have her children succeed and to support her family. Her dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her children with a good education. She has worked with us previously and has been punctual and responsible with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie N. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans et demi dans le Banc Villageois et a bénéficié 15 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure, elle a pris en location un local dans son village pour y exercer son métier de coiffeuse. Son crédit lui servira à acheter de la matière première pour la coiffure, des mèches et à payer les frais de location. Elle soutien son mari dans les différentes charges quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en:
Marie N. is 39 years old, she is married and the mother of five children. She has a seniority of seven and a half years in the Banc Villageois and has enjoyed 15 consecutive loans. She has a hairdressing salon and is renting a premise in her village to practice her trade of hairdressing. Her loan will allow her to buy the basic material for hairdressing, hair extensions and to pay the expenses from her rent. She supports her husband with the various daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her hairdressing business

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposa Victoria de 25 años y su pequeña hija en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de Pichanaki, además de tener un establecimiento alquilado. El ser una persona humana, hizo que Marlon estudie la especialidad de técnico de enfermería, es entonces que desde hace 6 años ayuda a los pobladores de su comunidad, trabajando en el área asistencial del puesto de salud de la localidad “Las Palmas”, paralelamente a esta actividad tiene un bazar de perfumería en el centro de su ciudad, que es atendido por una joven que contrato. Asimismo su esposa labora en la municipalidad distrital de Pichanaki.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender las emergencias que se suscitan en la zona  a cualquier hora del día y aunque no es del todo rentable le alcanza para vivir sin apuros, además con la ganancias que obtiene del bazar compensa para cubrir sus gastos, es por eso que cuanto antes espera vender CD´s y DVD´s para aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está agradecido por la confianza que le dieron, además  le gusta laborar con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de música en CD, películas en DVD para vender en su local.
texts.en:
Marlon, 26, lives with his wife, Victoria, 25, and his little daughter in his own home located in Pichanaki; he also has a rented locale. Being a humane person motivated Marlon to study nursing and for the last 6 years he has provided assistance to residents of his community working at the “Las Palmas” health center. In addition, he has a perfume sales stall downtown that an employee of his tends to. Also, his wife is employed by the city of Pichanaki. What he enjoys the most about his work is taking care of emergencies that arise in his area at all hours and, although not very profitable, it is enough for him to live care-free. Besides, his profits from sales help cover expenses. For this reason, he wants to start selling CDs and DVDs to increase profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he’s grateful for the trust that was placed in him. He also enjoys working with his fellow communal bank members. He will use the requested funds to buy an assortment of music CDs and movies on DVD to sell in his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy music CDs and DVDs to add to his stock inventory.

loans.name: Siga Thiuombou

texts.fr: Siga Thioumbou D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de NDONDOL  depuis le 25 juin 2002 et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu’elle a toujours bien gérés. Elle est détentrice d’une cantine où elle vend des produits laitiers, du sucre, du riz et de l’huile végétale. Elle fait parallèlement de l’embouche ovine. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 10 paires de moutons et approvisionner sa cantine. Elle participe à la nourriture et au maintien de la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Siga Thioumbou D. is a 38-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NDONDOL since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 loans, all of which she has managed well. She has a canteen where she sells dairy products, sugar, rice and vegetable oil. At the same time she has a sheep fattening activity. With her new loan she is going to buy 10 pairs of sheep and stock up her canteen. She contributes to food expenses and to covering her children's health costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment level in order to carry out her activity

loans.name: Ivania Maritza

texts.es: Ivania Maritza tiene 46 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora. Ella tiene 10 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que sus inicios no fueron muy fáciles ya que ella era madre soltera y tenía que buscara la manera de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, pues con todos los sacrificios que Ivania ha hecho ha podido salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, sombras, pintura de uñas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es continuar realizándole mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ivania Maritza, 46, has sold cosmetics for the last 15 years; she's always been a hard-working, tenacious person. She has 10 children who work independently. At the beginning, things were not very easy for her because she's a single mother and had to find ways to cover household expenses. However, all of Ivania's sacrifices have made it possible to get ahead. She will use the requested funds to buy lipsticks, eye shadows and nail polish among other things. Her wish is to continue to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Y. est âgée de 40 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 07 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a 10 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Son activité principale est l’embouche ovine et comme activité secondaire elle fait le petit commerce de haricots séchés. Avec son nouveau elle  va acheter 10 paires de moutons et 10 sacs de haricots séchés. Pour les moutons elle les engraisser pendant 4 ou 5 mois pour les vendre ensuite au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone, quant aux haricots elle les vend dans le village.
texts.en:
Khady Y., 40, is a widow and lives with her seven children. She has been a member of her Banc Villageois (borrowing group) for five years and has had 10 successive loans. Her main business is fattening sheep, and secondarily she sells dried beans. With her loan she intends to buy 10 pairs of sheep and 10 sacks of dried beans. As for the sheep, she will fatten them for 4 or 5 months and then sell them in the weekly markets in her area. She sells the beans in the village.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa F. est une femme de 56 ans, elle mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle et membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de suite de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est un agent de santé communautaire et matrone à la fois, son crédit lui permettra d’acheter des médicaments et de dispenser des soins primaires, sous le contrôle de l'infirmier de la zone, dans le village. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans les différentes tâches familiales.
texts.en:
Awa F., 56, is married and raising seven children. She has been a member of her "Banc Villageois" (borrowing group) since June 25, 2002 and has received 15 consecutive loans and never experienced any difficulty repaying them. She is both a community health agent and a midwife and her loan will allow her to buy medicines and provide primary health care, watched over by the area nurse, in the village. This work will bring in income that will allow her to help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her capacity for self-financing

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo de quince años en el distrito de Cura Mori, de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Está ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de chicha y de carne de carnero desde hace dos años, ella misma cría los animales que vende, y también prepara la chicha a base de harina de maíz y azúcar. La chicha es una bebida típica del país que viene siendo consumida por nuestros antepasados desde tiempos ancestrales, los pobladores de las zonas rurales del país creen que brinda energías para el trabajo y también la consumen en celebraciones especiales.

Ambos negocios se complementan ya que muchas veces los clientes le piden que prepare algun plato tipico a base de carnero (seco de cabrito con frejoles, por ejemplo) para acompañarlo con chicha, el buen trato de Basilia le ha hecho conocida en la zona y ya cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre acude a su vivienda para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Basilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de harina de maíz para elaborar mas chicha y también en la compra de alimento para mejorar la calidad de sus animales. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.

Ella es una mujer alegre y responsable, en la zona donde vive, sus clientes y vecinos le consideran una mujer honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Basilia, 45, lives with her 15-year-old son in Cura Mori district, Piura province, Piura region. It’s located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last two years she has sold chicha (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) and mutton; she raises the animals herself and prepares the chicha based on corn flour and sugar. Chicha is a typical beverage of the country that has been consumed by our ancestors since ancient times. Residents of rural areas of the country believe that it provides energy for work and they also consume it on special occasions. Both businesses complement each other because often customers ask her to prepare a typical, mutton-based dish (seco de cabrito with beans, for example) to enjoy with the chicha. Basilia’s good customer service has made her well-known in the area and she can count on her regular customers to come by her home to acquire her products. Basilia wants to buy more corn flour to increase her chicha production as well as buy feed to improve the quality of her animals. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan in the amount of 500 new soles that will help her reach this goal in order to increase sales and thus obtain higher profits. She is a cheerful and responsible woman. Where she lives, her customers and neighbors consider her to be an honest and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour to expand chicha (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) production and sales.

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es: José Lenin tiene José tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de ataúdes. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con esta actividad hace más de 30 años, pues tiene que mantener a sus hijos que tiene a cargo, es una persona muy honesta y humilde. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de clavos, pega, pinturas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos para continuar con esta actividad.
texts.en:
José Lenin has been an excellent Fundación client for a long time now. He has been a coffin maker for over 30 years because he has children to support. He is a very honest and humble person. He is asking for funding to buy nails, glue and paints, among other supplies. His wish is to improve his earnings so that he can continue in this occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nails, paint, glue, etc.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años, Eduarda fue levantando su negocio de tortillas y ventas.  Con la ayuda de su marido, quien le ayuda en la compra de maíz y leña, Eduarda a llegado a vender frito de cerdo y buñuelos de yuca.  Ahorra ella tiene mejor ganancia.

Eduarda va usar este préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, y cal. Ella ha tenido préstamos en el pasado y los ha usado para ampliar su negocio.

Eduarda y su familia sueñan de sacar adelante sus hijos menores.  Ella tambien tiene la meta de ampliar su negocio a la venta de cuajada
texts.en:
For the last 10 years Eduarda has built up her tortilla sales business. With her husband's help, who helps her buy corn and firewood, Eduarda has managed to also sell "frito de cerdo" (fried pork dish) and "buñuelos de yuca" (fried donut-like, manioc-based pastry); this has produced higher profits for her. Eduarda will use these funds to buy corn, firewood and lime powder. She has had previous loans that she used to expand her business. Eduarda and her family dream with getting their younger children ahead. She also has a goal of expanding her business into the sale of "cuajada" (a cheese-like dairy product).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre cien por ciento dedicado a sus labores, tiene 40 años y vive sólo en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Su trabajo consiste en preparar los injertos de palta, mango, cacao y frutas cítricas, para luego cultivarlos, de esa manera ha trabajado durante 8 años en sus propias tierras. Además no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, sin embargo cuando se trata de limpiar, aplicar abono y cosechar contrato operarios. La  agricultura le resulta bastante rentable porque vive cómodamente, además le permite ahorrar para algunos imprevistos y proyectos. Para su futuro, quiere construir su vivienda con material noble, pues a la fecha es rústico con maderas y calaminas, además desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas que lo beneficien. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y le agrada laborar de manera activa en su grupo comunal, más aún porque mensualmente puede ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita comprará ladrillos, madera y calaminas, para terminar de construir su casa a base de material noble.
texts.en:
Pedro is a man who is 100% dedicated to his work. He is 40 years old and lives alone in his own house, in the city of Pichanaki. His work consists of preparing grafts for avocado, mango, cocoa and citrus fruit trees, and then cultivating them. He has done this work for 8 years on his own land. He does not receive help from anyone, but when it is time to clear the fields, apply fertilizer or harvest his crops, he contracts hired laborers. Farming is quite profitable for him, and he lives comfortably; his work also allows him to save money for projects and unexpected expenses. For the future, he would like to rebuild his house using higher-quality materials, since it is currently quite rustic, made out of planks and corrugated sheets. He would also like to acquire more farmland, which would be advantageous for him. This is his third loan with MFP, and he enjoys working actively with his communal bank. He especially enjoys it because he is able to save money each month. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy bricks, wood and corrugated metal sheets, so he can finish building his house out of solid materials.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bricks, corrugated metal sheets and wood to finish building his house

loans.name: Diakher

texts.fr: Diakher D. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé à 100%. Elle développe diverses activités, à savoir le commerce de parfums, l’embouche ovine et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est également tresseuse. Avec son crédit elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises et acheter des mèches pour son activité de tresse. Ces activités lui procurent de revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de renforcer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Diakher D., 35, is single and has no children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of NDONDOL since June 25, 2002 and has received 15 consecutive loans which have always been reimbursed 100%. She has several businesses, selling perfume, fattening sheep, and selling cosmetics. She is also good at braiding hair. With her loan, she is going to add to her inventory and also buy hair extensions for her braiding business. These activities earn income that allows her to support herself and put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote her income-generating activities

loans.name: Amy Lèye

texts.fr: Amy Lèye D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui servira à acheter 20 moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Cette activité lui procure de revenus lui permettant de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy Lèye D. is a 39-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 consecutive loans; she has never had any problems with the repayments. She has a sheep fattening activity, and her new loan will be used to buy 20 sheep which she will fatten up and resell after four to five months. This activity procures an income which allows her to help her husband with the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 sheep to fatten

loans.name: Saida Del Carmen

texts.es: Saida Del Carmen tiene 31años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que dio inicio pues no tenia los recursos suficientes para mantener a sus 2 hijos, es así que ella busca el medio de mejorar sus ingresos, pues necesitaba proporcionarles comida. Ella ha sido una mujer responsable y luchadora. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de ropa variada. Su deseo es tener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Saida Del Carmen is 31 years old. She sells general merchandise. She started over six years ago. She did not have sufficient resources to support her two children. That is why she looked for a way to improve her earnings. She needed to feed the children. She has been a responsible and tenacious woman. The loan is to buy a variety of clothing. Her wish is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosales

texts.es: Rosales, de 32 años, vive con su esposa y su hija en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de construcción. Presta el servicio a varios clientes  que le solicitan  la construcción de sus casas echas a base de materiales como el ladrillo y cemento. Por la amplia trayectoria que tiene en la construcción tiene  prestigio, que garantiza la demanda de sus clientes, para la labor contrata la mano de obra de albañiles que lo ayudan en la construcción y siempre supervisa él mismo el desempeño del trabajo. Esta labor le ha permitido capitalizar rápidamente sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro con miras a crecer  en la calidad de su servicio y en la adquisición de nuevos clientes.Es la novena oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Rosales tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas nuevas como puntales, espátulas, maderas entre otros, que necesita;y otra  parte la destinará en apoyar un negocio de locutorio que su esposa administra.
texts.en:
Rosales, age 32, lives with his wife and daughter in his own house. For five years he has been offering construction services. He lends his service to various customers who ask for their houses to be made from a base of materials like brick and cement. He has prestige because of the great amount of experience he has in construction. That guarantees demand from his customers. He contracts bricklayers to do the work that helps in the construction. He personally supervises the performance of the work. This work has allowed him to rapidly capitalize his earnings and to improve his living conditions. Therefore, he will keep working in this field. He will look to grow in the quality of his service and to get new customers. This is his ninth loan with MFP. He promises to be very responsible making his payments. Also, he is grateful to all of the people who made this loan possible. It will be very useful to the progress of his business. Rosales plans to use the requested money to buy new tools like props, trowels, and wood, among other things that he needs. He will use another part of the loan to help with the call center business that his wife runs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou MABYE est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de suite de crédit et a toujours régulièrement remboursé. Elle est vendeuse de jus de fruits qu’elle fabrique de ses propres mains et revend en faisant du porte à porte. Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son  activité elle parvient à soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Seynabou MABYE is 56 years old, married and mother to four children who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 consecutive loans which she has always repaid regularly. She is a vendor of fruit juice which she makes herself and sells on a door-to-door basis. With the profits she makes from her activity she manages to help her husband cover the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou D. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Depuis le 25 février 2005 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL  et a reçu 10 fois de suite de crédit qu’elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé fidèlement. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son crédit lui permettra d’acheter 20 moutons et de l’aliment de bétail. Elle engraisse les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui permet de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Seynabou D. is a 36-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NDONDOL since 25th February 2005 and has had 10 consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid on time. She has a sheep fattening activity, and her loan will allow her to buy 20 sheep and food for them. She fattens up the animals for at least four months to resell them in the weekly markets in her town. This activity allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her self-financing capacity and buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chepén,  perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de toda clase de productos, comida y jugos en un kiosko instalado en la salida de la ciudad de Chepén, frente al paradero de los vehículos que van a la ciudad de Chiclayo, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida y lo que principalmente ofrece son productos comerstibles a los pasajeros que frecuentan el lugar. Debido al buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara los alimentos su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya cuenta con una clientela fiel.

Clara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos comestibles envasados, así como también en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de platos de comida, para llegar a su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Clara es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, sus clientes y conocidos le consideran una persona honrada y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Clara is a 46 year old woman who lives with her two children in the Chepen district within the province of Chepen in the Libertad region, about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past five years she has been selling all types of food products as well as juices in the city of Chepen, out of a kiosk located in front of a rest area for cars on their way to Chiclayo. Her business does quite well as she mainly offers food products to the passengers who frequent the stop. Since she treats her clients well and prepares excellent dishes, her business has grown steadily and she now has a faithful group of clients.

Clara wishes to expand her business through the purchase of more prepared foods as well as staple ingredients to prepare dishes from scratch. In order to achieve her goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles (PEN). This is her first request for a loan.

Clara is a happy and hard-working woman. Her clients and acquaintances consider her an honest person and say she always helps those who need her.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepared food products and basic ingredents to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene mucha experiencia con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues además tiene su pequeña pulpería, es así que le proporciona a su hijo lo necesario. Por lo que además tiene mucha competencia, por eso necesita comprar productos más variados. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. Siempre sueña con establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa has lots of experience with financing. She’s been running a small general store for more than 4 years, allowing her to support her son. She has lots of competition, so she needs to buy a greater variety of merchandise. This loan will provide her with working capital. She hopes to open a full store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yagou

texts.fr: Yagou S. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches et parents. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 février 2005 et 10 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours bien remboursé ses prêts. Ses activités sont très diversifiées, elle vend du mil, des haricots séchés, de l’huile de palme, des jus de fruits naturels qu’elle fabrique et fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Son crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises et d’acheter 6 moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle soutien beaucoup son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Yagou S. is a 52-year old woman who is married and mother to nine children; she is also guardian to three other children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th February 2005 and has had ten consecutive loans, which she has always repaid on time. Her activities are very diversified: she sells millet, dried beans, palm oil and natural fruit juices which she makes, and she also has a sheep fattening activity. Her loan will allow her to stock up on goods and to buy six sheep, which she will fatten up and resell after four to five months. She helps out her husband significantly in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene una venta de arroz, jugos, gaseosas, golosinos, etc.  Ella inicio en el negocio cuando el salario de su marido no le ajustaba parra los gastos de la casa.  Fue entonces que tuvo que poner el negocio.

Carmen ha recibido préstamos en el pasado.  Estos préstamos le han ayudado a mantener su negocio, sus clientes, y al fin, estabilidad económica.

Carmen tiene 45 años de edad y vive en Leon.  Ella tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Because her husband's salary was insufficient to cover household expenses, Carmen needed to set up a business of her own. She sells rice, juices, soft-drinks, sweets, etc. Carmen has gotten loans previously that have helped her keep her business afloat, retain her customers and maintain economic stability. Carmen is 45 years old and lives in Leon. She has two children who are university students.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, sweets, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est  âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de crédit. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine, une activité pour laquelle elle est très expérimentée pour l’avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter 10 paires de moutons et de l’aliment de bétail pour engraisser les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois et les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Participe beaucoup à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par l’achat de la nourriture et de vêtements pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is 39 years old, married and the caring mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank and has made 15 loans since June 25, 2002. Sokhna has developed extensive experience raising her sheep over the past five years. With this latest loan she would like to buy 10 head of sheep and feed to fatten her animals over the next four months. She will then sell her sheep at the local markets in her area. Sokhna works hard, buying food and clothing for her children and bettering her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business of raising sheep.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante, pues también la buena administración de su negocio es muy importante. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre se ha dedicado a obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella es muy tranquila con sus clientes y sus clientes asisten a su negocio porque Justina es muy cariñosa. Su deseo es invertir en una gran variedad de productos y convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos.
texts.en:
Justina has five children all of whom are employed independently. She has a grocery store that has succeeded thanks to the great effort she puts into it and the good management she gives it. She has been in this business for over 32 years; she has always worked toward earning family income. She is very calm with her customers and they come to her store because she is so affectionate. Her wish is to invest in a large variety of products and turn her grocery store into a distributorship. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kène Bougoul

texts.fr: Kène Bougoul F. est une femme âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 26 février 2006 et a reçu fois 7 de suite du crédit qu’elle a toujours bien remboursé.  Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt  lui permettra d’acheter 10 paires de moutons et de l’aliment de bétail pour engraisser les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois et  les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Les revenus générés par cette activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Kène Bougoul F. is a 38 years old married mother, bringing up 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank since February 26, 2006 and she has successfully repaid all of her 7 loans. Kène raises sheep and her latest loan will allow her to buy 10 head of sheep and enough feed for the next 4 months. She will then sell the sheep at the weekly markets in her area. The profits from her business will help her husband meet the family finances and also provide for some of her personal needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es: Maria Marlene tiene 37 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio como una forma de vida para ella ya que en ese momento no tenía un medio de ingreso para ayudarse a mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Empezó vendiendo ropa para niños, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ampliar su oferta. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Maria Marlene, 37, is a clothing merchant. She has been in this line of work for over 7 years. This became her way of life when she realized that she needed to have a source of income to support the two children she has under her care. She started out selling children's clothes but as time passed she widened her stock offerings. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène D. est âgée de 55 ans, elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. elle est membre du banc villageois de Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis le 08 janvier 2004. Elle s'active dans la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide et vend en même temps des tissus teintés communément appelés "thioub" Elle a sollicité ce prêt pour augmenter sa production et acheter plus de tissus en vue d'élargir sa clientèle. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille tout en satisfaisant ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Philomène D. is 55 years of age, married and the mother of five dependent children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Catholic Women in Vélingara since January 8, 2004. She specializes in preparing and selling peanut paste, and she also sells dyed fabrics commonly called “thioub.” She is seeking this loan in order to expand her production and to purchase more fabrics, with the goal of enlarging her customer base. Her income allows her to contribute towards the family budget while also providing for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting her business capital

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es un hombre muy responsable y luchador pues siempre está al pendiente de surtir su pulpería. Pues ya tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, por lo que ha mejorado poco a poco. Y este negocio surge como una alternativa para sufragar sus ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y galletas.
texts.en:
Abel is a responsible and tenacious man; he's always watching over his grocery store. He has been in this humble line of work for over 19 years and has worked with the Fundación for a long time; his business has been gradually improving. This business arose as an alternative way to earn funds to cover household expenses. He will use the funds to buy basic grains, detergents, sweets, natural beverages, bread and cookies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Chun L., 27, is single and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a singer, earning an income of about US $7 per day. Her brother is a waiter at a hotel, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a motorbike to commute to work and wood to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a food shop. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Tunh

texts.en: Tunh V., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises animals for an income of about US $5 per day. Her husband is both a farmer and a construction worker, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. V. is requesting a loan of US $700 to buy cows and pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy cows and pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Chok

texts.en: Chok L., 52, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She stays at home to raise piglets while her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Oy

texts.en: Oy K., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She sells snacks at home for an income of about US $6 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver in town, earning an income of US $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to buy a new motorbike for her husband, and she would like to invest the remainder in her current business of selling snacks. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for  her husband

loans.name: Leoun

texts.en: Leoun K., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She grows vegetables for an income of about US $0.60 per day. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $0.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The two children are chefs, each earning an income of US $5 per day. K. is requesting a loan of US  $1000 to buy a new motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay S., 57, is widowed and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a waitress at a food shop and raises pigs at home for an income of about $3 per day. Her daughter is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Launh

texts.en:
Launh T. is a 33-year-old resident of Kompong Cham, a province of Cambodia. She and her husband have four children. All four of the children are students and also assist with their parents' business when they are free from studying. 

Launh T. earns a living by producing and selling clay stoves for profit. She and her husband always help each other produce their many sets of stoves to sell. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait one or two weeks for their order. Launh T. is taking out her first loan for assistance in order to start building a new house. 

Launh T. and her husband appear in the photo here.

loans.use: To start building a new house

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao M., 37, is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She sells groceries and raises pigs for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her son is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to buy more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng V. L. is an old, married mother blessed with two kids, whom she cares for, as the children attend school. To help with the family’s living expenses, Seng V. L. is a professional teacher in the secondary school. She has been receiving a suitable salary to resolve the family's financial problems. Seng V. L.’s husband is a farmer. He grows different types of crops on their own farmland to earn for his responsibility for the family's daily living expenses. Seng V. L. has dug a medium pond where she wants to feed fish for extra income. Because Seng V. L. doesn’t have capital, she has decided to look for a loan to buy stock of small fish to raise.

loans.use: To buy small fish to raise.

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
Segunda N. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Andresa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of assorted vegetables in the market. Segunda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Segunda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Segunda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Segunda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Segunda from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Guljamish

texts.en: Guljamish I., 65, is a widow and lives with her three children in an apartment in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living together in their current home for 30 years. Guljamish's husband passed away 10 years ago. Guljamish operates a traditional clothing and ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) furnishing business. She has been operating her business since 1996, and has steadily expanded over the last 14 years.  Guljamish runs her sewing workshop from a rented place. She pays 30,000 MNT per month in rent. She usually manufactures hand-embroidered decorations for gers (the Mongolian nomadic housing tent), a product in especially high demand during the summer. Between 1985 and 1995 Guljamish was a seamstress in a sewing factory. She is a professional seamstress and has built a stable operation. With her business profits, Guljamish was able to pay for her three daughters' university fees through to graduation. All of them are now married and living in households of their own. Guljamish is an open and very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to create my own workplace by successfully operating my business. ” Guljimish is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more material in Taikeshken, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Gerlita's Group

texts.en:
Gerlita B. is from the village of Bunawan. She is 58 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Gerlita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Gerlita owns and operates a general store. Gerlita has been involved in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Gerlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gerlita is requesting a new loan, her 9th, of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock for the general store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
     *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for the store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros S. is from the village of D'ban. She is 54 years old, married and has an adult-aged child. Milagros owns and operates a business selling fish in the market. Milagros has been involved in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Milagros is requesting a new loan, her 4th, of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish to sell. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 30-year-old wife and mother. She has been farming for years, cultivating rice and some vegetables. Her husband, Sot, aged 32, appears in the photo. He works with her on the farm field. The couple lives with two small children who are going to school. S. is currently planting a rice crop, which she will harvest when it is mature. S. has another big farmland, on which she plans to plant crops for additional profit. Because S. doesn’t have money, she has applied for a loan to purchase many sacks of fertilizers and crop seeds to grow a better crop. She is hopefully that the loan will provide her with much income for her family and for her loan installment.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fertilizers and crop seeds to improve crop growth.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda T. is from the village of Calaran. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Hilda owns and operates a business selling pigs from her own farm. Hilda has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2009,  Hilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase feeds. Hilda is requesting her second loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa L. is from the village of Calamba. She is 46 years old, married and has adult-aged children. Melissa owns and operates an Internet cafe. Melissa has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Melissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Melissa is requesting a new loan, her 7th, of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for computers.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for computers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale.

In 2007, Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lolita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita L. P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 56 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Lolita raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. In 2007, Lolita joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers (such as manure) and seedlings. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lolita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI provides credit for its clients as well as savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto J. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 60 years old. To make a living, Loreto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Loreto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years already.

Loreto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Loreto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Loreto is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Loreto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim K. T. is 32-years-old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She lives in her own old wooden house with other family members and makes a living as a farmer. Her husband works as a requirement worker for income and also assists her on the farm. This couple is blessed with two kids who are attending school and under their care. Kim K. T. says that the current income is not adequate to support them. She would like to invest in a new business line for extra income, but she requires some money. Because Kim K. T. has no capital yet, she decided to look for assistance from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to purchase piglets to raise in a stall she built. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will build a location for distilling wine.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
40-year-old Lucy P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns & operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She dreams to succeed in all her endeavors.

Lucy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lucy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk S. and her husband appear in the photo above. This couple earns a living as local cultivators in the village. They live with two single children, while another three are now married and live separately. This rainfall, which is the season for farming a rice crop, Uk S. is lacking some materials for her farming business. Thus, she requests a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for cultivating.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for cultivating.

loans.name: Ma. Jesovie

texts.en:
Ma. Jesovie F., 39 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married to Raymundo. To earn a living, Ma. Jesovie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ma. Jesovie has been engaged in her business for over three years now.

In 2008, Ma. Jesovie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Jesovie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Jesovie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a tough woman, who has surmounted a lot of problems being a wife, mother, and businesswoman. The challenges she went through have not stopped her from improving her family's lifestyle and giving her four children a better future. Though her husband is in prison, she has not surrendered to life and accepted poverty. Instead she has gone beyond the very few opportunities offered by her poor life and there she found ASHI. 

It was in the year 2000 when Erlinda first received a loan through ASHI. She started a small “sari-sari” (convenience) store selling a small inventory of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages. As the years went on, the amounts of her loans have increased and helped her sustain and expand her business. The profits she occasionally makes from her business are such a great help for her to support the needs of her children, whose ages range from 10 to 18. She also supports the needs of her husband in prison. 

Erlinda is happy for having achieved her business. However, she still needs to have other sources of income for a back up in case her store has problems and her family needs a larger amount of financial assistance, especially for the children's education. Erlinda is requesting a larger amount to borrow to enable her to finance a transportation service which will be managed by a hired driver.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita J. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, Mariquita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She earns her income by planting rice and selling her harvest at the market. She is thankful for her business because she said it provides for her family's needs and also sustains her children's education.

Mariquita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariquita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mariquita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mariquita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C. lives in the rural Kompong Cham province, about 150 kilometers from the capital city Phnom Penh. She owns a small family house and resides with her other family members. Since 1990, she has been learning basic farming skills from her parents, which she uses to earn a living. Her younger sister, who appears in the right of the photo, is her business partner and helps with the planting of the rice and vegetable crops. Once the crops mature, they harvest and then sell them. Leng C. has a son who is unemployed, but he has construction skills. He hopes to use his skills to earn an income, but he requires some materials in order to do so. Leng C. has applied for a $1,100 loan to purchase construction materials to help her son. Leng C. is a widow and a mother blessed with six children: five are married, and one is single.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Mary Jean raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over three years already.

In 2007, Mary Jean joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Mary Jean from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to acquire piglets to fatten.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek B., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells groceries at home for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  B. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to help prepare for one of her children’s wedding party. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To help prepare one of the children's wedding party

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
37-year-old Medina C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has two school-aged children. To make a living, Medina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Medina has been engaged in her business for over eight years already.

Medina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Medina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Medina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her farm.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: Mork S., 47, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells bananas at a local market for an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her kid to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to be a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
33-year-old Mercy C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Mercy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mercy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb K., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She and her husband are tailors designing clothes for sale at home for an income of about USD 8 per day. This couple works hard everyday to generate the income for the family use. K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand the current business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Yum appears in the photograph at CREDIT's office.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy L. H., 40 years old, plants various crops in her own farmland in the village in Kompong Cham Province. Because of her business, she can help pay for her family’s expenses and further her children’s studies. She has four children, two of whom are now married and two are single. One of the children contributes about $70 a month to the family by working in a garment factory and two are laborers on a farm. Her husband, Mr. Sombat, who appears on the left in the photo, assists her on the farm. Soy L. H. is now requesting a loan of $1,100 to be used to grow potato and rice crops.

loans.use: To grow potato and rice crops.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and has two children. To make a living, Nemia owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over five years already.

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nemia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem I., 51, is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She recharges batteries at home for an income of about USD 3 per day. The four children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  I. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a new generator to charge batteries. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. I. appears in the photograph with one of her children.

loans.use: To buy a new generator to charge batteries

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells fish at a local market for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy wood to build a boat for fishing. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
